sentiment_score_definition: x <= -0.35: Bearish; -0.35 < x <= -0.15: Somewhat-Bearish; -0.15 < x < 0.15: Neutral; 0.15 <= x < 0.35: Somewhat_Bullish; x >= 0.35: Bullish
relevance_score_definition: 0 < x <= 1, with a higher score indicating higher relevance.

feed.title: Delta Air Lines Inc (NYSE:DAL) Stock Falls Despite Q4 Earnings Beat as Focus Shifts to Guidance
feed.summary: Delta Air Lines Inc (NYSE:DAL) exceeded Q4 2025 revenue and EPS expectations, reporting $16.00 billion in revenue and $1.55 adjusted EPS. Despite this earnings beat, the stock fell over 5% in pre-market trading, likely due to investor scrutiny of upcoming guidance for Q1 and full-year 2026, which may have fallen short of analyst estimates. The company also announced a significant order for 30 Boeing 787-10 Dreamliner aircraft, indicating long-term strategic investment.

feed.title: Duke Energy Corporation $DUK Shares Acquired by Sumitomo Mitsui Trust Group Inc.
feed.summary: Sumitomo Mitsui Trust Group Inc. increased its holdings in Duke Energy Corporation (NYSE:DUK) by 3.5% in the third quarter, acquiring an additional 67,092 shares. Other institutional investors like Simon Quick Advisors LLC and Farther Finance Advisors LLC also raised their stakes. Wall Street analysts have issued mixed ratings, with a consensus of "Moderate Buy" and an average price target of $136.50 for Duke Energy.

feed.title: Delta Air Lines Orders up to 60 Boeing 787 Dreamliners to Grow, Modernize Widebody Fleet
feed.summary: Delta Air Lines has placed its first direct order for up to 60 Boeing 787-10 Dreamliners to support international growth and renew its widebody fleet. This purchase includes 30 firm orders with an option for 30 more, aiming to enhance the customer experience, improve operations, and replace older, less efficient aircraft. The 787-10 offers capacity for up to 336 passengers, 25% lower fuel use, and superior passenger comfort, strengthening Delta's partnership with Boeing and supporting U.S. aerospace manufacturing jobs.

feed.title: Delta Air Lines Selects GE Aerospace GEnx Engines to Power New 787-10s
feed.summary: Delta Air Lines has chosen GE Aerospace's GEnx engines to power its new fleet of 30 Boeing 787-10 aircraft, with options for 30 more. The agreement also includes spare engines and long-term service support. This partnership, which builds on a long-standing relationship between the two companies, aims to enhance Delta's international growth plans through the GEnx engine's reliability and efficiency.

feed.title: AerCap Signs Purchase and Leaseback Agreements with Virgin Atlantic for Six New Airbus A330NEO Aircraft
feed.summary: AerCap Holdings N.V. announced purchase and leaseback agreements with Virgin Atlantic for six new Airbus A330-900 aircraft, with deliveries scheduled from Q2 2026 through Q4 2027. This deal deepens AerCap's partnership with Virgin Atlantic, supporting the airline's fleet renewal and sustainability goals with more fuel-efficient aircraft. Virgin Atlantic's CFO noted the A330neo will feature larger Premium and Upper cabins and more Retreat Suites, enhancing customer experience.

feed.title: XCF Global Evaluating Financing Alternatives to Drive Growth in SAF Platform
feed.summary: XCF Global is evaluating financing options, including potential debt financing structured with Bank of America, to support the construction of its New Rise Reno 2 facility. This expansion aligns with XCF's strategy to grow its Sustainable Aviation Fuel (SAF) production platform, capitalizing on a market projected to exceed $25 billion by 2030. The company also aims to jointly develop global distribution and marketing frameworks through a non-binding MOU with BGN INT US LLC.

feed.title: Scorpio Tankers Inc. Announces Update on its Liquidity, Outstanding Debt, and Vessel Purchase Commitments
feed.summary: Scorpio Tankers Inc. (NYSE:STNG) has provided an update on its liquidity, outstanding debt, and newbuilding vessel commitments. The company reported significant reductions in total debt and an increase in cash as of January 9, 2026, compared to September 30, 2025, largely due to recent vessel sales and debt prepayments. Scorpio Tankers also outlined future commitments for newbuilding vessels, including VLCCs, LR2s, and MRs, with deliveries scheduled through 2028.

feed.title: Earnings Flash (DAL) Delta Air Lines, Inc. Reports Q4 Revenue $16.00B, vs. FactSet Est of $14.68B
feed.summary: Delta Air Lines (DAL) reported its Q4 revenue at $16.00 billion, surpassing the FactSet estimate of $14.68 billion. The airline also announced that it expects Q1 adjusted EPS to range from $0.50 to $0.90 and full-year 2026 non-GAAP EPS between $6.50 and $7.50, against an estimated $7.28. In strategic moves, Delta ordered 30 Boeing 787-10s with options for 30 more, aligning with its positive outlook driven by premium travel demand.

feed.title: Delta Air Lines (DAL) Reports Mixed Q4 Results
feed.summary: Delta Air Lines reported an adjusted EPS of $1.55 for Q4, surpassing estimates, though revenue of $14.61 billion fell slightly below forecasts due to a government shutdown. Despite the revenue shortfall, the airline demonstrated strong financial management with a 10.1% operating margin. Looking ahead to 2026, Delta aims for a 20% year-over-year increase in earnings, driven by strong demand and continued investment in premium offerings, sustainability, and customer service.

feed.title: NextEra Energy announces date for release of fourth-quarter and full-year 2025 financial results
feed.summary: NextEra Energy (NYSE: NEE) announced it will release its fourth-quarter and full-year 2025 financial results on Tuesday, Jan. 27, 2026, before the stock market opens. The results will be accessible on the company's website, and senior management will discuss them during a live webcast at 9 a.m. ET on the same day. NextEra Energy is one of North America's largest electric power and energy infrastructure companies.

feed.title: Delta Air Lines Announces December Quarter and Full Year 2025 Financial Results
feed.summary: Delta Air Lines reported strong financial results for the December quarter and full year 2025, demonstrating industry leadership with record revenue and a double-digit return on invested capital. The company anticipates accelerating momentum into 2026, projecting a 20 percent year-over-year earnings growth and a 5 to 7 percent increase in March quarter revenue, supported by robust consumer and corporate demand. Key highlights include record revenue of $58.3 billion for the full year 2025, $4.6 billion in free cash flow, and a significant fleet expansion with an order for thirty 787-10 widebody aircraft from Boeing.

feed.title: Eco Wave Power delivers strong December output at Jaffa Port, Israel
feed.summary: Eco Wave Power Global AB reported strong wave energy production from its EWP-EDF One project at Jaffa Port in Israel during December 2025, demonstrating the system's reliability and potential for larger commercial deployments. The pilot installation operated with zero downtime since the start of 2025, generating over 2000kWh in December from moderate sea conditions. These results reinforce confidence in the company's plans for international expansion and scaling the technology to larger arrays in projects across the US, Taiwan, India, and Portugal.

feed.title: Cleantech Energy Trends; Sovereign Wealth Investment Activity; and Asian Lithium Outlook
feed.summary: This S&P Global update discusses key market insights for January 13, 2026. It highlights an anticipated slowdown in global solar installations for 2026, a significant surge in sovereign wealth fund private market deals in 2025 contrasted with a decrease in pension fund activity, and an expected softening of the Asian lithium market in Q1 2026 after a strong Q4 2025. The report also mentions upcoming webinars and outlooks on various global market trends.

feed.title: Assessing NextNRG (NXXT) Valuation After Early 2025 Revenue Growth Surges
feed.summary: NextNRG (NXXT) has announced preliminary unaudited figures for December 2025, showing 7% month-on-month revenue growth and 253% year-over-year growth to US$8.01 million. Despite a significant 67.4% decline in its 1-year total shareholder return, the stock has seen recent short-term momentum. A widely followed valuation narrative suggests NextNRG is 76.9% undervalued with a fair value of US$5.50, but another perspective highlights that its current P/S ratio of 2.7x is above the industry average, questioning if future growth can justify this premium.

feed.title: Morgan Stanley backs Daimler Truck, cuts Traton as 2026 outlook stays weak By Investing.com
feed.summary: Morgan Stanley has named Daimler Truck Holding AG as its top pick in the global truck sector, while downgrading Traton SE, due to an anticipated weak demand environment extending into 2026. The brokerage increased Daimler Truck's price target to €47 and maintained an "overweight" rating, citing its market position and shareholder return strategy. Conversely, Traton was downgraded to "underweight" with a €32 price target, facing pressures from its China factory ramp-up and tariffs, with potential benefits from infrastructure spending not expected until 2027.

feed.title: Is Brookfield Infrastructure’s Pivot Toward Data and Midstream Assets Altering The Investment Case For Brookfield Infrastructure Partners (BIP)?
feed.summary: Brookfield Infrastructure Partners' recent pivot towards data and midstream assets, coupled with its stock trading near a 52-week low, is prompting investors and analysts to reassess its investment case. While the company is actively recycling capital and planning unit repurchases, concerns about higher interest rates and refinancing risks remain. Analysts are cautiously optimistic, with upcoming Q4 2025 results expected to provide further clarity on cash flows and leverage.

feed.title: SM Energy price target lowered to $29 from $35 at RBC Capital
feed.summary: RBC Capital has cut its price target for SM Energy (NYSE:SM) from $35 to $29, while maintaining a Sector Perform rating, citing a lower oil price outlook. The energy company is currently trading near its 52-week low. This adjustment comes despite SM Energy reporting better-than-expected Q2 2025 earnings per share, though revenue missed forecasts, and follows a recent dividend declaration and KeyBanc Capital Markets' similar price target reduction related to a planned merger with Civitas.

feed.title: Why the TVA board is functioning again after 9 months of gridlock
feed.summary: The Tennessee Valley Authority (TVA) board has regained its quorum after nine months of gridlock, following the appointment and Senate confirmation of four new members nominated by former President Donald Trump. These new directors restore the board's ability to set policy, strategy, and electricity rates for the nation's largest public utility. The additions resolve the uncertainty that arose after Trump fired three Biden-appointed board members in 2025, bringing its membership from three to seven, with two seats remaining vacant.

feed.title: PACCAR Q2 Earnings Surpass Expectations, Sales Decline Y/Y
feed.summary: PACCAR Inc. (PCAR) reported Q2 2025 earnings of $1.37 per share, exceeding the Zacks Consensus Estimate of $1.28, although it was a decline from the prior year. Consolidated revenues fell to $7.51 billion from $8.77 billion year-over-year, despite certain segments like Parts and Financial Services surpassing revenue estimates. The company provided updated capital expenditure and R&D expense guidance for 2025.

feed.title: Tamboran Resources appoints Todd Abbott as new CEO By Investing.com
feed.summary: Tamboran Resources (NYSE:TBN, ASX:TBN) has announced the appointment of Todd Abbott as its new Chief Executive Officer, effective January 15, 2026. Abbott brings over 25 years of upstream oil and gas experience, having previously served as COO at Seneca Resources Company. Richard Stoneburner, the interim CEO, will remain as Chairman, as the company focuses on developing natural gas resources in Australia's Beetaloo Basin.

feed.title: Citizens Financial Group Inc. RI Has $4.66 Million Position in The Boeing Company $BA
feed.summary: Citizens Financial Group Inc. RI increased its stake in The Boeing Company (NYSE:BA) by 77.7% in the third quarter, bringing their total holdings to $4.66 million. Several other institutional investors also adjusted their positions in Boeing, which has seen positive sentiment due to increased airplane deliveries and significant defense contracts, despite negative trailing earnings. Analysts largely maintain a "Moderate Buy" consensus rating with an average target price of $235.33.

feed.title: Should You Buy Ford Stock While It's Under $15?
feed.summary: Ford stock saw a significant 42% return in 2025, outperforming the S&P 500, but its long-term performance over the past decade has lagged significantly. While Ford's F-Series remains America's top-selling truck, and its pro division shows promise with higher margins and recurring revenue, analysts express skepticism about the company's low growth, razor-thin profit margins, and sensitivity to economic downturns, making it a challenging long-term investment despite its current sub-$15 valuation.

feed.title: Kolibri Global Energy Inc. Provides Operations Update
feed.summary: Kolibri Global Energy Inc. has provided an operations update on its Tishomingo field wells in Oklahoma. The Barnes wells are showing strong oil production, with the 6-31-2H well averaging 634 BOEPD and the 6-4H well averaging 451 BOEPD over the last five days. The Velin wells, which had slower initial production due to being shut-in longer and geological complexities, are also improving. The company expects high oil percentages to lead to increased netbacks and lower decline rates, and plans to participate in upcoming investor conferences while continuing share buybacks and debt reduction.

feed.title: Volvo stock rating downgraded by Morgan Stanley despite price target hike
feed.summary: Morgan Stanley has downgraded Volvo AB (STO:VOLVB) (OTC:VLVLY) from Overweight to Equalweight, despite increasing its price target to SEK323.00 from SEK305.00. The downgrade is attributed to Volvo trading near its 52-week high, strong past performance, and limited near-term growth potential, with InvestingPro data indicating overbought conditions. Morgan Stanley revised down its FY26/FY27 estimates due to an expected slower recovery in North American truck demand, though Europe shows strength, leading to a forecast 9% revenue drop for fiscal year 2025.

feed.title: CenterPoint Energy stock rating upgraded to Outperform by BMO Capital
feed.summary: BMO Capital has upgraded CenterPoint Energy (NYSE:CNP) from Market Perform to Outperform, setting a price target of $42.00. The upgrade reflects the utility company's potential for an 8.6% earnings per share compound annual growth rate from 2025-2030 and a predicted investor preference for high-growth, low-risk companies in 2026. This positive outlook follows CenterPoint Energy's solid third-quarter 2025 earnings which exceeded analyst expectations, though revenue slightly missed projections.

feed.title: Exxon Mobil Keeps Venezuela Option Open Despite Trump Objections
feed.summary: Exxon Mobil is reportedly still interested in returning to Venezuela and plans to send a technical evaluation team, despite objections from US President Donald Trump. Trump expressed displeasure after Exxon CEO Darren Woods discussed the need for legal reforms and investment protections in Venezuela. This comes after US forces removed Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro and Trump urged American companies to invest in rebuilding the country's oil sector.

feed.title: Aviation Capital Group Orders 50 Boeing 737 MAX Jets
feed.summary: Aviation Capital Group (ACG) has placed a new order for 50 Boeing 737 MAX jets, including 25 737-8 and 25 737-10 airplanes, doubling its 737-10 order book. This acquisition brings ACG's total Boeing 737 MAX order book to 121 aircraft, making it the lessor with the largest order for the 737-10. This move is part of ACG's growth strategy to offer fuel-efficient aircraft technology and support its global customers' expansion.

feed.title: Aviation Capital Group Grows Portfolio With Order for 50 Boeing 737 MAX Aircraft
feed.summary: Aviation Capital Group (ACG) has finalized an order for 50 additional Boeing 737 MAX jets, comprising 25 737-8 and 25 737-10 variants, scheduled for delivery in 2032 and 2033. This order expands ACG's 737 MAX order book to 121 aircraft, reinforcing its commitment to fuel-efficient technology and meeting growing customer demand. The 737-10 model makes ACG the lessor with the largest backlog for Boeing's largest single-aisle jet, with all aircraft powered by LEAP-1B engines from CFM International.

feed.title: Kandi Technologies Showcases at AIMExpo 2026, Deepening Accessibility
feed.summary: Kandi Technologies Group, Inc. participated in the American International Motorcycle Expo (AIMExpo) 2026, showcasing its electric off-road vehicles and strengthening its North American channel network. The company engaged with existing dealers and new partners, formalizing collaboration agreements, and reiterating its focus on the North American market for product evolution, channel development, and localized operations. Kandi Technologies aims to enhance its industry visibility and support long-term business growth in the powersports and off-road vehicle sectors.

feed.title: Morgan Stanley rebaixa Volvo apesar de aumento no preço-alvo
feed.summary: Morgan Stanley rebaixou a Volvo AB de "acima da média" para "neutro" apesar de aumentar o preço-alvo para SEK323,00. A decisão reflete o forte desempenho recente da Volvo e o potencial limitado de força incremental a curto prazo, com a ação negociando perto da máxima de 52 semanas após um retorno de 45,53% no último ano. O Morgan Stanley reduziu as estimativas de demanda por caminhões na América do Norte para 2026/2027, embora a força do mercado europeu compense parcialmente essa queda.
feed.source: Investing.com Brasil - Finanças, Câmbio e Investimentos
feed.source_domain: Investing.com Brasil - Finanças, Câmbio e Investimentos

feed.title: Transocean Announces Contract Award and Extension Totaling $168 Million
feed.summary: Transocean announced a contract award for its Deepwater Mykonos drilling rig with bp in Brazil, valued at approximately $120 million for a 302-day campaign. Additionally, three one-well options were exercised for the Transocean Enabler in Norway, adding about $48 million in backlog and extending its commitment through September 2027. These fixtures collectively represent approximately $168 million in firm backlog for Transocean.

feed.title: NOV Stock: Why Holding for Now Is the Right Move, Not Buying
feed.summary: NOV Inc. has shown strong market momentum with a 37.9% gain over three months, outperforming peers and the broader oil and energy market due to its strategic positioning in long-term energy shifts, a record backlog, and superior free cash flow generation. However, the company faces challenges including delayed growth catalysts, a sharp decline in net income, and difficulties in the offshore wind market. Given these mixed signals, investors are advised to hold rather than buy, awaiting a more favorable entry point.

feed.title: A Look At Transocean (RIG) Valuation After New Brazil And Norway Rig Contracts
feed.summary: Transocean (RIG) recently secured new offshore rig contracts in Brazil and Norway, adding approximately $168 million to its backlog, which has put its shares in focus. Despite a 36.86% share price increase over 90 days, valuation models offer mixed signals: a narrative valuation suggests it's 2.5% overvalued, while a discounted cash flow (DCF) model indicates a 32.3% discount, implying potential undervaluation. The article highlights the company's strong backlog and revenue visibility but also points to its heavy debt load and interest costs as pressure points.

feed.title: Gary Black Cites Steve Jobs, Stephen King To Reiterate Importance Of Marketing For Tesla: 'FSD Has A Take Rate Of Just 15%…'
feed.summary: Investor Gary Black emphasized the critical need for a strong marketing strategy for Tesla (NASDAQ: TSLA), citing the low 15% adoption rate of its Full Self-Driving (FSD) technology despite advances. He referenced Steve Jobs on customer experience and Stephen King on brand value, arguing that even with great engineering and a shift towards AI, products don't sell themselves. Black believes Tesla needs to invest in brand equity and marketing to increase its intrinsic value and stay competitive.

feed.title: Ryder System, Inc. (NYSE:R) Receives Consensus Rating of "Moderate Buy" from Brokerages
feed.summary: Ryder System, Inc. (NYSE:R) has received a consensus "Moderate Buy" rating from brokerages, with an average 12-month price target of $205.67. The company recently reported Q3 EPS of $3.57, beating estimates, but revenue of $2.61 billion missed expectations, leading to guidance of $3.50-$3.70 EPS for Q4 2025 and $12.85-$13.05 for FY2025. Several analysts have recently raised their price targets for Ryder, reflecting a positive outlook despite some mixed financial results.

feed.title: Enphase Energy Begins U.S. Production of GaN-Powered IQ9N-3P Commercial Microinverters for 480V Solar Projects
feed.summary: Enphase Energy has started U.S. production of its new GaN-powered IQ9N-3P Commercial Microinverter, designed for 480V solar projects. This microinverter helps commercial solar installations meet Foreign Entity of Concern (FEOC) compliance and domestic content requirements while offering enhanced efficiency and simplified system design. Its U.S. manufacturing also makes eligible projects qualify for domestic content bonus tax credits.

feed.title: KBR and Tecnicas Reunidas lined up for US LNG EPC prize
feed.summary: KBR and Tecnicas Reunidas have been awarded a front-end engineering and design contract for the Coastal Bend LNG project in the US. This move positions them for the sought-after EPC prize in the country's liquefied natural gas sector. The article highlights the companies' involvement in a significant energy project.

feed.title: Tesla Tries A New Europe Fix: Cheaper, Longer-Range Model Y — Stock Rises Premarket
feed.summary: Tesla has introduced a new, cheaper, longer-range Model Y variant in Europe, aiming to boost demand in a region where sales have been inconsistent. This new Standard Long Range trim offers approximately 350 miles of range at a lower price point than existing premium long-range options. The move comes as Tesla faced a challenging year in much of Europe, despite strong performance in Norway.

feed.title: Energy Transfer LP (ET) Outpaces Stock Market Gains: What You Should Know
feed.summary: Energy Transfer LP (ET) stock closed up 1.12% at $17.15, outperforming the S&P 500's daily gain. The company is anticipated to report earnings of $0.36 per share, a 24.14% year-over-year growth, and revenue of $26.11 billion for the upcoming release. With a Zacks Rank of #3 (Hold) and a Forward P/E ratio of 11.04, ET appears to be an attractive investment compared to its industry.

feed.title: Ford Stock Rallies On Piper Sandler Upgrade, Plans To Launch Autonomous Driving On $30,000 EV
feed.summary: Ford shares rallied after Piper Sandler upgraded the stock to 'Overweight' with a $16 price target, citing the company's next-generation EV platform and plans to introduce autonomous driving on lower-cost EVs. Ford aims to launch "eyes-off driving technology" on a $30,000 all-electric vehicle in 2028 and is focusing on more affordable EVs following a decision to scale back on larger, less profitable electric models. The company also unveiled the new Ford AI Assistant at CES 2026.

feed.title: Devon Energy Schedules Fourth-Quarter 2025 Earnings Release and Conference Call
feed.summary: Devon Energy (NYSE: DVN) announced it will release its fourth-quarter 2025 financial results on Tuesday, February 17, after the close of U.S. markets. The company will then host a conference call on Wednesday, February 18, at 10 a.m. CDT (11 a.m. EDT) to discuss the results and answer questions from analysts and investors. Financial details and a webcast link will be available on Devon Energy's website.

feed.title: General Motors CEO Mary Barra says she still believes in electric vehicles
feed.summary: General Motors CEO Mary Barra maintains her belief in electric vehicles despite the Trump administration eliminating EV tax credits, which cost GM $6 billion. She envisions a future where robust charging infrastructure and technological advancements, like AI and Google Gemini, make EVs more appealing and affordable to consumers. GM has also relocated its global headquarters to the historic Hudson's Detroit building to better suit its collaborative business structure.

feed.title: Exxon Mobil quer visitar a Venezuela apesar da repreensão de Trump
feed.summary: Exxon Mobil maintains interest in visiting Venezuela and may send an evaluation team, despite President Trump's disapproval of CEO Darren Woods' comments regarding the need for legal changes and investment protection. The company aims to assess oil infrastructure and assets, noting that inherited debts from past expropriations are a significant obstacle to investment, while Chevron continues to operate in the region.

feed.title: Atmos Energy Corp.: The Quiet Infrastructure Giant Powering America’s Gas Future
feed.summary: Atmos Energy Corp. is positioned as a critical infrastructure giant in natural gas delivery, quietly powering daily life for millions across the US by operating and modernizing vast networks. The company's business model focuses on reliable gas supply, safety upgrades, and adaptability for a lower-carbon future, making it an investable and defensible asset despite the energy transition debates. Its strategic footprint in growth markets, pure-play focus on natural gas distribution, and long-term modernization efforts provide a competitive edge and drive shareholder value through regulated returns.

feed.title: Aviation Capital Group Orders 50 Boeing 737 MAX Jets
feed.summary: Aviation Capital Group (ACG) has placed a new order for 50 Boeing 737 MAX jets, comprising 25 737-8 and 25 737-10 airplanes, significantly expanding its order book to 121 units. This order reinforces ACG's growth strategy and commitment to fuel-efficient aircraft technology, establishing it as the lessor with the largest order book for the 737-10. Boeing's senior vice president highlights that this repeat order signifies strong confidence in the aircraft and strengthens the partnership between the two companies.

feed.title: Crescent Energy Schedules Fourth Quarter and Full Year 2025 Earnings Release and Conference Call
feed.summary: Crescent Energy (NYSE: CRGY) announced it will host a conference call and webcast on Thursday, February 26, 2026, at 10 a.m. CT to discuss its fourth quarter and full-year 2025 financial and operating results and its 2026 outlook. The company plans to release results after market close on Wednesday, February 25, 2026. The release and supplemental slides will be available on Crescent Energy's website.

feed.title: Oklo stock slips as insiders sell shares and traders reassess Meta nuclear deal
feed.summary: Oklo Inc. (OKLO) shares declined 2.7% after reports of insider share sales and a reassessment of its nuclear energy deal with Meta Platforms. While the Meta agreement to develop small modular reactors in Ohio offers long-term potential including a "multi-billion-dollar" investment and customer prepayment, traders are wary due to potential regulatory hurdles, a previous license denial, and recent insider selling by COO Caroline Cochran. The company's timeline for power generation is years away, and its success hinges on navigating permitting and site preparation.

feed.title: KEPCO opposes single-window nuclear export system
feed.summary: Korea Electric Power Corp. (KEPCO) has opposed calls for a single export window for South Korea's nuclear power projects, despite government efforts to streamline the current dual-track system with Korea Hydro & Nuclear Power (KHNP). KEPCO proposes maintaining a functional cooperation model where it handles marketing and financing, and KHNP focuses on construction. The utility also addressed an ongoing 1.4 trillion won settlement dispute with KHNP regarding the Barakah nuclear power plant, which is currently undergoing arbitration.

feed.title: Vistra Prices Private Offering of $2.250 Billion of Senior Secured Notes
feed.summary: Vistra Corp. announced the pricing of a $2.25 billion private offering of senior secured notes, consisting of $1.0 billion due 2031 at 4.700% interest and $1.250 billion due 2036 at 5.350% interest. The proceeds will fund a portion of the Cogentrix Energy acquisition, be used for general corporate purposes including debt repayment, and cover offering expenses. The notes are secured by a first-priority interest in collateral and are guaranteed by certain subsidiaries, with the offering expected to close on January 22, 2026.

feed.title: Waste Management (WM) Valuation Check After Upgrade, Dividend Hike, Buyback And New Solar Projects
feed.summary: Waste Management (WM) is gaining investor attention due to a Wall Street upgrade, a planned 14.5% dividend increase, a new US$3 billion buyback plan, and new solar projects. Despite a recent flat share price, long-term momentum is positive, and the stock is considered undervalued by Simply Wall St's narrative framework, trading below its fair value of US$247.16. However, its current P/E ratio is higher than both its fair ratio and the industry average, suggesting potential valuation tension.

feed.title: Key facts: JP Morgan Cuts XPO Price Target to $160; XPO Renews TAT Partnership
feed.summary: JP Morgan has decreased its price target for XPO (XPO) to $160.00 per share from $163.00. Additionally, XPO Inc. has extended its partnership with Truckers Against Trafficking (TAT) for the year 2026, reinforcing its dedication to combatting human trafficking in the transportation industry.

feed.title: Diana Shipping locks charter deal for ultramax with Bunge
feed.summary: Diana Shipping Inc. has secured a time charter contract with Bunge SA for its ultramax dry bulk vessel, the DSI Altair. The charter is for $14,750 per day, expected to generate approximately $5.30 million in gross revenue over the minimum period. The company's fleet currently consists of 36 dry bulk vessels, with plans to add two methanol dual-fuel kamsarmax vessels by 2028.

feed.title: Wall Street Cheers Lithium Giant Albemarle, Citing Start of New Upcycle
feed.summary: Wall Street analysts have expressed strong optimism for Albemarle Corp., the leading lithium producer, predicting a new multi-year upcycle in the lithium sector. This sentiment, driven by anticipated structural supply constraints and Albemarle's improving financials and operational execution, has led to increased price targets and a significant rally across lithium stocks. Scotiabank projects lithium carbonate equivalent prices could reach $20,000 per metric ton by 2028, underscoring a belief in a robust and sustained market inflection.

feed.title: Chevron (CVX) stock holds steady after report puts it in $22 billion Lukoil asset race
feed.summary: Chevron (CVX) stock remained steady after reports indicated it is a leading contender, paired with Quantum Capital Group, to acquire Lukoil's $22 billion overseas portfolio, which includes assets in Iraq, Azerbaijan, Kazakhstan, and European/U.S. refineries and fuel stations. The deal faces a U.S. deadline of January 17th and requires approval from the U.S. Treasury’s OFAC, which has previously blocked similar attempts. Investors are closely watching the outcome, especially given the complexities of sanctions and fluctuating oil prices, ahead of Chevron's Q4 earnings call on January 30th.

feed.title: Diamondback Energy (FANG) Reports Q4 Oil Prices Drop to $58.00/bbl
feed.summary: Diamondback Energy (FANG) reported a significant drop in Q4 oil prices to $58.00/bbl, down 9.8% from Q3, and natural gas prices also fell. Analysts anticipate adjusted earnings of $2.64/share for Q4 and $12.98/share for the full year, with the company's financial results expected on February 23. Wall Street analysts maintain a generally optimistic outlook, forecasting an average one-year price target of $178.10 for FANG, despite recent price target adjustments by some firms.

feed.title: Boeing stock climbs as FAA proposes new 737 inspections and investors eye delivery data
feed.summary: Boeing's shares climbed 2.3% as the FAA proposed new inspection rules for certain 737 Next Generation aircraft due to crack concerns. Investors are keenly awaiting Boeing's full-year delivery figures, which are crucial for gauging future earnings, especially after Airbus reported a significant lead in 2025 deliveries. The company also faces ongoing legal issues and challenges related to its 737 MAX certification.

feed.title: NorthWestern Energy to Host Year-End 2025 Financial Results Webinar
feed.summary: NorthWestern Energy Group, Inc. (Nasdaq: NWE) announced it will host an investor webinar on February 12, 2026, to discuss its financial results for the year ending December 31, 2025. The company plans to release its financial results on the evening of February 11, 2026. Interested parties can register for the webinar online, and a replay will be available.

feed.title: Evercore ISI downgrades Saia stock rating to In Line amid volume concerns By Investing.com
feed.summary: Evercore ISI has downgraded Saia Inc. (NASDAQ:SAIA) from Outperform to In Line, despite raising its price target to $367.00, citing ongoing volume challenges in the less-than-truckload (LTL) sector. The firm believes Saia's recent stock price gains require stronger volume growth and margin improvement, which are not considered likely in the near term. This decision follows mixed Q4 2025 shipping trends and concerns that 2026 targets might be too optimistic without an imminent acceleration in tonnage.

feed.title: GM Vs Ford: Which Automaker is the Better Investment for 2026?
feed.summary: This article analyzes whether General Motors (GM) or Ford (F) presents a better investment opportunity for 2026, considering their recent stock performance, EV sales, financial outlook, return on invested capital (ROIC), valuation, and dividends. While both companies outperformed expectations in 2025 and offer attractive valuations, GM shows an edge with higher ROIC, stronger earnings growth projections, and a "Strong Buy" Zacks Rank, compared to Ford's "Hold" rating.

feed.title: Seadrill cut to Sell at Citi, expecting disappointing 2026 EBITDA guidance (SDRL:NYSE)
feed.summary: Citi downgraded Seadrill (SDRL) to Sell from Neutral, setting a $32 price target, down from $35. The downgrade is based on expectations of disappointing 2026 EBITDA guidance, leading to a 5.3% drop in Seadrill's stock on Monday.

feed.title: Con Edison proposes 3-year electricity and gas rate hikes by more than 10 percent by 2028
feed.summary: Con Edison has proposed a three-year rate increase for electricity and gas, with electricity prices potentially rising over 12% and gas prices over 10% by 2028. This proposal has met strong public and political opposition in Westchester County, where local leaders argue the hikes exceed inflation and would create significant financial burdens for residents and businesses. A ConEd spokesperson emphasized the company's commitment to balancing investments for reliability with customer costs and community support.

feed.title: POTUS to Visit Ford Plant, Highlighting Company's U.S. Manufacturing Leadership
feed.summary: The article announces that the POTUS will be visiting a Ford plant. This visit is intended to highlight Ford's leadership in U.S. manufacturing. The content provided is very brief, serving primarily as a headline and confirmation of the event.

feed.title: Evercore ISI downgrades Saia stock rating to In Line amid volume concerns
feed.summary: Evercore ISI downgraded Saia Inc. (NASDAQ:SAIA) from Outperform to In Line, raising its price target to $367.00 but citing limited upside due to ongoing volume headwinds in the less-than-truckload (LTL) sector. Despite potential modest Q4 earnings upside, the firm believes Saia's recent stock rally requires stronger volume commentary and margin improvements that are unlikely. Other analysts have offered mixed reactions, with some raising price targets based on improving outlooks and others maintaining neutral or hold ratings.

feed.title: Ormat Technologies Signs 20-Year Geothermal Power Purchase Agreement with Switch
feed.summary: Ormat Technologies has signed a 20-year Power Purchase Agreement (PPA) with Switch, a data center operator, to supply approximately 13MW of renewable energy from its Salt Wells geothermal plant in Nevada. This agreement marks Ormat's first direct partnership with a data center operator and includes an option to expand the energy output with a 7MW Solar PV facility. Energy deliveries are expected to begin in early 2030, following a major upgrade to the Salt Wells plant by mid-2026, aiming to meet the growing demand for sustainable power in the data center industry.

feed.title: Alliant Energy Corporation Declares Quarterly Common Stock Dividend
feed.summary: Alliant Energy Corporation has declared a quarterly cash dividend of $0.5350 per share, payable on February 17, 2026, to shareowners of record as of January 30, 2026. The company has consistently paid dividends for 321 consecutive quarters since 1946 and is recognized as a member of the S&P 500 Dividend Aristocrats Index. Alliant Energy provides regulated energy services to approximately 1 million electric and 430,000 natural gas customers across Iowa and Wisconsin.

feed.title: EOG Resources reports $21 million net cash payments for derivatives in Q4
feed.summary: EOG Resources reported net cash payments of $21 million in Q4 2025 to settle financial commodity derivative contracts, with no cash receipts from its Brent crude-linked natural gas sales agreement expected to begin in 2027. The company detailed average commodity prices for the quarter and confirmed mark-to-market accounting for its derivatives. This disclosure follows recent positive Q3 2025 earnings results where EOG beat EPS forecasts, leading to reiterated 'Strong Buy' and 'Buy' ratings from Raymond James and UBS, respectively.

feed.title: This Midwest power company has paid dividends since 1946
feed.summary: Alliant Energy (NASDAQ: LNT) has declared a quarterly cash dividend of $0.5350 per share, payable on February 17, 2026, to shareowners of record as of January 30, 2026. The company has a long history of paying dividends, having done so for 321 consecutive quarters since 1946, and is recognized as a member of the S&P 500 Dividend Aristocrats Index. Alliant Energy provides regulated energy service to approximately 1 million electric and 430,000 natural gas customers across Iowa and Wisconsin.

feed.title: Citigroup Cuts Range Resources (NYSE:RRC) Price Target to $36.00
feed.summary: Citigroup has lowered its price target for Range Resources (NYSE:RRC) from $39.00 to $36.00, while maintaining a "neutral" rating. This adjustment implies a potential upside of 6.97% from the previous closing price, aligning with a broader "Hold" consensus among analysts with an average target of $41.95. The oil and gas exploration company recently exceeded quarterly EPS estimates but missed revenue expectations, with its stock currently trading around $33.66.

feed.title: EOG Resources reports $21 million net cash payments for derivatives in Q4
feed.summary: EOG Resources reported net cash payments of $21 million in Q4 2025 for settling financial commodity derivative contracts, with no cash receipts from its Brent-linked natural gas sales agreement. The company also disclosed average WTI crude and Henry Hub natural gas prices for the quarter, emphasizing mark-to-market accounting for derivatives and future gas sales. This comes after EOG reported strong Q3 earnings per share and recent positive analyst ratings.

feed.title: Scorpio Tankers stock maintains Buy rating at BTIG on strong market outlook By Investing.com
feed.summary: BTIG has reiterated its Buy rating and $75.00 price target for Scorpio Tankers (NYSE:STNG), citing strong market conditions and optimism for an extended cycle, with major customers securing multi-year contracts. The company's robust financial health, appealing valuation, and strategic fleet modernization efforts contribute to this positive outlook despite recent geopolitical disruptions and a downgrade from BofA Securities. Scorpio Tankers is also actively involved in fleet modernization, including charter agreements, vessel sales, and newbuilding acquisitions, alongside plans for two VLCCs.

feed.title: Expro Group Holdings N.V. Schedules Fourth Quarter and Full Year 2025 Earnings Release and Conference Call
feed.summary: Expro Group Holdings N.V. will hold a conference call on February 19, 2026, at 10:00 a.m. Central Time, to discuss its financial results for the fourth quarter and full year ended December 31, 2025. A press release with the results and presentation slides will be available on the company's investor relations website before the call. Participants can pre-register for dial-in access or listen via live webcast, with an audio replay available for two weeks.

feed.title: Snow Lake Completes Highly Successful Drill Program at the Pine Ridge Uranium Project in Wyoming
feed.summary: Snow Lake Energy has announced the completion of a highly successful drill program at its Pine Ridge Uranium Project in Wyoming, a 50/50 joint venture with Global Uranium and Enrichment Limited. The program of 114 holes confirmed widespread and continuous uranium mineralization across multiple sandstone packages in the prolific Powder River Basin. The company plans to analyze these results to prepare for the next drilling phase, noting significant assay results and potential for future in-situ recovery development.

feed.title: Alliant Energy Corporation Declares Quarterly Common Stock Dividend
feed.summary: Alliant Energy Corporation (NASDAQ: LNT) has declared a quarterly cash dividend of $0.5350 per share, payable on February 17, 2026, to shareowners of record as of January 30, 2026. The company has a history of paying dividends for 321 consecutive quarters since 1946 and is a member of the S&P 500 Dividend Aristocrats Index. Alliant Energy provides regulated energy service to approximately 1 million electric and 430,000 natural gas customers across Iowa and Wisconsin.

feed.title: EOG Resources reports $21 million net cash payments for derivatives in Q4 By Investing.com
feed.summary: EOG Resources (NYSE:EOG) reported net cash payments of $21 million in Q4 2025 for settling financial commodity derivative contracts. The company also noted no cash receipts from its Brent-linked natural gas sales agreement, which begins deliveries in January 2027. These details were part of a recent SEC filing, alongside disclosures on average crude oil and natural gas prices, mark-to-market accounting practices, and cautionary statements regarding future results.

feed.title: EOG Resources reports $21 million net cash payments for derivatives in Q4 By Investing.com
feed.summary: EOG Resources Inc. reported net cash payments of $21 million in Q4 2025 to settle financial commodity derivative contracts, with no cash receipts from its Brent-linked natural gas sales agreement expected to begin in 2027. The company utilizes mark-to-market accounting for these derivatives and its gas sales agreement. This financial update follows EOG's strong Q3 2025 earnings which exceeded EPS forecasts, leading to reiterated "Strong Buy" ratings from Raymond James and "Buy" from UBS, alongside the appointment of John D. Chandler to its Board of Directors.

feed.title: XPO, Inc downgraded to In Line at Evercore ISI downside risk to EPS estimates
feed.summary: Evercore ISI has downgraded XPO, Inc. (XPO) to "In Line" from "Outperform," lowering its price target to $148 from $151. The analyst cited potential downside risk to EPS estimates for the second half of 2026 and 2027 if sub-seasonal trends continue. The firm believes the stock's current trading at "much higher than mid-cycle multiples on ambitious 2027 forecasts" means "downside risk overwhelms upside potential."

feed.title: XPO Schedules Fourth Quarter 2025 Earnings Conference Call for Thursday, February 5, 2026
feed.summary: XPO (NYSE: XPO) has scheduled its fourth quarter 2025 earnings conference call and webcast for Thursday, February 5, 2026, at 8:30 a.m. Eastern Time. The company's financial results will be released earlier that morning and will be available on its website. Access details for the live call and webcast, as well as replay information, have been provided for interested parties.

feed.title: Workhorse Group board approves CEO compensation package including $600,000 salary
feed.summary: The Workhorse Group board of directors has approved a compensation package for CEO Scott Griffith, including an annual base salary of $600,000, retroactive to December 15, 2025. Griffith will also be eligible for a bonus opportunity of 50% of his base salary. This announcement follows the company's recent merger with Motiv Electric Trucks and a 1-for-12 reverse stock split.

feed.title: USA Compression Partners LP Completes Acquisition of J-W Power Company
feed.summary: USA Compression Partners, LP (NYSE: USAC) has successfully acquired J-W Power Company for approximately $860 million, funded by a mix of cash and common units. This acquisition significantly expands USA Compression's active horsepower by over 0.8 million, totaling 4.4 million across key regions, and enhances its customer base and market position in mid-to-large horsepower compression. The transaction is anticipated to be immediately accretive to Distributable Cash Flow and improve pro forma debt metrics, reinforcing long-term value for unitholders.

feed.title: USA Compression completes $860 million acquisition of J-W Power Company By Investing.com
feed.summary: USA Compression Partners has completed its $860 million acquisition of J-W Power Company, significantly expanding its horsepower and customer base across several regions. The deal, funded by cash and common units, is expected to improve financial metrics and provide near-term accretion on a Distributable Cash Flow basis. This strategic move follows better-than-expected third-quarter earnings and positive analyst sentiment, with the company scheduled to report next earnings on February 17, 2026.

feed.title: Blink Charging (BLNK) Shares Skyrocket, What You Need To Know
feed.summary: Shares of Blink Charging (BLNK) surged 22.2% following increased investor optimism about the EV charging infrastructure provider's expansion plans and favorable industry news. The company recently raised $20 million through a public offering to fund its fast-charging network expansion, coinciding with positive developments in the EV charging sector, including government efforts to reduce charging costs. Despite the significant jump, BLNK shares are still trading well below their 52-week high.

feed.title: Allegiant strikes $1.5 billion deal to acquire Sun Country
feed.summary: Allegiant Travel Co. has agreed to acquire Sun Country Airlines Holdings Inc. for $1.5 billion in a cash-and-stock deal, further consolidating the U.S. airline industry. The merger, which combines the ninth- and 12th-largest airlines, aims to expand their reach to more vacation destinations, including international locations, and strengthen their position against dominant carriers. Sun Country's brand will be phased out after the deal closes, subject to regulatory approval, as both budget carriers leverage their complementary networks and focus on vacation travel.

feed.title: Forum Energy Technologies appoints Leslie Beyer to board of directors By Investing.com
feed.summary: Forum Energy Technologies, Inc. (NYSE:FET) has appointed Leslie A. Beyer to its Board of Directors. Beyer, recognized for her experience in federal government and the energy sector, will also serve on the Compensation & Human Capital Committee and the Nominating, Governance & Sustainability Committee. The appointment is expected to provide valuable insights into the regulatory environment and energy expansion for the Houston-based company, which recently reported an increase in revenue and consolidated EBITDA for Q3 2025.

feed.title: Devon Energy is about to reveal its late‑2025 performance
feed.summary: Devon Energy (NYSE: DVN) announced it will report its fourth-quarter 2025 results on Tuesday, February 17, 2026, after the U.S. market closes. The company will also host a conference call for analysts and investors on Wednesday, February 18, 2026, at 10:00 a.m. CDT (11:00 a.m. EDT) to discuss the findings. All relevant materials, including the earnings release, presentation, webcast link, and a replay, will be available on Devon Energy’s website.

feed.title: Devon Energy Schedules Fourth-Quarter 2025 Earnings Release and Conference Call
feed.summary: Devon Energy (NYSE: DVN) has announced that it will release its fourth-quarter 2025 financial results on Tuesday, February 17, 2026, after the U.S. financial markets close. The company will also host a conference call on Wednesday, February 18, 2026, at 10 a.m. CDT to discuss the results and answer questions from analysts and investors. Details for accessing the earnings release, presentation, and webcast will be available on Devon Energy's website.

feed.title: Devon Energy Schedules Fourth-Quarter 2025 Earnings Release and Conference Call
feed.summary: Devon Energy Corporation (NYSE: DVN) has announced its plan to release fourth-quarter 2025 results on Tuesday, February 17, 2026, after the close of U.S. financial markets. The company will also host a conference call on Wednesday, February 18, 2026, at 10 a.m. CDT (11 a.m. EDT) to discuss the results and answer questions from analysts and investors. The earnings release, presentation, and webcast link will be available on Devon Energy's website.

feed.title: CHS Expands Into St. Louis to Strengthen Center Gulf Supply Chain
feed.summary: CHS Inc., a leading farmer-owned cooperative, is expanding its presence by leasing a grain terminal in Cahokia, Illinois, from COFCO International Ltd. This strategic move strengthens CHS's Center Gulf export strategy, enhances its ability to connect with local growers, and provides competitive market access for its owners. The facility offers year-round access to the St. Louis Harbor and direct connections to all six North American Class I railways, supporting efficient grain and byproduct transportation.

feed.title: Halliburton EVP Beckwith sells $574,875 in HAL stock By Investing.com
feed.summary: Halliburton's EVP, Secretary, and CLO, Beckwith Van H., sold 17,798 shares of HAL stock for $574,875 on January 9, 2026, under a Rule 10b5-1 trading plan. This sale occurred near the company's 52-week high, aligning with InvestingPro's fair value assessment. Beckwith also transferred shares for tax obligations and retains a significant holding along with stock options, as Halliburton prepares for its next earnings report and continues strategic initiatives.

feed.title: Devon Energy Schedules Fourth-Quarter 2025 Earnings Release and Conference Call
feed.summary: Devon Energy Corp. (NYSE: DVN) announced it will release its fourth-quarter 2025 financial results on Tuesday, Feb. 17, after the U.S. financial markets close. The company will then host a conference call on Wednesday, Feb. 18, at 10 a.m. CDT (11 a.m. EDT) to discuss the results and answer questions from analysts and investors. All relevant materials and webcast links will be available on their website, www.devonenergy.com.

feed.title: COMSTOCK RESOURCES, INC. ANNOUNCES FOURTH QUARTER 2025 EARNINGS DATE AND CONFERENCE CALL INFORMATION
feed.summary: Comstock Resources, Inc. announced its fourth quarter 2025 earnings release date and conference call details. The company will release results on February 11, 2026, after market close, followed by a conference call on February 12, 2026, at 10:00 a.m. CT to discuss the financial outcomes. Interested parties need to register to participate in the call or can listen via a live webcast.

feed.title: Why Sigma Lithium Stock Soared Today
feed.summary: Sigma Lithium (NASDAQ: SGML) stock surged today following multiple analysts raising price targets on its larger rival, Albemarle (NYSE: ALB). Scotiabank, in particular, provided an optimistic outlook for lithium prices, predicting a multi-year tightening cycle and significant price increases by 2028 due to supply constraints. This positive industry forecast suggests potential future gains for Sigma Lithium, despite its current lack of profitability.

feed.title: How Chevron played the long game for Venezuela’s oil reserves
feed.summary: Chevron has strategically maintained its presence in Venezuela, positioning itself to profit from the country's vast oil reserves despite political turmoil and U.S. sanctions. The company's "long game," including extensive lobbying and strong ties to the Trump administration, allowed it to secure licenses and significantly increase production. While this benefits Chevron and the Trump administration's agenda, experts question its long-term viability for Venezuela given the country's decaying infrastructure, massive debt, and ongoing political instability.

feed.title: Alphabet’s Wing Adds 150 Walmart Stores to Drone Delivery Program
feed.summary: Alphabet's drone delivery company, Wing, is significantly expanding its partnership with Walmart, adding 150 new store locations for drone delivery services, starting with Houston and soon expanding to Orlando, Tampa, and Charlotte. The company plans to reach 270 Walmart stores in various major cities by 2027, including Los Angeles and Miami. This expansion builds on successful drone delivery operations in the Dallas-Fort Worth Metroplex and Atlanta, offering quick delivery of everyday items.

feed.title: Caterpillar Launches AI Assistant for Equipment Management
feed.summary: Caterpillar Inc. has introduced Cat AI Assistant at CES 2026, marking its entry into AI-powered fleet management for heavy equipment. This new conversational AI tool aims to streamline equipment operations by linking Caterpillar's digital applications into a single interface. The system will provide predictive maintenance, step-by-step repair guidance for technicians, and real-time in-cab coaching for operators, addressing skilled labor shortages in construction.

feed.title: Automakers' share in China NEV market in 2025: BYD leads with 27.2%, Tesla 5th with 4.9%
feed.summary: In 2025, BYD maintained its lead in China's new energy vehicle (NEV) market with a 27.2% share, despite a 6.3% year-on-year sales decline. Tesla, ranking fifth, saw its market share drop to 4.9% from 6.0% in 2024. Geely and Changan also showed significant growth in the NEV and overall passenger vehicle markets, respectively.

feed.title: What To Watch With The U.S. Global Jets ETF (JETS) Before Buying
feed.summary: The U.S. Global Jets ETF (JETS) offers exposure to the global airline industry, showing recovery momentum with a 13.9% gain over the last year. Key factors for potential investors to consider include projected decreases in jet fuel costs for 2026, which could boost industry margins, and the ETF's significant concentration in four major U.S. carriers (United, Southwest, Delta, American). The upcoming Q4 earnings report from American Airlines on January 22 is particularly critical due to its relatively low profit margins compared to peers and its substantial weighting within the JETS portfolio. Investors should also monitor the ongoing debate between recovering leisure travel demand and persistent weakness in business travel.

feed.title: Kosmos Energy Rises on Ghana’s Drilling Success, Boosting Market Confidence
feed.summary: Kosmos Energy's stock is up significantly due to successful drilling operations in Ghana's Jubilee field, expected to produce over 10,000 barrels of oil per day. The company has also secured license extensions until 2040 and shows financial resilience, including a $100 million withdrawal from its Gulf of America term facility. These developments, along with government support in Ghana and Senegal, are boosting investor confidence and signal a potential turnaround for the company.

feed.title: NANO Nuclear Energy Extends Relationship with the University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign to Construct and Operate the First KRONOS MMR™ Energy System on U.S. University Land
feed.summary: NANO Nuclear Energy Inc. has signed an MOU with the University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign to develop, construct, and operate its KRONOS MMR™ microreactor on campus. This collaboration aims to deploy the first KRONOS MMR™ on U.S. university land, aligning with Illinois' carbon reduction goals and positioning the university as a key innovation hub. The project will involve joint committees, regulatory engagements, and significant investment in engineering and testing, with U. of I. ultimately assuming ownership and operational responsibility.

feed.title: The Autonomous Trucking Stock Investors Overlook
feed.summary: The article discusses Aurora Innovation (NASDAQ: AUR), an autonomous trucking company held in Cathie Wood's Ark Autonomous Technology & Robotics ETF. Aurora aims to address challenges in the freight industry like driver shortages and high costs by developing self-driving trucks, with operations already approved between Dallas and Houston. While the company is in an early stage with significant losses, it has $1.6 billion in cash to fund operations until mid-2027, making it a speculative but potentially high-growth investment in a rapidly expanding industry.

feed.title: International Seaways stock hits 52-week high at 55.19 USD By Investing.com
feed.summary: International Seaways Inc (INSW) stock has reached a 52-week high of $55.19, driven by significant gains over the past year, including a 43.57% total return and a 40.48% six-month gain. The company boasts "GREAT" financial health according to InvestingPro, with a P/E ratio of 12.53 and a dividend yield of 5.39%. This performance highlights strong investor confidence and the company's ability to capitalize on opportunities in the maritime shipping sector, often moving opposite to broader market trends.

feed.title: Stifel raises TETRA Technologies stock price target to $13 on water desalination growth By Investing.com
feed.summary: Stifel has increased its price target for TETRA Technologies Inc. (NYSE:TTI) to $13.00 from $9.00, maintaining a Buy rating. This upgrade is driven by the strong growth potential of TETRA's water desalination business, with the new target representing a 32% upside. The firm also noted TETRA's robust Fluids operations, Water & Flowback business, and its growth in selling high-purity zinc bromide, along with recent positive Q3 2025 earnings and a new joint venture for magnesium production.

feed.title: TFI International (TSE:TFII) Price Target Raised to C$173.00 at Desjardins
feed.summary: Desjardins has increased its price target for TFI International (TSE:TFII) to C$173.00 from C$170.00, maintaining a "buy" rating and suggesting a potential upside of 12.36%. This uplift comes despite mixed analyst sentiment, with Scotiabank reducing its target to C$140.00 while National Bankshares raised theirs to C$170.00. TFI International last reported quarterly earnings of C$1.20 per share on C$2.74 billion in revenue and saw an insider sell 1,000 shares for C$119,860.00.

feed.title: TFI International (NYSE:TFII) Price Target Raised to $141.00
feed.summary: JPMorgan Chase & Co. raised its price target for TFI International (NYSE:TFII) from $106.00 to $141.00, maintaining an "overweight" rating and suggesting a potential upside of 26.47%. Several other analysts have also adjusted their price targets, indicating mixed views with an average consensus rating of "Moderate Buy" and an average price target of $119.87. The company recently exceeded quarterly earnings expectations, reporting EPS of $1.20 against a consensus of $1.19 and revenue of $1.97 billion, significantly higher than the expected $1.49 billion.

feed.title: ECD x CTC Defender 02 Rolls Out Following Strategic Alliance | THE SHOP
feed.summary: ECD Automotive Design and Chelsea Truck Company (CTC) have unveiled the ECDxCTC Defender 02, a factory-new Defender 110 P525 V-8. This customized vehicle, finished in Carpathian Grey with a Series 2 Wide Track body kit and 22-inch wheels, marks a significant step in their collaboration announced in November. The companies aim to create vehicles with bold design and confident performance, with more builds planned for modern Defender platforms.

feed.title: Leibler Jack, director at Nextnrg, sells $154k in shares
feed.summary: Jack Leibler, a director at NEXTNRG, INC. (OTC:NXXT), sold 150,000 shares of the company's common stock for $154,485 on November 21, 2025. This transaction leaves him with 56,007 directly owned shares, and occurred below the current trading price. Despite this, NextNRG recently reported a 253% increase in revenue for December 2025 and secured a 28-year Power Purchase Agreement.

feed.title: OGE creates new division for “more personalized service”
feed.summary: Oklahoma Gas & Electric (OG&E) has established a new Commercial Division and appointed John Laws as Chief Commercial Officer to enhance personalized service, deliver innovative energy solutions, and manage growing electricity demand in Oklahoma and western Arkansas. This strategic move aims to strengthen customer engagement, maintain low electric rates, and balance growth with reliability and affordability. Laws' diverse background in corporate finance, energy operations, and public service is expected to guide the utility through a period of rapid energy system change and increased demand across various sectors.

feed.title: Energy Fuels Soars with Record Uranium Production and Strategic Expansion
feed.summary: Energy Fuels Inc. (UUUU) saw its stock surge by 8.09% following record uranium production and sales guidance. New long-term sales contracts with the U.S. nuclear power sector and a strong feasibility study for its Madagascar project, projecting a $1.8B post-tax NPV, are key drivers. The company's expansion into commercial-scale rare earth element production further enhances its outlook, signaling continued growth and profitability.

feed.title: Why Enphase (ENPH) Stock Is Trading Up Today
feed.summary: Enphase Energy (ENPH) shares jumped over 6.5% today after the company announced production shipments of its new IQ9N-3P Commercial Microinverter, which uses advanced gallium nitride technology and meets domestic content requirements. The positive movement was further bolstered by KeyBanc upgrading Enphase's stock to Sector Weight and Goldman Sachs raising its rating from Sell to Neutral. This news indicates a positive shift in analyst perception and market sentiment for the company.

feed.title: Allegiant to Buy Sun Country Airlines in $1.5 Billion Deal
feed.summary: Allegiant Travel announced its plan to acquire Sun Country Airlines in a $1.5 billion deal, including $400 million of Sun Country's debt. This merger comes as low-cost carriers face challenges from high costs and competition, aiming to achieve growth and scale. The combined entity will focus on providing affordable flights to leisure destinations, serving nearly 175 cities, and will maintain headquarters in Las Vegas with a significant presence in Minneapolis-St. Paul.

feed.title: Allegiant anuncia compra da Sun Country por US$ 1,5 bilhão nos EUA
feed.summary: Allegiant Travel announced the acquisition of Sun Country Airlines for $1.5 billion in cash and stock, uniting two leisure and low-cost focused airlines. The deal, expected to close in the second half of the year pending approval, will result in Allegiant shareholders owning approximately 67% of the combined company. The companies' networks have minimal overlap, aiming to boost competitiveness without reducing domestic route competition, with Allegiant's CEO Greg Anderson taking charge of the combined entity.

feed.title: NANO Nuclear Signs Memorandum of Understanding with Ameresco to Explore the Deployment of Advanced Microreactor Technologies on Federal and Commercial Sites
feed.summary: NANO Nuclear Energy Inc. has signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MOU) with Ameresco, Inc. to explore the integration of NANO Nuclear's advanced micro modular reactor technologies, like the KRONOS MMR™, with Ameresco's engineering, procurement, and construction (EPC) capabilities. This collaboration aims to deploy these microreactors on federal and commercial sites, addressing the growing energy needs, particularly for data centers and industrial markets. The MOU sets the stage for evaluating potential pathways for siting, development, construction, licensing, operation, and decommissioning of NANO Nuclear’s microreactors, with Ameresco potentially leading EPC activities.

feed.title: Tamboran Resources appoints Todd Abbott as new CEO By Investing.com
feed.summary: Tamboran Resources Corporation has appointed Todd Abbott as its new Chief Executive Officer, effective January 15, 2026. Abbott brings over 25 years of experience in the upstream oil and gas sector, having previously served as COO at Seneca Resources Company. Richard Stoneburner, the interim CEO, will continue as Chairman as the company focuses on developing natural gas resources in Australia's Beetaloo Basin.

feed.title: Xpeng Stock Jumps Ahead of Flying Car IPO in Hong Kong
feed.summary: Xpeng's stock rose by about 6% following news of a potential Hong Kong IPO for its flying-car unit, Xpeng Aeroht, also known as Aridge. This move aligns with Beijing's support for a low-altitude economy and reflects investor interest in Xpeng's expansion beyond electric vehicles. The company aims for customer deliveries of its first mass-produced flying car model in late 2026 and has already secured $150 million in external capital for the unit.

feed.title: XPeng (XPEV) stock jumps 8% as flying-car IPO report hits tape, EU tariff rules in focus
feed.summary: XPeng's U.S. shares surged by 8% following reports that the company is preparing for an IPO of its flying-car division in Hong Kong, with JPMorgan and Morgan Stanley tapped to lead the offering. This move aims to fund XPeng's ambitions in autonomy, robotics, and low-altitude air mobility, separating these ventures from its crowded EV business. Meanwhile, the EU has set strict conditions for minimum-price agreements for Chinese EV imports, signaling a complex trade environment.

feed.title: Valero Energy Corp: How a Quiet Refining Giant Became a High-Performance Energy Platform
feed.summary: Valero Energy Corp, traditionally a refining and midstream company, has transformed into a sophisticated, high-performance energy platform. It achieves this through complex, flexible refining, industrial-scale low-carbon fuels production (renewable diesel and ethanol), and an export-centric logistics network. This strategic evolution provides a competitive edge, driving strong cash generation and making Valero a compelling investment in the energy sector.

feed.title: Tesla Inc. (TSLA) Wells Fargo Maintains Bearish Forecast
feed.summary: Wells Fargo analyst Colin Langan has reaffirmed an Underweight (Sell-equivalent) rating for Tesla Inc. (TSLA), despite an upward revision of the 12-month price target to $130 from $120. The firm remains bearish due to concerns over slowing vehicle demand, intensifying competition, margin pressure, and a belief that Tesla's valuation is disconnected from its near-term earnings power, implying a significant downside from its current share price.

feed.title: Union Pacific (UNP) Analyst Rating Update: JP Morgan Raises Price Target | UNP Stock News
feed.summary: JP Morgan has maintained a Neutral rating on Union Pacific (UNP) but increased its price target from $267 to $270, representing a 1.12% rise. This adjustment signals a slightly positive outlook on UNP's future. The article also provides a summary of recent historical analyst ratings and a consensus forecast from 25 analysts, indicating an average target price of $261.22 with an "Outperform" status.

feed.title: A Look At FTAI Aviation (FTAI) Valuation After Launch Of New FTAI Power Platform
feed.summary: FTAI Aviation (FTAI) has launched FTAI Power, a new platform that converts CFM56 aircraft engines into aeroderivative turbines for data centers. This has garnered fresh attention, especially after strong share price performance with a 30-day return of 38.89% and a 90-day return of 44.07%. Despite this, Simply Wall St's analysis suggests FTAI is currently 8.2% overvalued with a fair value of US$227.10 per share, while the average analyst target is US$250.10.

feed.title: Will Delta (DAL) Beat Estimates Again in Its Next Earnings Report?
feed.summary: Delta Air Lines (DAL) is positioned for a potential earnings beat in its upcoming report, scheduled for January 13, 2026. The company has a history of surpassing earnings estimates, with an average surprise of 7.72% over the last two quarters. With a Zacks Earnings ESP of +0.24% and a Zacks Rank #3 (Hold), the indicators suggest a favorable outcome.

feed.title: Equinor Awards $10B in Maintenance Contracts to Supplier Companies

This five-year contract, with two extension options, is crucial for maintaining daily production of 1.2 million barrels of oil and gas from the Norwegian Continental Shelf until at least 2035. The initiative aims to lower costs, enhance efficiency through long-term partnerships, and is expected to generate 4,000 man-years of work, despite pressures from low crude oil prices.

feed.title: Why Exxon is ‘playing too cute’ in Venezuela talks with Trump

Industry experts suggest Exxon's cautious approach is strategic and could give them more negotiating power, as Venezuela is considered "uninvestable" without significant reforms.

feed.title: Ormat Technologies Signs 20-Year PPA with Switch for ~13MW

This agreement, Ormat's first direct PPA with a data center operator, supports Switch's sustainability goals and the growing demand for renewable energy in the data center industry. Energy deliveries are set to begin in Q1 2030 after a major upgrade to the Salt Wells plant, with potential for further expansion by adding a 7MW solar PV facility.

feed.title: Alliant Energy Corporation Declares Quarterly Common Stock Dividend
authors: Alliant Energy Corporation via Business Wire
feed.summary: Alliant Energy Corporation (NASDAQ: LNT) has declared a quarterly cash dividend of $0.5350 per share, payable on February 17, 2026, to shareowners of record as of January 30, 2026. feed.title: KBR & Tecnicas Reunidas Win FEED Contract for Texas LNG Project

feed.title: PG&E reaches $100 million shareholder settlement over 2017, 2018 California wildfires

The settlement, filed in U.S. District Court in San Jose, California, requires a judge's approval. Shareholders alleged that PG&E concealed defective safety practices, which led to devastating fires like the 2017 North Bay fires and the 2018 Camp Fire.

feed.title: Down 27% in 2025, This Worst-Performing Oil Stock Is Set to Go Parabolic in 2026
feed.summary: Oneok (NYSE: OKE) experienced a significant 27% stock drop in 2025 due to aggressive, debt-backed acquisitions, including Medallion Midstream, EnLink Midstream, and Magellan Midstream. Despite being a major midstream energy company with stable fee-based earnings, investors grew wary of increased debt and integration costs. However, analysts predict a strong comeback in 2026 driven by substantial cost synergies, reduced tax expenses, and declining capital expenditures, which are expected to boost free cash flow, support dividends, and potentially lead to share buybacks.

feed.title: American Chevron accelerates loading of tankers with Venezuelan oil
feed.summary: American oil and gas company Chevron Corp. is significantly increasing its loading of Venezuelan oil onto tankers, reaching the fastest pace in seven months since May 2025. This acceleration aligns with the U.S. government's interest in Venezuela's oil resources. The oil is primarily destined for American refineries such as Phillips 66 and Valero Energy Corp., as well as Chevron's own plant.

feed.title: Enphase begins distributing commercial microinverter nationwide
feed.summary: Enphase Energy has started shipping its IQ9N-3P Commercial Microinverter across the United States. This microinverter is manufactured in the U.S. and is designed for three-phase 480-Y/277-V grid configurations, utilizing gallium nitride (GaN) technology for increased efficiency. It aims to support domestic content requirements and FEOC compliance for commercial solar projects.

feed.title: Array Technologies and TAT Technologies have been highlighted as Zacks Bull and Bear of the Day
feed.summary: Zacks Equity Research has named Array Technologies (ARRY) as its Bull of the Day, citing its strong market position in the solar industry, favorable risk-to-reward ratio, significant ROIC, and attractive valuation. Conversely, TAT Technologies (TATT) has been identified as the Bear of the Day due to its stretched valuation and limited competitive advantage despite positive sentiment in the aerospace and defense sector. The article also compares Micron Technology (MU) and NVIDIA Corp (NVDA), concluding that NVIDIA appears to be a more stable stock with greater growth potential in 2026 due to stronger market expectations despite both having a Zacks Rank #1.

feed.title: Willdan Group stock hits all-time high at 121.5 USD By Investing.com
feed.summary: Willdan Group Inc.'s stock reached an all-time high of $121.5, now trading at $121.8 with a market capitalization of $1.78 billion. This surge reflects strong investor confidence, with the stock gaining 237.91% over the past year and 62.05% in the last six months, driven by robust revenue growth and strategic initiatives like recent acquisitions and a significant energy savings contract. Analysts remain bullish despite the stock trading above its InvestingPro Fair Value.

feed.title: Inside the Chinese mold maker behind greener electric trucks
feed.summary: Mingteng International (MTEN) is deepening its strategic collaboration with a leading Chinese NEV supplier to develop powertrain components. The partnership aims to leverage Mingteng's expertise in complex mold design and precision production to create lighter aluminum-alloy components, improving efficiency for greener electric trucks. This move reinforces Mingteng's role in the new energy vehicle supply chain, supporting sustainable development and long-term growth in the NEV sector.

feed.title: Mingteng International Expands Ongoing Strategic Collaboration with Leading NEV Top Tier Supplier in China to Support Sustainable Development
feed.summary: Mingteng International Corporation Inc. (Nasdaq: MTEN) has strengthened its collaboration with a key new energy vehicle (NEV) component supplier in China. This partnership focuses on mold development and manufacturing for lightweight aluminum alloy components used in electric powertrain systems, aiming to support the automotive industry's green transformation. The company anticipates continued innovation in NEV technologies and plans to leverage such collaborations for sustainable development and long-term growth.

feed.title: Wing and Walmart Expand Drone Delivery to 150 New Stores
feed.summary: Wing and Walmart are significantly expanding their drone delivery partnership to 150 new stores across the U.S., aiming for over 270 locations by 2027 and serving 40 million people. This expansion, which begins in Houston and includes major cities, is set to make drone deliveries a common practice for essentials and small, urgent purchases. The initiative highlights the rapid move of drone delivery from an experimental phase to mainstream utility, with Wing also partnering with DoorDash for restaurant deliveries.

feed.title: Zacks Market Edge Highlights: Exxon Mobil, Chevron and ConocoPhillips
feed.summary: Zacks Market Edge podcast, hosted by Tracey Ryniec, discusses whether major oil stocks like Exxon Mobil, Chevron, and ConocoPhillips represent value or potential traps in 2026. The episode analyzes their current P/E ratios, earnings expectations, and dividend yields, considering factors like Venezuela's developments and fluctuating oil prices.

feed.title: Array Technologies and TAT Technologies have been highlighted as Zacks Bull and Bear of the Day
feed.summary: Zacks Equity Research has named Array Technologies (ARRY) as its Bull of the Day due to its strong financial performance, favorable risk-to-reward ratio, and benefits from clean energy policies in the solar industry. Conversely, TAT Technologies (TATT) has been designated the Bear of the Day, with its stock trading near an all-time high amidst concerns of overvaluation in the aerospace and defense sector despite recent positive sentiment. The article also compares Micron Technology (MU) and NVIDIA (NVDA), identifying NVIDIA as having greater growth potential in 2026 within the AI chip market.

feed.title: Howmet Aerospace (HWM) Enters Buy Zone as it Outperforms the Broader Market
feed.summary: Howmet Aerospace (HWM) has significantly outpaced the broader market, with a 92% gain in the last twelve months driven by strong aftermarket demand and a near-monopoly on critical aerospace components. Despite its recent surge, analysts identify a new "buy zone" between $202 and $206, supported by robust Q3 2025 earnings and a favorable position in the aerospace and defense sectors. The company's unique role as a Tier 1 supplier, insulating it from major aircraft manufacturer headwinds, positions it for continued growth in 2026, though its premium valuation presents a risk.

feed.title: Howmet Aerospace (HWM) Enters Buy Zone as it Outperforms the Broader Market
feed.summary: Howmet Aerospace (HWM) has significantly outperformed the S&P 500, with a 92% gain over the last year, driven by high-margin aftermarket demand and its near-monopoly on critical engine components. Analysts identify a technical "buy zone" between $202 and $206, supported by robust Q3 2025 earnings and strong demand from both commercial aviation (due to aging fleets) and defense sectors. Despite its premium valuation, Howmet's specialized expertise and technological moat position it as an indispensable and resilient player in the aerospace industry.

feed.title: Allegiant to acquire Sun Country Airlines for $1.5 billion
feed.summary: Low-cost carrier Allegiant will acquire Sun Country Airlines in a deal valued at approximately $1.5 billion, including debt. Sun Country shareholders will receive a premium of about 19.8% to their stock's Friday closing price through a combination of Allegiant shares and cash. The combined entity, headquartered in Las Vegas, is expected to generate significant annual synergies and expand its network across the U.S. and internationally.

feed.title: A Look At Allegiant Travel (ALGT) Valuation After Its Recent Share Price Rally
feed.summary: Allegiant Travel (ALGT) has experienced a significant share price rally, prompting an analysis of its valuation.
