While the most followed narrative suggests the stock is 36.5% overvalued against a fair value of US$69.58, a Discounted Cash Flow (DCF) model by Simply Wall St indicates it is heavily undervalued with a fair value of approximately US$1,019.65. This discrepancy highlights differing views on the company's future prospects, including fleet modernization impacts and potential risks like leisure demand recovery and cost pressures.

feed.title: Fluor Completes Mechanical Milestone for BASF’s Landmark Verbund Project in South China
feed.summary: Fluor Corporation has announced the mechanical completion of BASF's Zhanjiang Verbund Site project in South China, a significant milestone for one of the region's most complex chemical developments. The project, BASF's largest single global investment, achieved exceptional safety performance with over 75 million work hours without a Lost Time Injury. Fluor provided extensive engineering, procurement, and construction support for integrated operations, and once fully operational, the site will be BASF’s third-largest Verbund site globally, serving the rapidly growing Chinese chemical market.

feed.title: Tortoise Power and Energy Infrastructure Fund, Inc. (TPZ) Declares Monthly Distribution and Tortoise Essential Assets Income Term Fund (TEAF) Provides Update on Direct Investments and Portfolio Allocation
feed.summary: Tortoise Power and Energy Infrastructure Fund, Inc. (TPZ) announced a monthly distribution of $0.05 per share payable on April 30, 2021. Additionally, Tortoise Essential Assets Income Term Fund (TEAF) provided an update on its direct investments, portfolio asset allocation, and impact statistics as of March 31, 2021, emphasizing continued monthly updates until direct investments reach 60%. The article also includes a cautionary statement about forward-looking statements and information about Tortoise Capital Advisors.

feed.title: Inside the mobile lab speeding up rare earth drilling tests in Greenland
feed.summary: Critical Metals Corp (CRML) has acquired a turnkey Integrated Mobile Geochemical Analysis Centre for approximately US$1 million to expedite rare earth element (REE) drilling tests at its Tanbreez project in Greenland. This mobile lab, featuring a Bruker M4 Tornado Plus 26S Micro XRF system, will provide on-site REE analysis in about 80 minutes, significantly reducing turnaround times and reliance on external laboratories. The investment aims to enhance exploration efficiency, support the pilot plant activities, and contribute to the training and employment of Greenlandic personnel, aligning with ESG considerations.

feed.title: Global Partners LP Announces Cash Distribution on Series B Preferred Units
feed.summary: Global Partners LP declared a quarterly cash distribution of $0.59375 per Series B preferred unit. This distribution covers the period from November 15, 2025, to February 14, 2026, with payment scheduled for February 17, 2026. Non-U.S. investors will be subject to federal tax withholding.

feed.title: Eco Wave Power registra produção de 2.000 kWh em projeto no Porto de Jaffa
feed.summary: Eco Wave Power announced that its EWP-EDF One wave energy project in Jaffa Port, Israel, produced over 2,000 kWh of electricity in December 2025. The pilot project, which uses small-scale floats, has maintained stable operation and zero downtime since early 2025, providing crucial real-world performance data for the company's larger commercial endeavors globally. Eco Wave Power is also developing projects in Los Angeles, Taiwan, India, and Portugal.
feed.source: Investing.com Brasil - Finanças, Câmbio e Investimentos
feed.source_domain: Investing.com Brasil - Finanças, Câmbio e Investimentos

feed.title: Green Plains Expands Leadership Team with Ryan Loneman as General Counsel
feed.summary: Green Plains Inc. has appointed Ryan Loneman as General Counsel and Secretary, effective January 26, 2026. Loneman will lead the legal function and advise senior leadership on corporate governance, strategic transactions, and regulatory matters. This appointment is part of Green Plains' ongoing efforts to strengthen its leadership team and support its long-term growth strategy in the biorefining industry.

feed.title: Duke Energy Florida Debuts First US 100% Green Hydrogen Power System
feed.summary: Duke Energy Florida has launched the DeBary Hydrogen Production Storage System in Volusia County, making it the U.S.'s first end-to-end system for producing, storing, and combusting 100% green hydrogen for electricity generation. This initiative integrates green hydrogen into utility-scale power operations, enhancing grid flexibility, reliability, and resilience by storing excess renewable energy from solar power. The system uses an upgraded combustion turbine capable of running on 100% hydrogen, demonstrating a significant step towards a clean, flexible, and dependable power generation future.

feed.title: Battery maker Amprius just finished a $97.5M stock sale
feed.summary: Amprius Technologies (NYSE: AMPX) announced the completion and termination of its at-the-market (ATM) equity offering program, through which it raised approximately $97.5 million in net proceeds. The company sold 25.5 million shares under the program, which was originally established on October 2, 2023. As of December 31, 2025, Amprius reported unaudited cash and cash equivalents of approximately $91.9 million.

feed.title: CN posts monthly grain movement record
feed.summary: Canadian National Railway (CN) achieved a new monthly record for grain movement in December, marking its fourth consecutive record month. The company moved over 2.82 million tonnes of grain from Western Canada, surpassing its previous December record from 2020. CN also set an annual record in 2025 by shipping over 31.3 million tonnes of grain from Western Canada and more than 32.7 million tonnes across all of Canada.

feed.title: (ENB) Technical Pivots with Risk Controls (ENB:CA)
feed.summary: This article provides technical analysis and trading plans for Enbridge Inc. (ENB:CA), focusing on short trading opportunities. It includes AI-generated signals and ratings for various terms (Near, Mid, Long). The piece also lists numerous related articles offering investment analysis and trading signals for ENB over several months.

feed.title: Allegiant Air to acquire Sun Country Airlines in $1.5B deal
feed.summary: Allegiant Air announced its plan to acquire Sun Country Airlines in a cash-and-stock deal valued at approximately $1.5 billion. The merger aims to combine two low-cost U.S. carriers specializing in leisure travel, expanding their route networks and offering more affordable travel options. The deal is expected to close in the second half of 2026, pending regulatory and shareholder approval, with the combined entity operating under the Allegiant name and led by Allegiant CEO Gregory Anderson.

feed.title: Eco Wave Power Reports Strong December 2025 Wave Energy Performance at Jaffa Port, Reinforcing Scalability of Its Wave Energy Technology
feed.summary: Eco Wave Power Global reported strong wave energy production at its EWP-EDF One project in Jaffa Port during December 2025, producing over 2,000 kWh of clean electricity from moderate wave heights. This performance validates the scalability of their technology, with plans for larger commercial deployments and continued global expansion, including projects in the U.S., Taiwan, India, and Portugal. The company aims to transition wave energy from demonstration to large-scale commercial application, reinforcing its role as a predictable renewable energy source.

feed.title: Record Grain Volumes Could Be A Game Changer For Canadian National Railway (TSX:CNR)
feed.summary: Canadian National Railway reported record grain movement in December and for the full year 2025, driven by strong crops and efficient rail operations. This achievement could significantly impact their network efficiency and earnings growth, aligning with their 2025 EPS growth guidance of 10% to 15%. However, investors are advised to consider potential volume pressures in other segments and compare various fair value estimates for Canadian National Railway.

feed.title: Ryanair Cancels Over 267,000 Shares in Early January Buyback
feed.summary: Ryanair Holdings repurchased and cancelled 4,404 ordinary shares and 263,310 ordinary shares underlying American Depositary Shares between January 5 and 9, 2026. This share buyback is part of an ongoing capital management strategy aimed at reducing the company's share count, potentially boosting earnings per share, and demonstrating confidence in its financial health. Analysts currently have a "Buy" rating on RYAAY stock with a price target of $33.00, and TipRanks' AI Analyst, Spark, rates RYAAY as "Outperform" due to its strong financial performance, positive technical indicators, and attractive valuation.

feed.title: Why one firm is adding 62 heavy trucks to Singapore’s busy roads
feed.summary: Multi Ways Holdings has announced the purchase of 62 Sinotruk vehicles for S$8.24 million (US$6.4 million) and a one-year non-exclusive dealership agreement with Cycle & Carriage. This investment aims to expand the company's fleet capacity to meet demand in Singapore's construction and logistics sectors and establish a new sales channel. The order includes 40 cement mixers and 22 tipper trucks, with delivery expected within three months.

feed.title: Westwood Announces Monthly Income Distributions for Westwood Salient Enhanced Midstream Income ETF (MDST) and Westwood Salient Enhanced Energy Income ETF (WEEI)
feed.summary: Westwood Holdings Group has announced the monthly income distributions for its Westwood Salient Enhanced Midstream Income ETF (MDST) and Westwood Salient Enhanced Energy Income ETF (WEEI). Both ETFs are actively managed and aim to provide high distributable monthly income through a combination of dividends and options premiums from covered calls, offering double-digit income to investors. As of January 5, 2026, MDST has $172 million in net assets and WEEI has $35 million in net assets.

feed.title: Global Partners Announces Cash Distribution on Series B Preferred Units
feed.summary: Global Partners LP announced a quarterly cash distribution of $0.59375 per unit on its 9.50% fixed-rate Series B preferred units for the period from November 15, 2025, through February 14, 2026. This distribution will be paid on February 17, 2026, to unitholders of record as of February 2, 2026. The announcement also included important non-U.S. withholding information for brokers and nominees regarding tax treatment of distributions to non-U.S. investors.

feed.title: Turning Kansas hydrogen drilling assets into digital tokens
feed.summary: Netcapital Inc. (NASDAQ: NCPL) has signed PureWave Hydrogen (TSX.V: PWH) as its first client to tokenize hydrogen drilling assets in Kansas, marking its first potential revenue-generating real-world asset tokenization initiative. This move aims to create a repeatable template with a consistent fee structure for scalable platform revenue. Netcapital's CEO, Rich Wheeless, stated that this initiative will broaden investor access to asset-backed projects through regulated digital infrastructure while maintaining investor protections.

feed.title: New Houston energy deal hub targets nuclear, fuels and AI infrastructure
feed.summary: Cohen & Company (COHN) has opened a new Houston office and appointed Rahul Jasuja as Head of Energy and Energy Transition to expand its advisory services. This expansion comes after nearly doubling deal flow and closing $44 billion in transactions in 2025. The Houston hub will focus on four core verticals, including nuclear, critical energy supply chains, energy transition fuels, and traditional energy evolution, positioning the firm for industrial-scale capital markets for energy infrastructure.

feed.title: Cohen & Company Announces Appointment of Senior Leadership to Expand Energy and Energy Transition Capabilities
feed.summary: Cohen & Company Capital Markets has appointed Rahul Jasuja as Head of Energy and Energy Transition and opened a new Houston office. This strategic move aims to expand the firm's advisory services in traditional energy and energy transition, focusing on critical energy supply chains, sustainable fuels, and firm energy systems. The expansion follows significant growth, with the firm nearly doubling deal flow and closing $44 billion in transactions in 2025.

feed.title: Pony.ai and BAIC BJEV launch "Cooperation 2.0"
feed.summary: Pony.ai and BAIC BJEV have launched "Cooperation 2.0," a comprehensive strategic upgrade focused on industrialization, commercialization, and globalization of autonomous driving. This expands their collaboration beyond robotaxis to include product co-creation, joint market development, integrated industry chains, ecosystem co-building, and capital synergy. The partnership aims to accelerate the mass production and global deployment of Level 4 autonomous vehicles, leveraging their combined resources and expertise.

feed.title: Forum Energy Technologies Announces Appointment of The Honorable Leslie A. Beyer to its Board of Directors
feed.summary: Forum Energy Technologies, Inc. (NYSE: FET) has announced the appointment of The Honorable Leslie A. Beyer to its Board of Directors, where she will also serve on the Compensation & Human Capital Committee and the Nominating, Governance & Sustainability Committee. Ms. Beyer brings extensive experience from her previous roles, including Assistant Secretary of the Interior for Land and Minerals Management and CEO of the Energy Workforce and Technology Council. Her appointment is expected to provide valuable insights into regulatory environments and energy expansion, aligning with FET's strategic objectives.

feed.title: Record Grain Volumes Could Be A Game Changer For Canadian National Railway (TSX:CNR)
feed.summary: Canadian National Railway reported record monthly grain movement in December and record full-year grain movement in 2025, driven by strong Canadian crops. This performance validates the company's focus on network efficiency and earnings growth, aligning with its 2025 EPS growth guidance of 10% to 15%. However, investors should consider potential risks from flat or pressured volumes in other segments, which could offset the grain sector's strength.

feed.title: Toyota Boosts Share Buyback Program: Details Here
feed.summary: Toyota Motor Corporation has increased its share buyback program to 1.2 trillion yen ($8.31 billion) from 1 trillion yen, aiming to repurchase up to 530 million shares (3.93% of outstanding shares) by April 30, 2025. This decision reflects current stock price levels and follows a previous plan in July to repurchase shares from Japanese banks and insurers. Additionally, the company recently trimmed its 2026 EV production target due to slowing global demand.

feed.title: Enphase Energy Begins Shipments of IQ9 Commercial Microinverters in the United States
feed.summary: Enphase Energy has started shipping its IQ9N-3P Commercial Microinverter in the United States, manufactured domestically to meet content requirements for commercial solar projects. This new microinverter, featuring gallium nitride (GaN) technology, is designed for three-phase 480Y/277 V grid configurations, aiming to simplify system design and improve efficiency. It supports high-power solar panels up to 600 W and offers a 25-year warranty.

feed.title: Delta Air Lines Earnings Preview: (DAL) Stock Eyeing Breakout Leading In
feed.summary: Delta Air Lines (DAL) is set to report its Q4 2025 earnings, with consensus estimates of $1.52 EPS and $15.96 billion in revenue, reflecting a $200 million pre-tax profit headwind from a December government shutdown. The market will closely watch if Delta's premiumization strategy can sustain margin expansion despite this disruption, and particular attention will be paid to 2026 guidance, premium cabin revenue growth, and unit revenue trajectory. The results will determine whether the stock validates its recent rally or faces a near-term breakdown.

feed.title: Enphase Energy Begins Shipments of IQ9 Commercial Microinverters in the United States
feed.summary: Enphase Energy has started shipping its IQ9N-3P Commercial Microinverters in the United States, utilizing gallium nitride (GaN) technology and manufactured domestically to meet federal content requirements. This new microinverter is designed for three-phase commercial solar projects, offering improved efficiency, simplified installation, and enhanced reliability. It supports high-power solar panels and is compliant with rigorous grid standards, providing a scalable and safe solution for commercial rooftops.

feed.title: Enphase Energy Begins Shipments of IQ9 Commercial Microinverters in the United States
feed.summary: Enphase Energy has started shipping its IQ9N-3P Commercial Microinverters across the United States. These microinverters, manufactured in the U.S. to meet domestic content requirements, are designed for three-phase 480Y/277 V grid configurations and utilize gallium nitride (GaN) technology for improved efficiency and reliability. The product supports high-power solar panels up to 600 W and simplifies commercial solar installations, addressing federal sourcing requirements and offering long-term operational benefits.

feed.title: NiSource launches $1.5 billion ATM equity offering program
feed.summary: NiSource Inc. has launched an "At-The-Market" equity offering program, through which it may issue and sell up to $1.5 billion of its common stock. The company plans to use the net proceeds for general corporate purposes, including funding its capital expenditures and investments. This move aligns with NiSource's strategy to finance its infrastructure modernization and clean energy transition initiatives.

feed.title: US based ASP Isotopes completes acquisition of Renergen
feed.summary: ASP Isotopes Inc. has acquired Renergen Limited, creating a combined entity focused on critical isotopes and liquid helium. This acquisition integrates ASP Isotopes' enrichment technologies with Renergen's helium and natural gas operations, especially the Virginia Gas project which has secured significant U.S. DFC funding. The newly formed company aims to meet the increasing demand for these critical materials in high-tech sectors such as semiconductors, quantum computing, AI, and clean energy.

feed.title: Veteran shale executive takes helm of new Beetaloo Basin gas development
feed.summary: Tamboran Resources Corporation has appointed Todd Abbott as its new Chief Executive Officer, effective January 15, 2026. Abbott brings over 25 years of experience in upstream oil and gas, previously serving as COO at Seneca Resources Company. His appointment comes as Tamboran enters the development phase of its Beetaloo Basin project in Australia, with a focus on operational leadership and capital discipline.

feed.title: Lucid Group (LCID) Reiterated at Overweight by Cantor Fitzgerald
feed.summary: Cantor Fitzgerald analyst Andres Sheppard has reiterated an Overweight rating on Lucid Group Inc. (LCID), projecting significant developments for the company. LCID plans to deploy over 20,000 Lucid Gravity electric SUVs as Robotaxis in partnership with Uber, with deployment starting in late 2026 or early 2027. Additionally, Lucid surpassed production forecasts for FY25, delivering 15,841 vehicles and producing 18,378 vehicles, exceeding both analyst estimates and annual guidance.

feed.title: Phillips 66 stock price target raised to $152 by Mizuho on refining outlook
feed.summary: Mizuho has increased its price target for Phillips 66 (NYSE:PSX) to $152 from $150, while maintaining a Neutral rating, citing a strong Refining segment outlook and growing Midstream earnings. The firm anticipates solid Q4 2025 results, albeit slightly below consensus estimates, attributing potential sequential declines to weaknesses in Marketing & Specialties and Chemicals. Other analysts show mixed sentiment, with UBS reiterating a Buy rating at $160 after the Lindsey Oil Refinery acquisition, but Freedom Capital Markets downgrading the stock to Sell with a $138 target due to broader oil and gas sector concerns.

feed.title: Independent Proxy Advisory Firms Recommend NuVista Shareholders Vote “For” Proposed Ovintiv Transaction
feed.summary: Independent proxy advisory firms, including Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS), have recommended that NuVista Energy Ltd. shareholders vote "FOR" the proposed Arrangement with Ovintiv Inc. NuVista shareholders can elect to receive cash, Ovintiv shares, or a combination for their NuVista shares. The special meeting to approve the Arrangement is scheduled for January 23, 2026, and shareholders are urged to vote by January 21, 2026.

feed.title: Snow Lake Completes Highly Successful Drill Program at the Pine Ridge Uranium Project in Wyoming
feed.summary: Snow Lake Energy announced the successful completion of its 2025 drill program at the Pine Ridge Uranium Project in Wyoming, a joint venture with Global Uranium and Enrichment Limited. The program of 114 drill holes confirmed widespread uranium mineralization, identifying at least 25 mineralized roll fronts within three sandstone packages. The results show continuous mineralization, with highlights including 2.6m at 0.101% U3O8 and 2.0m at 0.092% U3O8, paving the way for future exploration and potential in-situ recovery development in the prolific Powder River Basin.

feed.title: Drilling in Wyoming uranium basin reveals new mineralized zones at Pine Ridge project
feed.summary: Snow Lake Energy (NASDAQ: LITM) has successfully completed its 2025 drill program at the Pine Ridge uranium project in Wyoming, a 50/50 joint venture with Global Uranium and Enrichment. The program drilled 114 holes, totaling 38,000 meters, confirming widespread and continuous roll-front uranium mineralization across multiple sandstone packages and identifying at least 25 mineralized roll fronts. The most significant assay reported was 2.6m at 0.101% U3O8, with the mineralization found in geologically and hydrologically isolated sandstones at depths suitable for In-Situ Recovery (ISR) development.

feed.title: Tamboran Names New CEO
feed.summary: Tamboran Resources Corp has appointed Todd Abbott, formerly COO of Seneca Resources, as its new CEO, effective January 15. He replaces interim CEO Richard Stoneburner, who remains chair. Abbott's extensive experience in unconventional oil and gas operations and his focus on productivity and cost reduction align with Tamboran's objectives for its Beetaloo Basin development. This appointment comes as Tamboran is in the process of acquiring Falcon Oil & Gas Ltd to expand its holdings in the Beetaloo Basin.

feed.title: What to Expect From Xcel Energy's Q4 2025 Earnings Report
feed.summary: Xcel Energy Inc. (XEL) is set to release its Q4 2025 earnings report, with analysts expecting an adjusted EPS of $0.97, a 19.8% increase from the previous year. Despite mixed past performance against Wall Street estimates, the company's stock has risen 11.9% over the past year, matching the Utilities Select Sector SPDR ETF, though lagging the S&P 500. Analysts hold a "Strong Buy" consensus with a target price indicating an 18.9% upside.

feed.title: Meeder Asset Management Inc. Acquires 17,600 Shares of NextEra Energy, Inc. $NEE
feed.summary: Meeder Asset Management Inc. significantly increased its stake in NextEra Energy (NEE) by 17,600 shares in Q3, bringing its total holdings to 17,601 shares valued at $1.33 million. This comes as NextEra Energy reported strong Q3 earnings, beating analyst estimates with $1.13 EPS and showing 5.3% year-over-year revenue growth. Despite a recent sale of shares by the CEO, institutional ownership remains strong, and the company maintains a "Moderate Buy" consensus rating from analysts with an average target price of $91.72.

feed.title: Sumitomo Mitsui Trust Group Inc. Purchases 89,586 Shares of NextEra Energy, Inc. $NEE
feed.summary: Sumitomo Mitsui Trust Group Inc. increased its stake in NextEra Energy, Inc. by 1.8% in Q3, acquiring an additional 89,586 shares and raising its total holding to 4,953,009 shares valued at approximately $373.9 million. This comes as CEO Armando Pimentel, Jr. recently sold a significant portion of his shares, reducing his holding by over 47%. Wall Street analysts currently rate NextEra Energy as a "Moderate Buy" with a consensus target price of $91.72.

feed.title: A Look At First Solar (FSLR) Valuation After Jefferies Downgrade And Class Action Scrutiny
feed.summary: First Solar (FSLR) has seen a recent sentiment hit following a Jefferies downgrade to Hold due to repeated guidance reductions and challenging market conditions, coupled with class action headlines. Despite short-term volatility and a share price decline over 30 days, the company shows strong long-term gains with 1-year and 5-year total shareholder returns of 29.98% and 147.11%, respectively. With its stock at US$238.66, analysts' average target of US$281.65, and an estimated intrinsic value implying a 22.2% discount, there's a question of whether this presents a buying opportunity, especially given its stable $18.5 billion contracted backlog.

feed.title: Here’s What Analysts Think About ​Vistra Corp (VST)
feed.summary: Goldman Sachs and Bank of America Securities have reiterated their ratings on Vistra Corp (VST) following its acquisition of Cogentrix for approximately $4 billion. The deal adds 5,500 MW of natural gas-fired power plants to Vistra's portfolio. Analysts view this as a strategic move that enhances capacity in key US electricity markets, with potential for significant EBITDA generation despite some regulatory risks.

feed.title: Horizon Aircraft to Provide a Business Update and Second Quarter 2026 Results on January 14, 2026 at 8:30 AM EST
feed.summary: Horizon Aircraft (NASDAQ:HOVR) will release its fiscal second-quarter 2026 financial results on Wednesday, January 14, 2026, at 8:30 AM EST. Management will discuss these results and other company information during a conference call and webcast. Shareholders are invited to submit questions for the webcast by Friday, January 9, 2026.

feed.title: Wing Drone Delivery to Add 150 More Walmart Stores
feed.summary: Walmart and Wing are significantly expanding their drone delivery service by adding 150 more Walmart stores across new markets including Los Angeles and Miami, aiming to serve 40 million Americans by 2027. The service, operating under FAA Part 135 authorization, delivers items up to 5 pounds within 20 minutes, with high customer adoption rates. Future growth hinges on the FAA's proposed Part 108 rule, which would allow widespread operations beyond visual line of sight and in controlled airspace, despite ongoing industry debates.

feed.title: Loring Wolcott & Coolidge Fiduciary Advisors LLP MA Sells 32,081 Shares of Canadian National Railway Company $CNI
feed.summary: Loring Wolcott & Coolidge Fiduciary Advisors LLP MA reduced its stake in Canadian National Railway Company (NYSE:CNI) by 2.3% in the third quarter, selling 32,081 shares and holding 1,392,998 shares valued at $133.67 million. Despite this reduction, Canadian National Railway remains a significant holding for the firm. The company has a "Moderate Buy" consensus rating from analysts, raised its quarterly dividend, and reported an EPS beat though revenue fell short of expectations.

feed.title: Rail Vision launches proof of concept in India
feed.summary: Rail Vision Ltd. has launched a Proof of Concept (POC) in India with Sujan Industries to demonstrate its Mainline product capabilities for railway safety to senior government officials and industry stakeholders. This initiative follows Rail Vision's participation at the Indian Railways Electronics and Equipment Exhibition, highlighting a significant expansion into India's vast railway network. The POC aims to enhance railway safety and operational efficiency, potentially leading to wider deployment in the rapidly modernizing Indian rail sector.

feed.title: Institutional Confidence Fuels Momentum for Uranium Energy Shares
feed.summary: Uranium Energy Corp. (UEC) is experiencing a surge in institutional confidence, with Norges Bank establishing a new $105 million position and other funds increasing their stakes. This bullish sentiment is further supported by significant call option activity and a strong technical uptrend, even though the company is pre-production and currently reports no revenue. The market appears to be focusing on UEC's physical uranium inventory and project pipeline, anticipating a tighter uranium supply-demand dynamic in 2026.

feed.title: CMS Energy's Q4 2025 Earnings: What to Expect
feed.summary: CMS Energy (CMS) is preparing to announce its fiscal Q4 2025 results, with analysts projecting an adjusted EPS of $0.96, a 10.3% increase year-over-year. For the full fiscal year 2025, the company is expected to report adjusted EPS of $3.59, up 7.5% from 2024. Despite underperforming the S&P 500 and the Utilities Select Sector SPDR ETF over the past 52 weeks, analysts maintain a "Moderate Buy" rating, with a target price suggesting a potential 13.1% upside.

feed.title: Scorpio Tankers to sell LR2 product tanker for $57.5 million
feed.summary: Scorpio Tankers Inc. announced the sale of the STI Kingsway, an LR2 product tanker, for $57.5 million, with the transaction expected to close in Q1 or Q2 of 2026. This sale is part of a larger fleet adjustment involving four LR2 tankers. The company maintains a strong financial position, profitability, and a consistent dividend history, while also advancing newbuilding agreements for future fleet expansion.

feed.title: CMS Energy's Q4 2025 Earnings: What to Expect
feed.summary: CMS Energy (CMS) is anticipated to announce its Q4 2025 earnings soon, with analysts forecasting an adjusted EPS of $0.96, a 10.3% increase year-over-year. The company has a "Moderate Buy" rating from analysts, with an average price target that suggests a 13.1% upside. Despite outperforming earnings expectations in most recent quarters, CMS shares have underperformed the S&P 500 and the Utilities Select Sector SPDR ETF over the past 52 weeks.

feed.title: Tema Etfs LLC Takes $3.69 Million Position in Uber Technologies, Inc. $UBER
feed.summary: Tema Etfs LLC has acquired a new position of 37,655 shares in Uber Technologies, Inc. valued at approximately $3.69 million during the third quarter. This investment comes as Uber reported strong quarterly earnings, beating analyst estimates with $3.11 EPS and $13.47 billion in revenue. Despite some mixed analyst views and concerns over short-term earnings risks, the overall sentiment remains largely positive with several firms reiterating Buy/Overweight ratings.

feed.title: Tema Etfs LLC Has $4.40 Million Stock Position in Xcel Energy Inc. $XEL
feed.summary: Tema Etfs LLC significantly increased its stake in Xcel Energy Inc. during Q3, buying an additional 16,681 shares to bring its total holdings to 54,494 shares, valued at approximately $4.40 million. Xcel Energy (NASDAQ:XEL) has declared a quarterly dividend of $0.57 per share, yielding about 3.1%, and maintains a "Buy" consensus rating from analysts with an average price target of $87.21 despite missing Q3 EPS estimates. The company's stock trades at $74.26, with institutional investors owning 78.38% of the shares.

feed.title: Babcock & Wilcox to Participate in the 28th Annual Needham Growth Conference on January 16, 2026
feed.summary: Babcock & Wilcox Enterprises, Inc. (B&W) announced its participation in the 28th Annual Needham Growth Conference, which will be held virtually on January 16, 2026. B&W's Chairman and CEO, Kenneth Young, along with CFO Cameron Frymyer, will host one-on-one and small group meetings with investors during the event. The conference is a significant growth stock investing event, providing insights into the emerging growth company ecosystem.

feed.title: A Look At Nano Nuclear Energy (NNE) Valuation After Securities Class Action Dismissal
feed.summary: NANO Nuclear Energy (NNE) has drawn attention following the dismissal of a federal securities class action lawsuit, impacting its stock performance. Despite a recent 41.14% decline in its 90-day share price, the company's Price-to-Book ratio of 7.3x is in line with direct peers, indicating market confidence in its future projects given its pre-revenue status. However, NNE faces significant execution risks, including ongoing losses and uncertainty in commercializing its microreactor designs.

feed.title: Critical Metals Stock Surges Nearly 12% During Monday Pre-Market: What's Going On?
feed.summary: Shares of Critical Metals Corp. (CRML) surged nearly 12% in pre-market trading, sparked by former President Donald Trump's renewed discussions about acquiring Greenland for national security reasons. The company has a significant rare earth project in Greenland, making it a key player in the rare earths industry, and its stock has reacted similarly to Trump's past comments on the territory. However, concerns about the risks involved in developing mineral resources in politically sensitive areas and potential international ramifications, such as the stability of NATO, are also highlighted.

feed.title: FTC Solar Inc (NASDAQ:FTCI) Emerges as a High-Growth Momentum and Technical Trend Candidate
feed.summary: FTC Solar Inc (NASDAQ:FTCI) has been identified as a high-growth momentum and technical trend candidate, aligning with the Mark Minervini strategy. The company meets strict technical criteria, including price trading above key moving averages, strong relative strength, and being near 52-week highs. Additionally, FTCI exhibits robust fundamental momentum with significant sales growth, improving earnings trends, and positive analyst estimate revisions.

feed.title: Logistics company GXO sets Feb. 11 date to unpack 2025 results
feed.summary: GXO Logistics, Inc. (NYSE: GXO) announced it will host its fourth quarter and full-year 2025 earnings conference call and webcast on Wednesday, February 11, 2026, at 8:30 a.m. Eastern Time. The company's results will be released after market close on Tuesday, February 10, 2026, and made available on investors.gxo.com. Access details for the call and replay, including conference IDs, are provided for investors.

feed.title: Stifel raises TETRA Technologies stock price target to $13 on water desalination growth
feed.summary: Stifel has increased its price target for TETRA Technologies Inc. (TTI) to $13 from $9, maintaining a Buy rating, due to the strong growth prospects of its water desalination business. This new target implies a 32% upside from the current price, supported by a sum-of-the-parts valuation. The company also recently reported strong Q3 2025 earnings and announced a joint venture with Magrathea Metals for magnesium production.

feed.title: Iridian Asset Management LLC CT Buys New Holdings in SLB Limited $SLB
feed.summary: Iridian Asset Management LLC CT initiated a new position in SLB Limited during Q3, purchasing 60,916 shares valued at $2.09 million. Other institutional investors like Vanguard Group Inc. and Norges Bank also significantly adjusted their holdings, bringing total institutional ownership to 81.99%. Conversely, company insiders have been net sellers, liquidating 103,947 shares worth $3.87 million over the past 90 days.

feed.title: EOG Resources (NYSE:EOG) Passes the Peter Lynch GARP Investment Test
feed.summary: EOG Resources (NYSE:EOG) has been identified as a stock that aligns with Peter Lynch's "growth at a reasonable price" (GARP) investment philosophy. The company demonstrates strong performance in key metrics such as a 5-year EPS growth of 18.45%, a PEG ratio of 0.53, an ROE of 18.26%, and a Debt-to-Equity ratio of 0.25, all fitting Lynch's criteria for a well-run company with sustainable growth at a sensible price.

feed.title: The Freight Reset: J.B. Hunt’s Q4 Earnings to Signal the 2026 Economic Trajectory
feed.summary: J.B. Hunt Transport Services, Inc. is set to release its Q4 2025 earnings, which are expected to provide key insights into the state of the American supply chain and the broader economic trajectory for 2026. After a "freight recession" and a year of operational stabilization, analysts anticipate J.B. Hunt's report to indicate whether the market has turned a corner, driven by efficiency gains and a potential re-rating of transportation stocks as interest rate cuts stimulate spending. The report's implications extend beyond trucking, serving as a barometer for consumer demand and industrial health, with a focus on margin recovery over volume growth and strategic pivots like expanding into Last Mile services.

feed.title: The Descartes Systems Group Inc
feed.summary: Descartes Systems Group announced that Supergasbras, a leading Brazilian LPG distributor, has modernized its logistics operations using Descartes' cloud-based route planning and fleet management solution. The solution has significantly enhanced the efficiency of Supergasbras' distribution, managing over 400 trucks and 400,000 tons of LPG monthly, leading to benefits like faster route planning, fewer stockouts, and lower operational costs. This digital transformation project has also improved real-time visibility, integration with other enterprise systems, and overall reliability in deliveries across Brazil.

feed.title: Cummins Inc. Reinvents the Powertrain: How a 105?Year?Old Engine Giant Is Turning Into a Clean-Tech
feed.summary: Cummins Inc. is transforming from a diesel engine manufacturer into a diversified clean-power platform, focusing on hydrogen, batteries, and low-carbon engines to adapt to the electrifying transport market. The company is rebuilding its portfolio into a modular power platform under the Accelera by Cummins brand, offering advanced diesel, natural gas, hydrogen internal combustion, fuel cells, and battery-electric systems. This strategic shift aims to provide versatile powertrain solutions for various regulatory futures, positioning Cummins as an integrated supplier across multiple energy pathways.

feed.title: Comstock Metals Expands Network - Launches End-of-Life Solar Facility in California
feed.summary: Comstock Metals, a leader in solar panel recycling, has launched a new facility in California dedicated to handling end-of-life solar panels. This satellite facility, strategically located in California's Central Valley, will serve as a hub for collecting, preparing, and aggregating decommissioned photovoltaic panels before they are transported to Comstock Metals' fully permitted recycling facility in Nevada. The initiative aims to support California’s clean energy efforts by reducing landfill disposal and recycling critical materials from retired solar panels.

feed.title: What happens to old solar panels? One firm built a hub
feed.summary: Comstock Inc. (NYSE: LODE) has established a new satellite storage and prepping facility in California's Central Valley to handle end-of-life solar panels. This facility will centralize collection and logistics for decommissioned PV panels, preparing them for transport to Comstock Metals' fully permitted Nevada recycling facility. The move aims to support the growing solar market in the western U.S. by providing an environmentally responsible solution for recycling critical materials like aluminum, silver, copper, and gallium.

feed.title: Large powertrain maker secures control of key fuel injection supplier
feed.summary: China Yuchai International (CYD) announced that its subsidiary acquired a 27.97% equity interest in Nanyue Diankong (Hengyang) Industrial Technology (NYDK) for approximately RMB 176.2 million. This acquisition makes Yuchai the second-largest shareholder and, through a concerted action agreement, grants them operational control, including the right to nominate 6 of 9 directors and designate NYDK's general manager. The move strengthens Yuchai's supply chain for key fuel-injection components and has resulted in a significant positive market reaction, with CYD stock gaining 8.12%.

feed.title: Joby to expand manufacturing footprint with acquisition of new Ohio facility
feed.summary: Joby Aviation is expanding its manufacturing capabilities by acquiring a new 700,000-square-foot facility in Dayton, Ohio. This expansion aims to double production to four aircraft per month by 2027 and will begin operations this year, complementing Joby's existing California and Ohio facilities. The move is supported by significant policy momentum for Advanced Air Mobility (AAM) in the U.S., with Joby highlighting Dayton's historical significance in aerospace innovation.
feed.source: JEC - Connecting the World with Composites
feed.source_domain: JEC - Connecting the World with Composites

feed.title: ArcelorMittal Poland launches large-scale energy project in Krakow
feed.summary: ArcelorMittal is investing over PLN 200 million in a large-scale energy project at its Krakow plant in Poland. This initiative includes constructing a new boiler house, installing a closed-loop heat recovery system, and building a power substation. The project aims to significantly reduce natural gas consumption and cut CO2 emissions by 115,000 tons annually, with completion expected by the end of 2027.

feed.title: Darling Ingredients stock price target raised to $50 by Jefferies
feed.summary: Jefferies has increased its price target for Darling Ingredients (NYSE:DAR) to $50, maintaining a Buy rating and noting the stock is undervalued according to InvestingPro analysis. The firm anticipates strong Q4 EBITDA driven by its Feed and Diamond Green Diesel segments, despite potential Q1 headwinds from feedstock pricing and lower 45Z credits for sustainable aviation fuel. Darling Ingredients recently reported mixed Q3 2025 results, with lower-than-expected EPS but higher revenue, and announced significant production tax credit sales and a new joint venture for its collagen and gelatin businesses.

feed.title: How smarter routing is keeping cooking gas flowing across Brazil
feed.summary: Descartes Systems Group announced that Supergasbras, a leading LPG distributor in Brazil, has modernized its logistics operations using Descartes' cloud-based route planning and fleet management solution. This implementation covers over 400 trucks and 900 personnel, transporting more than 400,000 tons of LPG monthly. The changes have led to faster and safer route planning, reduced stockouts, lower operational costs, and improved delivery reliability, enhancing Supergasbras's digital transformation.

feed.title: Scorpio Tankers Inc. Announces a Vessel Sale Agreement
feed.summary: Scorpio Tankers Inc. has announced an agreement to sell its 2015-built LR2 product tanker, STI Kingsway, for $57.5 million, with the sale expected to close by the second quarter of 2026. This is part of a larger plan to sell four LR2 tankers and acquire newbuildings, including four MR newbuildings, two VLCC newbuildings, and two LR2 newbuildings, expanding and modernizing its fleet. The company continues to be a major provider of marine transportation for petroleum products globally.

feed.title: Scorpio Tankers stock maintains Buy rating at BTIG on strong market outlook By Investing.com
feed.summary: BTIG has reiterated its Buy rating and $75.00 price target for Scorpio Tankers (NYSE:STNG) due to strong market conditions, increased timecharter activity, and a positive outlook for an extended cycle. Geopolitical factors also contribute to market inefficiencies, which Scorpio Tankers is well-positioned to navigate. The company's financial health and upcoming fleet modernization through new vessel acquisitions and sales underscore its strategic efforts.

feed.title: Scorpio Tankers Inc. Enters Agreement to Sell LR2 Product Tanker STI Kingsway for $57.5 Million
feed.summary: Scorpio Tankers Inc. has announced the sale of its LR2 product tanker, STI Kingsway, for $57.5 million, with the transaction expected to close in early 2026. This sale is part of a broader strategy to sell four LR2 tankers while simultaneously expanding its fleet with new constructions, including MR, VLCC, and LR2 newbuildings scheduled for delivery between 2026 and 2028. The company's press release highlights both potential positives like enhanced liquidity and fleet modernization, and potential negatives such as concerns over fleet downsizing or financial repositioning.

feed.title: Frontier Airlines Remains A 'Hold' As Strategy Shift Has Yet To Crystalize (NASDAQ:ULCC)
feed.summary: Frontier Group Holdings (ULCC) has outperformed the S&P 500 but now trades above the analyst's price target of $5.25. While facing near-term revenue declines, strategic shifts such as launching first class and growing loyalty programs could aid EBITDA margin recovery, alongside easing competitive pressures as Spirit Airlines reduces overlapping routes. However, the company faces high capital needs and negative operating cash flow, maintaining a "Hold" rating due to fragile upside dependent on uncertain cash flow and reliance on debt for fleet expansion.

feed.title: USA Compression Partners stock price target raised to $25 from $23 at Mizuho
feed.summary: Mizuho increased its price target for USA Compression Partners (NYSE: USAC) from $23 to $25, while maintaining a Neutral rating. The firm noted USA Compression's outperformance against peers, attributed to positive natural gas macro trends and increased exposure to dry gas basins. Recent performance includes a 14.5% one-year total return and a "nicely accretive" acquisition of J-W Power, which is expected to accelerate deleveraging and improve margins.

feed.title: J.B. Hunt Gears Up to Report Q4 Earnings: Is a Beat in Store?
feed.summary: J.B. Hunt Transport Services, Inc. (JBHT) is set to announce its fourth-quarter 2025 results on January 15, with the Zacks Consensus Estimate for earnings at $1.78 per share, suggesting a 16.34% year-over-year increase. The company's revenues are projected to be $3.09 billion, a slight decline from the previous year. Factors like decreased Intermodal revenues and higher net interest expenses could impact the bottom line, though a positive Earnings ESP suggests an earnings beat.

feed.title: KBR Awarded FEED for Coastal Bend LNG Project
feed.summary: KBR has been awarded the front-end engineering design (FEED) contract for Coastal Bend’s natural gas liquefaction and export facility on the Texas Gulf Coast. The project aims to reduce greenhouse gas emissions by utilizing ConocoPhillips’ Optimized Cascade® Process (COP OCP) technology. KBR will lead the FEED effort, coordinating between parties and supporting FERC filings, highlighting its leadership in efficient and scalable energy infrastructure.

feed.title: New Texas Gulf Coast LNG plant taps KBR to design lower-carbon setup
feed.summary: KBR (NYSE: KBR) has been awarded the front-end engineering design (FEED) contract for Coastal Bend LNG's natural gas liquefaction and export facility on the Texas Gulf Coast. The project aims to reduce greenhouse gas emissions by utilizing ConocoPhillips' Optimized Cascade® Process technology. KBR will lead the FEED for the entire inside battery limits scope, including liquefaction, nitrogen rejection, gas treatment, and heavy hydrocarbon removal, emphasizing its expertise in efficient and low-carbon LNG infrastructure.

feed.title: New Jersey Resources (NYSE:NJR) Ticks All The Boxes When It Comes To Earnings Growth
feed.summary: New Jersey Resources (NYSE:NJR) shows positive earnings growth, with EPS increasing by 5.2% annually over the last three years and revenue growing 13% to US$2.0b in the past year. The company also benefits from significant insider ownership, valued at US$26m, aligning insider and shareholder interests. These factors suggest that NJR is a growing business worth monitoring.

feed.title: Tesla Rival Xpeng Hires Morgan Stanley, JPMorgan To Prepare Hong Kong Listing For Aeroht: Report
feed.summary: Xpeng, a Chinese automaker and Tesla rival, has reportedly engaged Morgan Stanley and JPMorgan & Chase Co. to manage a potential public listing in Hong Kong for its flying car unit, Aeroht. This move aligns with Xpeng's broader strategy to expand into "physical AI" and Robotaxi services, including a trial collaboration with Alibaba's Amap mapping platform by 2026. The report also highlights broader developments in air mobility, with Tesla's CEO Elon Musk hinting at hovering capabilities for the Roadster and Transportation Secretary Sean Duffy promoting air taxis.

feed.title: Consumers Energy Stands with Customers on Energy Costs, Continues Its Commitment, Provides $5 Million to Lower Bills
feed.summary: Consumers Energy is investing $5 million to help Michigan customers and communities manage energy costs, emphasizing its commitment to affordable energy. The funds, which are not derived from customer bills, will be distributed through partnerships with various agencies to provide direct assistance and energy-saving programs. This initiative is part of a broader, ongoing effort to ensure energy remains accessible and to support customers facing economic pressures.

feed.title: XCF Global Evaluating Financing Alternatives to Drive Growth in SAF Platform
feed.summary: XCF Global is exploring financing options, including debt financing with Bank of America, to fund the expansion of its Sustainable Aviation Fuel (SAF) production platform, starting with the New Rise Reno 2 facility. This initiative aligns with a memorandum of understanding with BGN INT US LLC for global distribution and aims to capitalize on the rapidly growing SAF market, projected to exceed $25 billion by 2030. The company's CEO, Chris Cooper, emphasized the criticality of expanding SAF production to meet global decarbonization targets.

feed.title: USA Compression Partners stock price target raised to $25 from $23 at Mizuho
feed.summary: Mizuho has raised its price target for USA Compression Partners LP (NYSE:USAC) to $25 from $23, maintaining a Neutral rating, citing the company's outperformance, positive natural gas market momentum, and the accretive acquisition of J-W Power. The new target aligns with InvestingPro's fair value assessment, suggesting the stock is slightly undervalued. Mizuho also noted improved margins, lower leverage, and the potential for future growth investments or cash distribution increases.

feed.title: HF Sinclair Completes Acquisition of Industrial Oils Unlimited
feed.summary: HF Sinclair Corporation (NYSE: DINO) has successfully completed its acquisition of Industrial Oils Unlimited, LLC (IOU), a supplier of industrial lubricants and specialty fluids. This transaction, closed on January 8, 2026, integrates IOU's operations into HF Sinclair's Lubricants & Specialties business segment. The acquisition is expected to expand HF Sinclair's lubricant offerings across the United States, supporting portfolio growth and strengthening its position in the lubricants market.

feed.title: Lithium's Resurgence: Scotiabank Upgrades Albemarle as EV Supply Chain Braces for New Growth Phase
feed.summary: Scotiabank has upgraded Albemarle Corporation (ALB) to "Sector Outperform" with a price target hike from $85.00 to $200.00, signaling a bullish shift for the lithium market. This upgrade reflects the clearing of excess inventory, practicing of supply discipline by producers, and an anticipated 30-40% growth in global lithium demand for 2026. The move suggests a V-shaped recovery for lithium prices, benefiting major producers like Albemarle, but potentially increasing input costs for EV manufacturers.

feed.title: Lithium's Resurgence: Scotiabank Upgrades Albemarle as EV Supply Chain Braces for New Growth Phase
feed.summary: Scotiabank has upgraded Albemarle Corporation (ALB) to "Sector Outperform" and significantly raised its price target from $85 to $200, signaling a bullish outlook for the lithium market. This upgrade reflects a belief that the market has cleared excess inventory, supply discipline has tightened conditions, and demand from EVs, BESS, and AI data centers is poised for significant growth in 2026. The shift marks the end of a multi-year bear cycle for lithium, with implications for EV manufacturers, battery producers, and the potential for increased consolidation in the mining sector.

feed.title: BofA Hikes First Solar Target (FSLR) to $291, Eyeing a 2026 Stock-Picker’s Cycle
feed.summary: Bank of America raised its price target for First Solar (FSLR) to $291 from $255, maintaining a Buy rating and forecasting 2026 as a "stock-picker's cycle" for the solar industry. This means individual company performance will be key, rather than broad sector trends. Other analysts have also adjusted their targets, with Guggenheim raising its target to $312 and Jefferies downgrading to Hold due to concerns about the 2026 outlook and potential tariff impacts.

feed.title: Piper Sandler Upgrades HF Sinclair (DINO) to $68 as 2026 West Coast Supply Tightens
feed.summary: Piper Sandler has upgraded HF Sinclair (DINO) to Overweight with a $68 price target, citing a favorable refining environment and the company's strong West Coast exposure. This upgrade positions HF Sinclair as a top pick among small-to-mid-cap refiners due to an expected tightening West Coast market. Mizuho also increased its price target for DINO to $63, maintaining an Outperform rating, and views US oil and gas companies as undervalued despite current market sentiment.

feed.title: Why Did LODE Stock Gain In Pre-Market Today?
feed.summary: Comstock (LODE) shares rose in pre-market trading after its subsidiary, Comstock Metals LLC, secured a new facility in California. This new hub will support the company's solar panel recycling operations by handling the collection and preparation of decommissioned panels. The move comes after Comstock received regulatory approval to process waste solar panels at its Nevada recycling facility, with the California site aiming to streamline logistics and reduce costs for clients.

feed.title: Boeing to Release Fourth Quarter Results on January 27
feed.summary: The Boeing Company announced that it will release its financial results for the fourth quarter of 2025 on Tuesday, January 27. President and CEO Kelly Ortberg and Executive Vice President and CFO Jay Malave will discuss the results and company outlook during a 10:30 a.m. ET conference call. Event details including the webcast, news release, and presentation materials will be made available on Boeing's investor relations website.

feed.title: RBC Capital reaffirms Matador Resources stock rating with $62 target
feed.summary: RBC Capital has reiterated its Outperform rating and $62.00 price target for Matador Resources Company (NYSE:MTDR), expecting the company to recover its standing as a favored small and mid-cap stock despite a recent 28.96% price decline. The firm highlighted Matador's consistent performance, upcoming catalysts, and strategic value drivers like the San Mateo Midstream asset, along with recent financial reaffirmations and strong analyst sentiment. Factors such as dividend yield, P/E ratio, and potential M&A activity also position Matador attractively.

feed.title: Caterpillar Expands Collaboration with NVIDIA to Apply AI and Robotics Across Heavy Industry
feed.summary: Caterpillar Inc. has announced an expanded collaboration with NVIDIA to integrate AI and robotics across its construction, mining, energy, and manufacturing operations. This partnership aims to enhance machine performance, safety, efficiency, and supply chain management through NVIDIA's computing platforms, including the Jetson Thor for AI-assisted operations and the Cat AI Assistant. The initiative also involves using NVIDIA's AI infrastructure for manufacturing optimization and digital twins, supporting Caterpillar's goal of improving productivity and operational reliability for its global customers.

feed.title: Himalaya Shipping seals fresh index-linked deal
feed.summary: Himalaya Shipping has secured a new 11 to 14-month index-linked time charter for its 2023-built newcastlemax vessel, Mount Ita, with a significant premium over the Baltic 5TC benchmark. This deal, set to begin in late January, allows for conversion to fixed rates based on the FFA curve, aligning with the company's strategy to balance spot market exposure with the flexibility to lock in forward earnings. The company, led by CEO Lars-Christian Svensen, operates a fleet of 12 LNG dual-fuel newcastlemax bulkers.

feed.title: Canadian National Railway (CNI) Receives a Hold from Bank of America Securities
feed.summary: Bank of America Securities analyst Ken Hoexter maintained a Hold rating on Canadian National Railway (CNI) with a $107 price target. Despite the Hold rating, the consensus among analysts for CNI is a Moderate Buy with an average price target of $113.43. The Q3 earnings report showed revenue of C$4.17 billion and a net profit of C$1.14 billion, indicating growth from the previous year, though corporate insider sentiment for the stock is negative due to increased selling activity.

feed.title: B.Riley downgrades Triumph Financial stock rating to Neutral on valuation
feed.summary: B.Riley has downgraded Triumph Financial (NASDAQ:TFIN) from Buy to Neutral, maintaining a $70 price target, as the stock approaches this valuation. The downgrade is primarily due to the current valuation, with shares trading at 30 times the firm's 2026 EPS estimate, and concerns regarding a seasonally weak first quarter. Investors are now looking to the upcoming earnings report for more clarity on trucking recovery and the performance of Triumph's fintech offerings.

feed.title: Vistra Energy stock price target raised to $244 from $230 at BMO Capital
feed.summary: BMO Capital has increased its price target for Vistra Energy (NYSE:VST) to $244 from $230, maintaining an Outperform rating, following Vistra's 20-year power purchase agreements with Meta for approximately 2,600 MW of power. This deal, along with revised share repurchase and debt paydown assumptions, is expected to boost Vistra's adjusted EBITDA and free cash flow per share. Despite a high P/E ratio, the company remains profitable, and management has been actively buying back shares.

feed.title: Trump threatens to sideline Exxon from Venezuela's oil: 'They're playing too cute’
feed.summary: President Trump has threatened to exclude Exxon Mobil from Venezuela's oil industry after its CEO, Darren Woods, stated that the market is "uninvestable" in its current state. Trump, who is pushing for U.S. oil companies to invest $100 billion in Venezuela, expressed dissatisfaction with Exxon's response, implying other companies are more willing. Exxon requires significant changes to commercial frameworks, the legal system, and hydrocarbon laws before reconsidering substantial investment in Venezuela, where it previously had assets seized.

feed.title: Plug Power sells its 49% stake in Korean hydrogen joint venture SK Plug Hyverse
feed.summary: Plug Power has sold its 49% stake in the Korean hydrogen joint venture SK Plug Hyverse. The US manufacturer, which had initially pledged $365 million, only contributed $49.8 million to the company formed with the SK conglomerate.

feed.title: Kosmos Energy (KOS) Shares Operational Update, Bernstein Remains Bullish
feed.summary: Kosmos Energy (KOS) provided an operational and financial update, detailing progress such as the completion of the second Jubilee producer well in Ghana, significantly increasing Jubilee output. Bernstein reiterated a 'Market Perform' rating for KOS but reduced its price target from $1.70 to $0.80, citing expected short-term oil price volatility while projecting longer-term strength. The company also secured license extensions for its Jubilee and TEN oilfields until 2040 and confirmed the GTA LNG project reached its nameplate capacity.

feed.title: Will Rising Subsea Robotics Demand and Defense Expansion Change Oceaneering International's (OII) Narrative?
feed.summary: Oceaneering International (OII) is gaining investor attention due to increased demand for its subsea robotics and offshore services, alongside an expanding defense and non-energy robotics segment. While analysts maintain a "hold" rating, they have slightly raised price targets, reflecting cautious optimism about the company's ability to diversify revenue streams. Despite this growth, Oceaneering's narrative remains tied to the cyclical nature of offshore oil and gas spending, which still presents a significant risk.

feed.title: Trump Weighs Blocking Exxon’s Return to Venezuela
feed.summary: US President Donald Trump is considering blocking Exxon Mobil's return to Venezuela due to the company's cautious stance on investing there. Exxon's CEO cited the need for durable investment protections and legal reforms in Venezuela, while ConocoPhillips's CEO discussed debt restructuring. Trump indicated that the US would decide which firms can operate in Venezuela and signed an executive order to protect Venezuelan oil revenues in US Treasury accounts.

feed.title: Construction begins on Royal Caribbean's new cruise terminal in Miami
feed.summary: Royal Caribbean Group and PortMiami have commenced construction on a new Cruise Terminal G at PortMiami, following a groundbreaking ceremony. The $345 million project, a collaboration with Lemartec-NV2A joint venture, will feature a modern terminal capable of accommodating up to 7,000 passengers, a multi-level parking garage, and intermodal facilities. Slated for completion in late 2027, the terminal is designed for efficiency and energy optimization.

feed.title: JPMorgan Chase Takes Notifiable 6.9% Stake in Hexagon Composites
feed.summary: JPMorgan Chase & Co., through J.P. Morgan Securities PLC, has acquired a 6.929% stake in Hexagon Composites ASA, holding over 17 million shares as of January 7, 2026. This significant investment crosses the 5% ownership threshold, positioning JPMorgan as a key institutional shareholder and possibly indicating growing international investor interest in Hexagon Composites. The latest analyst rating for HXGCF stock is a Hold with a price target of NOK10.00.

feed.title: COMSTOCK RESOURCES, INC. ANNOUNCES FOURTH QUARTER 2025
feed.summary: Comstock Resources, Inc. (NYSE:CRK) is scheduled to release its fourth quarter 2025 financial results on February 11, 2026, after the market closes. The company will host a conference call on February 12, 2026, at 10:00 a.m. CT to discuss these results, with registration required for telephonic participation and a live webcast available for listen-only access. A replay of the call will be accessible for twelve months.

feed.title: Allegiant To Acquire Sun Country In $1.5 Billion Merger
feed.summary: Allegiant Travel Company announced its acquisition of Sun Country Airlines for $1.5 billion, creating one of the largest leisure-focused airlines in the U.S. This cash-and-stock deal is expected to expand routes, integrate loyalty programs for 22 million passengers, and generate $140 million in annual synergies. Despite potential regulatory challenges, the companies are confident due to minimal route overlap and a focus on leisure travel.

feed.title: RETRANSMISSION: Cruz Battery Metals Engages Stantec for Maiden Resource Estimate and Technical Report on the Solar Lithium Project in Nevada, Directly Bordering American Lithium
feed.summary: Cruz Battery Metals Corp. has engaged Stantec Consulting Ltd. to prepare a Maiden Resource Estimate and Technical Report for its Solar Lithium Project in Nevada, which borders American Lithium Corp.'s TLC project. The company has discovered lithium in all 14 drill holes on the project and sees this as an opportune time to advance the project given rising lithium prices and renewed investor interest in the sector. Cruz aims to become more active in 2026 and beyond, with several battery metals-focused projects across the USA and Canada.

feed.title: Hertz Global Holdings (HTZ) Ordered to Pay Over $270 Million in Bond Premiums
feed.summary: Hertz Global Holdings (HTZ) has been ordered to pay over $270 million in bond premiums and interest after the U.S. Supreme Court declined to hear its appeal regarding bond payments. This ruling, which favors unsecured bondholders, will significantly increase Hertz's debt liability and has already caused its stock price to fall. Analysts maintain a generally negative outlook for HTZ, with an average 1-year price target of $3.00, reflecting concerns about the company's financial health and future strategic plans.

feed.title: A Chinese EV maker is rolling out self-driving tech to everyday cars
feed.summary: XPENG (XPEV) has launched its 2026 P7+ flagship model, featuring significant AI advancements and confirming global expansion plans. The company reported impressive global delivery growth in 2025, including strong international and European sales. XPENG also unveiled its VLA2.0 autonomous driving AI, which will be deployed to customer vehicles starting March 2026, marking a pivotal step in its transition to an AI-driven technology leader.

feed.title: XPeng (XPEV) Valuation Check As AI Robotaxis And Humanoid Robots Expand Its Auto Tech Ambitions
feed.summary: XPeng (XPEV) recently reported strong December and full-year 2025 deliveries, with fresh attention also drawn to its "physical AI" expansion into robotaxis and humanoid robots. Despite a mixed short-term stock performance, a 1-year total shareholder return of 63.83% indicates positive momentum. Analysts currently view XPEV as undervalued at US$28.24 per share, significantly above its last close of US$20.02, though some market ratios suggest expectations might already be high.

feed.title: NANO Nuclear Signs Memorandum of Understanding with Ameresco to Explore the Deployment of Advanced Microreactor Technologies on Federal and Commercial Sites
feed.summary: NANO Nuclear Energy Inc. has signed an MOU with Ameresco, Inc. to explore integrating NANO Nuclear's microreactor technologies with Ameresco's EPC capabilities for deployment on federal and commercial sites. This collaboration aims to develop infrastructure for advanced modular microreactors like KRONOS MMR™, ZEUS™, and LOKI MMR™ to meet evolving energy needs and support the U.S. energy transition, especially for AI, data centers, and other energy-intensive applications. The companies will assess regulatory, financial, and siting factors, and potentially coordinate on government funding.

feed.title: Congo LNG Enters Phase 2
feed.summary: Eni S.p.A. has launched Phase 2 of the Congo LNG Project, aiming to export its first liquefied natural gas cargo in early 2026. This phase introduces three new production platforms, the Scarabeo 5 for gas treatment and compression, and the Nguya FLNG for liquefaction, boosting the project's total capacity to 3 MTPA. The project, which came online ahead of schedule, integrates advanced technologies for a reduced carbon footprint and flexible gas processing.

feed.title: Entergy Texas Completes Millbend Substation And Transmission Project, Providing Nearly 100 MW For East Montgomery County
feed.summary: Entergy Texas has completed the Millbend substation and transmission line project in East Montgomery County, designed to provide nearly 100 megawatts of electricity to the rapidly growing area. This project, part of the STEP Ahead initiative, aims to enhance grid reliability, reduce strain on existing infrastructure, and improve resilience against severe weather events. Local leaders lauded Entergy's proactive approach to infrastructure development, emphasizing its importance for community security and continued growth.

feed.title: Trump 'Inclined' To Keep Exxon Mobil Out Of Venezuela: 'Didn't Like Their Response'
feed.summary: Former President Donald Trump is considering excluding Exxon Mobil (NYSE: XOM) from a Venezuelan investment initiative due to the company's CEO labeling the country "uninvestable." In contrast, Chevron (NYSE: CVX), which already operates in Venezuela, expressed optimism about increasing its production there. Trump had encouraged U.S. oil companies to invest $100 billion in Venezuela's oil sector, an idea met with skepticism by many industry leaders.

feed.title: Woodside Energy shares hold near one-month peak as oil jitters keep traders on edge
feed.summary: Woodside Energy (WDS) shares rose 0.6% to a near one-month high, reaching A$23.72, driven by fluctuating oil prices influenced by Iranian supply concerns and potential Venezuelan barrel returns. Investors are closely watching Woodside's upcoming Q4 2025 earnings report on January 28 and the full-year 2025 annual report on February 24 for insights into production, costs, and guidance. The energy sector's performance remains tied to crude prices, with potential downside if supply disruptions fail to materialize and cause prices to drop.

feed.title: Tamboran appoints Todd Abbott as CEO
feed.summary: Tamboran Resources Corporation has appointed Todd Abbott as its new Chief Executive Officer, effective January 15, 2026. Abbott brings over 25 years of upstream oil and gas experience, including significant roles at Seneca Resources and Marathon Oil, and will lead Tamboran through a pivotal development phase in the Beetaloo Basin. His appointment is expected to drive operational performance and cost efficiency as the company aims to provide energy security to Australia.

feed.title: Xpeng is said to hire banks for flying car unit IPO in Hong Kong
feed.summary: Xpeng, the Chinese electric-vehicle maker, has reportedly hired JPMorgan Chase & Co and Morgan Stanley to work on an initial public offering for its flying car unit, Xpeng Aeroht, in Hong Kong. The company has confidentially filed for a share sale that could occur as early as this year. Xpeng aims for its core automotive business to fund frontier technologies like its flying car unit, which plans to deliver its first mass-produced vehicle in late 2026.

feed.title: Vista Energy, S.A.B. de C.V. - Sponsored ADR (NYSE:VIST) Given Average Recommendation of "Moderate Buy" by Brokerages
feed.summary: Vista Energy, S.A.B. de C.V. (NYSE:VIST) has received an average rating of "Moderate Buy" from eight brokerages, with an average one-year price target of $68.44. The company recently reported strong earnings, beating consensus estimates with $1.48 EPS and $706.1 million in revenue. Institutional investors hold a significant portion of the company's stock, and analysts expect 5.74 EPS for the current year.

feed.title: How EPD’s Higher Payout and Modest Buybacks Have Changed Its Investment Story
feed.summary: Enterprise Products Partners L.P. recently increased its quarterly cash distribution and repurchased units, reinforcing its income-focused investment story. While this emphasizes returning capital to unitholders, the company's reliance on steady volumes, leverage, and ongoing capital projects, along with a significant debt load, remains central to its investment narrative. Investors should monitor cash generation against distribution and debt obligations as market conditions evolve.

feed.title: Frontier Group (ULCC) Is Up 9.5% After Naming Dempsey CEO And Raising Q4 EPS Outlook
feed.summary: Frontier Group (ULCC) saw its stock rise 9.5% after appointing James G. Dempsey as its new President, CEO, and board member. The company also raised its fourth-quarter 2025 adjusted diluted earnings per share outlook, attributing the stronger revenue to the new leadership and improved demand. This move signals continuity in its ultra-low-cost model, with analysts highlighting the potential for sustainable profits despite industry challenges.

feed.title: Ball Corp.: How a ‘Boring’ Can Company Became a Climate-Tech Powerhouse
feed.summary: Ball Corp., known for aluminum cans, has transformed itself into a climate-tech powerhouse by positioning aluminum packaging as sustainable and integrating its aerospace precision engineering. The company emphasizes material circularity, decarbonization, and brand innovation in its packaging, while its aerospace division contributes to advanced sensing and climate monitoring. This dual focus allows Ball Corp. to navigate regulatory pressures and consumer demand for sustainability, competing effectively against both metal and plastic rivals by offering a comprehensive, climate-friendly solution.

feed.title: Comstock Metals Expands Network - Launches End-of-Life Solar Facility in California
feed.summary: Comstock Metals, a division of Comstock Inc., has launched its first satellite storage and prepping facility in California's Central Valley. This new facility will serve as a critical hub for the responsible collection, preparation, and aggregation of decommissioned photovoltaic panels, supporting the growing solar energy market in California and eventually shipping panels to Nevada for closed-loop recycling. The move aims to optimize logistics, reduce landfill disposal, and recover critical minerals from end-of-life solar panels.

feed.title: Blink Charging (BLNK) Stock Soars—Key Information You Should Be Aware Of
feed.summary: Blink Charging (BLNK) stock surged by 22.2% following investor optimism regarding its growth strategy and expansion plans for its fast-charging network, funded by a recent $20 million public offering. Despite this recent jump, which saw shares close at $0.92, the stock remains 63.3% below its 52-week peak of $2.50 from October 2025 and has significantly underperformed over a five-year period. The company's stock is known for its volatility, influenced by broader market trends and shifts in investor sentiment towards the EV and tech sectors.

feed.title: Air Taxi Manufacturer Acquires Ohio Assembly Plant
feed.summary: Joby Aviation Inc., an electric air taxi manufacturer, has acquired a new 700,000-square-foot assembly plant in Dayton, Ohio. This expansion aims to double production to four aircraft per month by 2027 and complements their existing facilities in California and Ohio. Operations at the new Ohio plant are slated to begin later this year.

feed.title: Comparative Study: Tesla And Industry Competitors In Automobiles Industry
feed.summary: This article provides an in-depth comparative analysis of Tesla (NASDAQ: TSLA) against its key competitors in the Automobiles industry. It examines Tesla's financial metrics, market position, and growth potential, highlighting its high valuation ratios (P/E, P/B, P/S) compared to industry averages, efficient use of equity (ROE), and robust revenue growth. The study also notes Tesla's lower EBITDA and gross profit, along with a favorable debt-to-equity ratio, indicating a strong financial position relative to its peers.

feed.title: Coastal Bend LNG Selects KBR and Técnicas Reunidas for FEED and EPC
feed.summary: Coastal Bend LNG has chosen KBR, Inc. and Técnicas Reunidas for the front-end engineering and design (FEED) of its natural gas liquefaction and export facility on the Texas Gulf Coast. The collaboration will utilize ConocoPhillips’ Optimized Cascade® Process to ensure cost-competitiveness and mitigate greenhouse gas emissions. Following a positive final investment decision, KBR and Técnicas Reunidas will proceed with the engineering, procurement, and construction (EPC) phase of the project, aiming to deliver low-carbon LNG to global markets.

feed.title: MOKOSMART and Silicon Labs Revolutionize Cold Chain Monitoring
feed.summary: MOKOSMART and Silicon Labs have partnered to launch two new Bluetooth beacons, the M4 Pro and S05T temperature loggers, designed to revolutionize cold chain transportation. These devices, integrating Silicon Labs' ultra-low-power BG22 SoCs with MOKOSMART's robust hardware, offer real-time, high-accuracy temperature tracking and extended battery life. The collaboration aims to address critical transparency and visibility challenges in the growing cold chain market, which is projected to reach $372 billion by 2029.

feed.title: Canaan (CAN) Growth Momentum Strengthens Following 3.0 MW Proof-of-Concept Project Announcement
feed.summary: Canaan Inc. announced a 3.0 MW proof-of-concept project with Bitforest Investment in Manitoba, Canada, aimed at monetizing waste heat from crypto mining for agricultural applications. This 24-month pilot project involves deploying 360 Avalon A1566HA-460T liquid-cooled servers and four cooling modules, with the goal of capturing up to 90% of consumed electricity to preheat water for greenhouses. The initiative reinforces Canaan's strategy to position high-density computing as an energy-efficient infrastructure asset, highlighting benefits like low power costs and potential for replication in colder regions.

feed.title: Synopsys Unveils Vision for AI-driven, Software-defined Automotive Engineering
feed.summary: Synopsys showcased AI-driven and software-defined engineering solutions at CES 2026, aiming to accelerate automotive innovation, reduce costs, and shorten release cycles. The company emphasizes virtualizing design, integration, and prototyping to meet the demands of software-defined mobility and AI integration in vehicles. Synopsys' solutions, supported by collaborations with industry leaders like Arbe Robotics, Audi, and Samsung, are designed to enhance safety, optimize performance, and create new revenue streams for automakers.

feed.title: Assessing Calumet’s (CLMT) Valuation After Its New Senior Unsecured Notes Offering
feed.summary: Calumet (CLMT) recently completed a $400.9 million senior unsecured notes offering, impacting its capital structure and future interest. Despite a forecasted 2025 net loss and a recent share price decline over the past year, the stock is considered 7.4% undervalued, trading at $19.87 against a fair value of $21.45. This valuation largely hinges on the anticipated success of its MaxSAF 150 project, expected to begin production in early 2026 and significantly boost revenues and EBITDA margins through sustainable aviation fuel production.

feed.title: Heavy Transportation Equipment Stocks Q3 Results: Benchmarking Cummins (NYSE:CMI)
feed.summary: This article analyzes the Q3 earnings of several heavy transportation equipment companies, focusing on Cummins (CMI). It highlights that the sector is investing in automated and connected vehicles, as well as electric mobility solutions, but is susceptible to economic cycles. Cummins reported strong Q3 results, exceeding revenue and EBITDA expectations, while Greenbrier (GBX) had a good quarter but saw its stock decline. Wabash (WNC) delivered the weakest full-year guidance, and Oshkosh (OSK) and Federal Signal (FSS) also had their Q3 results reviewed.

feed.title: TotalEnergies Gets New Block around Lebanon-Israel Border
feed.summary: TotalEnergies and its partners have signed an agreement with the Lebanese government to explore Block 8, located near the Israeli-Lebanese maritime border, despite previous exploration in Block 9 yielding no positive results. The consortium, consisting of TotalEnergies, Eni SpA, and QatarEnergy, plans to conduct a 3D seismic survey in Block 8 to assess its exploration potential. This move follows the 2022 agreement between Lebanon and Israel to delineate their maritime border, which included provisions for hydrocarbon exploration in the region.

feed.title: China Yuchai acquires 83.9 mil shares in Nanyue Diankong Industrial Tech Company for RMB176.2 mil
feed.summary: China Yuchai International, a subsidiary of Hong Leong Asia, has acquired 83.9 million shares in Nanyue Diankong (Hengyang) Industrial Technology Company (NYDK) for RMB176.2 million ($32.48 million).
