This acquisition makes China Yuchai the second-largest shareholder and, through a concerted action agreement with NYDK's largest shareholder, gives it operational control over the company. The move aims to enhance Yuchai's supply chain for key components used in its powertrain solutions.

feed.title: Discipline and Rules-Based Execution in GLNG Response
feed.summary: This article provides an in-depth AI-generated analysis for Golar Lng Limited (NASDAQ: GLNG), highlighting strong near and mid-term sentiment, a significant risk-reward short setup, and a mid-channel oscillation pattern. It outlines three distinct trading strategies—Position, Momentum Breakout, and Risk Hedging—with specific entry, target, and stop-loss levels for different risk profiles. The analysis also includes multi-timeframe signal strengths, support, and resistance levels to aid in trading decisions.

feed.title: KEPCO Partners with Burns & McDonnell for U.S. Grid Project
feed.summary: Korea Electric Power Corp. (KEPCO) has signed a 765kV transmission grid technology consulting contract with Burns & McDonnell, building on a previous cooperation agreement. KEPCO will provide technical consulting for Burns & McDonnell's U.S. 765kV transmission grid projects, aiming to capture a share of the expanding ultra-high voltage transmission grid market in the U.S., estimated at $60 billion. This partnership seeks to combine KEPCO's advanced transmission technology with Burns & McDonnell’s local expertise to accelerate project development and technology exports in the U.S. energy sector.

feed.title: DHT Holdings stock faces Monday test as oil rally and VLCC rates collide
feed.summary: DHT Holdings (DHT) is facing a critical Monday as an oil rally, driven by supply concerns in Iran and Venezuela, puts crude-shipping stocks in the spotlight. While DHT's stock slipped slightly on Friday, investors are closely watching firming VLCC freight rates and broader macroeconomic news. The company recently announced the delivery of a new VLCC and the sale of two older ones, positioning itself for future market movements.

feed.title: Frontline (FRO) stock: $2 billion VLCC swap puts tanker owner back in focus before Monday’s open
feed.summary: Frontline (FRO) announced a significant fleet overhaul, swapping eight older VLCCs for nine new, scrubber-equipped ECO VLCC newbuild contracts in a deal worth over $2 billion. This move, which pushes cash outlays into 2026-27 and involves Frontline's largest shareholder, aims to modernize its fleet to 81 vessels. The transaction, reported to yield about $486 million in net cash after debt repayment, places the company under scrutiny regarding its funding package and the related-party aspect of the purchase, with traders closely watching freight rates and fuel costs.

feed.title: Hawaiian Electric stock jumps 8% into the weekend — here’s what matters before HE trades again
feed.summary: Hawaiian Electric Industries (HE) stock surged 8.1% on Friday, closing at $14.77, fueled by a weaker-than-expected jobs report and falling Treasury yields which buoyed the utilities sector. Investors are closely watching the stock, especially with upcoming oral arguments in the Hawaii Supreme Court on Jan. 27 regarding a case involving HE and insurers, and lingering legal risks from the 2023 Maui wildfires, including a recent $47.75 million shareholder settlement. Wall Street analysts maintain a "Hold" rating with a target price below Friday's close, highlighting continued legal and financial uncertainties.

feed.title: International Seaways stock in focus as U.S. flags possible Venezuela sanctions shift next week
feed.summary: International Seaways (INSW) stock is under scrutiny as the U.S. Treasury hints at possibly lifting Venezuela sanctions as early as next week to facilitate oil sales. This news, combined with recent U.S. seizures of Venezuela-linked tankers, creates volatility in tanker stocks. Traders are closely watching U.S. policy signals and their impact on physical oil prices, logistics, and potential shifts in freight rates.

feed.title: Phillips 66 (PSX) Is Up 8.9% After Lindsey-Humber Integration Bet On Heavy Crude Logistics
feed.summary: Phillips 66 (PSX) stock rose 8.9% following its agreement to acquire the Lindsey Oil Refinery assets in the U.K. and integrate them with its Humber Refinery. This strategic move aims to enhance storage and logistics, potentially offering access to heavier crude feedstocks and improving fuel distribution. The integration is expected to reshape Phillips 66's investment narrative and cash flow profile, despite ongoing risks from volatile refining margins and turnaround costs.

feed.title: TOP Ships amends suezmax tanker charter at higher rate
feed.summary: TOP Ships, led by Evangelos J. Pistiolis, has amended a suezmax tanker time-charter deal for its vessel Eco Oceano with Central Tankers Chartering, a company also affiliated with Pistiolis. The new agreement shortens the charter duration to five years starting January 1, 2026, but significantly increases the daily rate from $24,500 to $30,000. Additionally, the charterer now has a purchase option for $70 million exercisable in February 2027.

feed.title: WeRide ramping up driverless mobility operations abroad
feed.summary: Chinese autonomous driving company WeRide is expanding its robotaxi operations globally, particularly in the Middle East, Europe, and Southeast Asia, after a dual listing in Hong Kong and the United States. The company now has autonomous vehicles in 11 countries and regions, leveraging its Level 4 autonomous driving technology and significant R&D investment to drive commercial success in markets with strong revenue potential and supportive regulatory environments. WeRide aims to capitalize on the global inflection point for driverless transport with strategic partnerships and increasing overseas revenue.

feed.title: Allegiant to acquire Sun Country Airlines for $1.5B
feed.summary: Low-cost airline Allegiant will acquire Sun Country Airlines in a deal valued at approximately $1.5 billion, including debt. Sun Country shareholders will receive a premium of about 19.8% to their Friday closing stock price. The acquisition is expected to expand the combined company's network, add more destinations, and generate $140 million in annual synergies by the third year after closing, with the deal projected to close in the second half of 2026.

feed.title: Aerospace Stocks Q3 Teardown: TransDigm (NYSE:TDG) Vs The Rest
feed.summary: This article analyzes the Q3 performance of TransDigm (NYSE:TDG) and other aerospace stocks. TransDigm exceeded analyst expectations with strong revenue and operating income, while AAR (NYSE:AIR) also had an exceptional quarter. AerSale (NASDAQ:ASLE) reported the weakest Q3 performance among the reviewed companies despite its stock showing an increase since the results.

feed.title: NRG Energy Inc.: How a Retail Powerhouse Is Rewiring the U.S. Energy Experience
feed.summary: NRG Energy Inc. is transforming its business model from a traditional commodity power seller to a customer-centric energy and home services platform. The company is focusing on bundled energy plans, smart home integration, and data-driven services to provide predictability and convenience to its over seven million customers across North America. This strategic shift aims to create a sticky, subscription-style relationship with consumers, positioning NRG Energy Inc. as a primary energy interface rather than just a utility.

feed.title: Tamboran appoints Todd Abbott as CEO effective January 15
feed.summary: Tamboran Resources Corporation has appointed Todd Abbott as its new CEO, effective January 15, 2026. Abbott brings over 25 years of experience in the upstream oil and gas industry, including leadership roles at Seneca Resources, Marathon Oil, and Pioneer Natural Resources. His appointment comes as Tamboran prepares to enter the development phase of its Beetaloo Basin gas assets, with a focus on improving productivity and capital efficiency.

feed.title: NRG Energy Inc.: How a Retail Powerhouse Is Rewiring the U.S. Energy Experience
feed.summary: NRG Energy Inc. is transforming from a commodity power seller into a customer-centric energy and home services platform, focusing on bundled energy plans, smart home integration, and sustainable options. This strategic shift aims to create predictable revenues and long-term customer relationships by offering a diverse product mix through brands like Reliant and Green Mountain Energy. The company's repositioning toward consumer-grade products and enhanced customer experience is expected to impact its stock valuation positively.

feed.title: Heavy Transportation Equipment Stocks Q3 Results: Benchmarking Cummins (NYSE:CMI)
feed.summary: This article analyzes the Q3 earnings of several heavy transportation equipment companies, focusing on Cummins (NYSE:CMI). While Cummins reported strong operating results with revenues of $8.32 billion, exceeding analysts' expectations, other companies like Greenbrier (NYSE:GBX) and Wabash (NYSE:WNC) showed mixed performance. Greenbrier beat expectations but saw its stock decline, while Wabash posted disappointing guidance despite a stock increase.

feed.title: Allegiant to acquire Sun Country in deal valued at $1.5 billion
feed.summary: Allegiant Travel Co. announced its plan to acquire Sun Country Airlines Holdings Inc. in a cash-and-stock deal worth $1.5 billion, including Sun Country's debt. Sun Country shareholders will receive 0.1557 shares of Allegiant common stock and $4.10 in cash per share, representing a 19.8% premium. This merger will expand their combined network to over 650 routes, including 18 international destinations.

feed.title: Allegiant to buy rival budget airline Sun Country for around $1.5 billion
feed.summary: Allegiant and Sun Country Airlines have announced a merger agreement, with Allegiant acquiring Sun Country in a deal valued at approximately $1.5 billion, including debt. This acquisition represents a nearly 20% premium over Sun Country's recent closing stock price and signifies further consolidation within the competitive airline industry. The combined entity will likely leverage Allegiant's focus on connecting smaller cities to vacation destinations.

feed.title: National Grid plc stock: defensive dividend giant steadies after recent pullback
feed.summary: National Grid plc's stock has seen a modest pullback recently but remains attractive to investors due to its defensive income appeal and robust dividend. Despite macro-driven rate jitters, the UK grid operator's shares are consolidating within a longer-term range, with analysts cautiously supportive of its long-term infrastructure strategy. The company's ongoing capital expenditure program and portfolio optimization efforts are key to its future prospects, though interest rate trajectories and regulatory clarity will be crucial determinants for its stock performance.

feed.title: Critical Metals Corp. (CRML) Advances Tanbreez With Pilot-Plant and Storage Facility Build in Greenland
feed.summary: Critical Metals Corp. (NASDAQ:CRML) has announced the start of construction for a multi-use storage and pilot-plant facility in Qaqortoq, Greenland, to support its Tanbreez Rare Earth Project. This facility, designed for Arctic conditions, is expected to be ready by May 2026 and will aid in pilot-plant operations and technical work. The company also purchased a residential property in Qaqortoq to serve as its local operational base.

feed.title: ASP Isotopes Inc. (ASPI) Closes Renergen Deal, Unlocking $750M in Funding for Helium Expansion
feed.summary: ASP Isotopes Inc. (ASPI) has successfully completed its acquisition of Renergen Limited, a strategic merger that combines ASPI's enrichment technologies with Renergen's helium and natural gas assets, including the Virginia Gas Project in South Africa. This deal positions the combined entity to become a major global supplier of critical materials for high-growth sectors such as semiconductors and quantum computing. A key benefit of the acquisition is Renergen's access to approximately $750 million in debt funding, primarily from the U.S. International Development Finance Corporation (DFC), earmarked for expanding helium production capacity.

feed.title: Ramaco Resources, Inc. (METC) Signals Confidence With $100 Million Stock Buyback
feed.summary: Ramaco Resources, Inc. (METC) has announced a significant share repurchase program of up to $100 million of its Class A common stock over the next 24 months, representing about 10% of its market capitalization. This buyback is supported by the company's strong financial position, including over $600 million in capital raises in the latter half of 2025. METC, known for metallurgical coal, has also expanded into rare earth elements and critical minerals.

feed.title: Edison International Stock: Quiet Rally, Cautious Optimism And A Market Testing Its Nerves
feed.summary: Edison International's stock has shown a quiet but steady rally, outperforming many utility peers over the past year with a double-digit percentage gain. Analysts generally hold a positive to neutral view, seeing modest upside potential when combined with dividends, despite regulatory and wildfire-related uncertainties in California. The company's strategic focus on grid hardening, decarbonization, and infrastructure upgrades, alongside operational stability, is expected to drive continued shareholder returns without needing speculative growth.

feed.title: Mesa Air receives Nasdaq compliance warning
feed.summary: Mesa Air Group, Inc. has received a warning from Nasdaq stating that its stock is not in compliance with the minimum bid price requirement. The company has 180 calendar days, or until July 8, 2024, to regain compliance. To resolve the issue, Mesa Air Group's stock must close at $1.00 per share or more for at least 10 consecutive business days.

feed.title: (GEL) Movement Within Algorithmic Entry Frameworks
feed.summary: The article provides an algorithmic analysis for Genesis Energy L.p. (NYSE: GEL), indicating weak near-term sentiment but strong long-term prospects. It outlines three distinct trading strategies—Position, Momentum Breakout, and Risk Hedging—with specific entry, target, and stop-loss levels. The analysis highlights a significant 46.5:1 risk-reward setup targeting a 12.1% gain.

feed.title: Assessing Galp Energia SGPS (ENXTLS:GALP) Valuation After Morgan Stanley Upgrade And Energy Transition Push
feed.summary: Morgan Stanley recently upgraded Galp Energia SGPS (ENXTLS:GALP) to Overweight, pushing the stock back into focus. Despite recent share price choppiness, shorter-term momentum is improving, and the company trades at a P/E of 11x, which is below industry and peer averages, suggesting it may be undervalued. Simply Wall St's DCF model also indicates a 30.1% discount to an estimated fair value of €22.12, reinforcing the potential undervaluation.

feed.title: Shaping The Future Of Tourism Travel: Surf Air Mobility At Needham Event
feed.summary: Surf Air Mobility Inc. will participate in the 28th Annual Needham Growth Conference on January 16, 2026, to showcase its innovations in air mobility. The company, a leader in electric aviation and sustainable travel, is transforming the tourism industry through its AI-powered SurfOS software and electric aircraft programs. These advancements aim to provide eco-friendly, efficient, and accessible travel options, connecting remote destinations and promoting sustainable tourism.

feed.title: Understanding Momentum Shifts in (FXN)
feed.summary: The article details a neutral sentiment for First Trust Energy Alphadex Fund (FXN) across all time horizons, suggesting sideways price action. It highlights a significant risk-reward short setup with a 24.2:1 ratio and provides three AI-generated trading strategies: Position Trading, Momentum Breakout, and Risk Hedging, complete with entry, target, and stop-loss levels. The analysis emphasizes a wait-and-see approach due to a mid-channel oscillation pattern.

feed.title: Uranium Energy Corporation (UEC) Rallied 130% Post Purchase
feed.summary: Maple Tree Capital highlighted Uranium Energy Corp. (AMEX: UEC) in its Q3 2025 investor letter, noting its "Heartwood" portfolio took a large stake in UEC in Q4 2024. The firm believes UEC, an American uranium miner, is well-positioned to benefit from increased demand due to AI data center power constraints. Despite UEC's stock closing at $12.20 with an 82.36% gain over the last 52 weeks, Maple Tree Capital suggests some AI stocks offer greater upside and less risk.

feed.title: Vertical and Bristow Partner to Deliver Full Service 'Ready-to-Fly' eVTOL Operations for VX4 Customers
feed.summary: Vertical Aerospace and Bristow Group Inc. have expanded their strategic partnership to accelerate eVTOL adoption globally. This collaboration will provide a "ready-to-fly" model for customers, offering turnkey access to aircraft, pilots, maintenance, and insurance for Vertical's VX4 eVTOLs. Bristow has also pre-ordered up to 50 VX4 aircraft, with an option for 50 more, demonstrating confidence in Vertical's technology and commercial viability.

feed.title: BMO and KeyBanc Stay Postivie on Vistra (VST) After Cogentrix Deal
feed.summary: BMO Capital and KeyBanc have maintained positive ratings on Vistra Corp. (VST) following its announcement to acquire Cogentrix Energy for approximately $4 billion. BMO reduced its price target to $230 but kept an Outperform rating, while KeyBanc reaffirmed its Overweight rating with a $217 price target. The acquisition is expected to result in mid-to-high single-digit accretion for Vistra from 2027 to 2029.

feed.title: PACCAR Inc.: How a Quiet Truck Giant Is Re?engineering the Future of Heavy Transport
feed.summary: PACCAR Inc., known for its Kenworth, Peterbilt, and DAF brands, is transforming the heavy-duty truck market by developing connected, electric, and autonomous platforms for freight. The company focuses on integrated proprietary powertrains, advanced driver assistance systems, and zero-emission trucks, supported by a robust global parts and financial ecosystem. This strategy positions PACCAR as a key player in the industry's shift towards cleaner and smarter transport, reflected in its strong market valuation.

feed.title: Walmart plans drone delivery for another 150 stores in 4 more cities
feed.summary: Walmart and Wing plan to significantly expand their drone delivery service to 150 additional stores and four new major metropolitan areas including Los Angeles, St. Louis, Cincinnati, and Miami. This expansion doubles the number of cities with drone delivery from Walmart, with the service seeing high adoption rates from customers. By 2027, drone delivery is expected to be available from over 270 Walmart locations across the U.S., reaching approximately 40 million people.

This request comes as FirstEnergy acknowledges worsening reliability since 2019, but cities like Cleveland and Lakewood are opposing the proposal, citing increased public safety risks, economic harm, and the burden on vulnerable residents. Critics also question FirstEnergy's explanations for outages and the effectiveness of prior investments in grid improvements.

feed.title: WESPAC Advisors Increased Its Position in First Trust NASDAQ Clean Edge Smart Grid Infrastructure. Is the Index Fund a Buy?
feed.summary: WESPAC Advisors SoCal, LLC significantly increased its stake in the First Trust NASDAQ Clean Edge Smart Grid Infrastructure Index Fund (NASDAQ:GRID) by acquiring 32,351 shares, valuing the transaction at approximately $4.96 million. This move more than doubled their previous holdings, suggesting a bullish outlook on the fund, likely driven by the rising electricity demands of artificial intelligence and the push towards clean energy. The GRID fund focuses on companies involved in electric grid modernization and smart energy management, with a strong one-year return of 30.1%.

feed.title: MAX Airlines -3x Inverse Leveraged ETN (NYSEARCA:JETD) Trading Down 5.3% – What’s Next?
feed.summary: MAX Airlines -3x Inverse Leveraged ETN (JETD) saw its shares decline by 5.3% during mid-day trading on Friday, with the stock closing at $4.07 after trading as low as $4.07. Trading volume increased by 32% compared to the average daily volume. The ETN, which tracks -3x the daily price movements of US-listed air transportation companies, has a market capitalization of $2.04 million and was launched in June 2023.

feed.title: Chevron Could See $700 Million-a-Year Boost From Venezuelan Oil
feed.summary: Chevron Corp. stands to gain an additional $400 million to $700 million annually in cash flow from increased oil production in Venezuela, according to a TD Cowen analyst. This opportunity arises as the US administration aims to control Venezuelan crude supplies. While Chevron is uniquely positioned among US oil majors in the country, it is expected to prioritize boosting output from existing assets over new capital investments until a stable government and fiscal regime are established.

feed.title: Proficient Auto Logistics, Inc. Announces Participation in Stifel Transportation & Logistics Conference and Upcoming Investor Conference Call
feed.summary: Proficient Auto Logistics, Inc. will participate in the Stifel Transportation & Logistics Conference on February 10-11, 2026, with key executives presenting. The company will also hold an investor conference call on February 9, 2026, to discuss preliminary unaudited operating and financial results for the full year 2025. This engagement aims to provide transparency and update investors on the company's financial performance and strategic direction.

feed.title: Oil Services ETF (OIH) Hits New 52-Week High
feed.summary: The VanEck Oil Services ETF (OIH) has reached a new 52-week high, surging 65.9% from its low. This rally is attributed to rising oil prices, spurred by U.S. intervention in Venezuela and geopolitical tensions. Despite a Zacks ETF Rank #3 (Hold) with a High risk outlook, OIH shows potential for continued growth with a positive weighted alpha of 26.64.

feed.title: Vistra Corp Enters 20-Year PPAs with Meta for Carbon-Free Power
feed.summary: Vistra Corp announced 20-year power purchase agreements with Meta to supply 2,609 MW of carbon-free power from its PJM nuclear plants. Full energy delivery is expected by the end of 2027, with an uprate completed by 2034, projecting mid-teens levered returns. This agreement signifies a significant step in providing carbon-free electricity to Meta.

feed.title: CHS Inc. to operate COFCO grain terminal in Illinois under lease agreement
feed.summary: CHS Inc. will lease and operate COFCO International Ltd.'s grain terminal in Cahokia, Illinois, starting January 31, 2026. This agreement allows CHS to expand its logistics reach and strengthen its Midwest-to-Gulf grain corridor without owning the asset. The facility is strategically located on the Mississippi River with extensive rail connections, offering high-throughput handling for grain and grain byproducts.

feed.title: Is UBS’s New Coverage of China Yuchai (CYD) Reframing Its Engine Business Risk‑Reward Story?
feed.summary: UBS has initiated coverage on China Yuchai International (CYD) with a 'Buy' rating and a US$60.00 price target, drawing institutional attention to the engine manufacturer. This new coverage highlights the company's shift towards alternative fuel technologies and export growth, despite its foundational ties to traditional internal combustion engines. Investors are encouraged to consider diverse perspectives due to a wide range of fair value estimates from other analysts, emphasizing the varying views on the company's future catalysts.

feed.title: Brenmiller Energy Founder & CEO Avi Brenmiller Wins Merage Industry Leader Award
feed.summary: Avi Brenmiller, Founder and CEO of Brenmiller Energy, has been awarded the Merage DeserTech Industry Leader Award for his significant contributions to climate innovation and clean energy. Under his leadership, Brenmiller Energy has pioneered thermal energy storage solutions and established the world's first TES gigafactory. The award acknowledges his career-long effort in bringing visionary clean technologies from concept to commercial reality, including a transformative milestone with Solel Solar Systems Ltd.

feed.title: Meta se associa à Oklo para desenvolver campus de energia nuclear de 1,2 GW em Ohio
feed.summary: Meta Platforms, Inc. (Nasdaq:META) e Oklo Inc. (NYSE:OKLO), uma empresa de tecnologia nuclear avançada, anunciaram um acordo para desenvolver um campus de energia nuclear de 1,2 gigawatt no condado de Pike, Ohio. O projeto visa fornecer energia para os centros de dados da Meta na região, com operações iniciais previstas para 2030 e capacidade total a ser atingida até 2034. A Meta fará pagamentos antecipados e fornecerá financiamento para o projeto, que também é esperado para criar milhares de empregos e gerar novas receitas fiscais.
feed.source: Investing.com Brasil - Finanças, Câmbio e Investimentos

feed.title: Oklo, Meta Announce Agreement in Support of 1.2 GW Nuclear Energy Development in Southern Ohio
feed.summary: Oklo Inc. and Meta Platforms, Inc. have announced an agreement to develop a 1.2 GW nuclear power campus in Pike County, Ohio, to support Meta's data centers. Meta will prepay for power and provide funding to secure nuclear fuel and advance Phase 1 of Oklo's Aurora powerhouse deployment. The project is expected to create jobs, expand Ohio's clean energy workforce, and bring significant tax revenues, with the first phase targeted to come online as early as 2030 and full 1.2 GW capacity by 2034.

feed.title: Oklo Stock Plunges After 2025 Surge Amid Rising Risks
feed.summary: Oklo Inc., a nuclear technology company, experienced a significant stock plunge in early 2026 after a 238% surge in 2025, due to concerns about its lack of revenue, high cash burn, and plans to raise capital through stock offerings. Despite U.S. Department of Energy support and regulatory progress, the company faces substantial risks regarding financing, licensing, and reactor deployment delays, which could trigger further sell-offs. Oklo's future remains uncertain as it navigates complex challenges to justify its high valuation for a pre-revenue company.

feed.title: Oklo jumps 20% in pre-market as Meta unveils nuclear deals to power data centers
feed.summary: Oklo Inc. saw a 20% jump in pre-market trading after Meta announced a deal to power its AI infrastructure with nuclear energy from Oklo, Vistra, and Terrapower. The agreement with Oklo involves building a 1.2 GW nuclear power campus in Ohio, with Meta prepaying for power and providing upfront funding to accelerate reactor technology deployment. This move by Meta highlights the growing demand for reliable, carbon-free nuclear power to support the energy-intensive AI sector, fueling a "Nuclear Renaissance."

feed.title: Technical Reactions to BNO Trends in Macro Strategies
feed.summary: This article analyzes technical reactions to United States Brent Crude Oil Fund (NYSE: BNO) trends, identifying a mid-channel oscillation pattern and a strong risk-reward setup targeting a 7.3% gain. It outlines three AI-generated trading strategies (Position, Momentum Breakout, Risk Hedging) tailored to different risk profiles and provides a multi-timeframe signal analysis with current support and resistance levels. The piece emphasizes prevailing positive sentiment and offers institutional-grade analysis for BNO.

feed.title: National Grid: Why Using Renewable Biogas Energy is Pivotal
feed.summary: Don Chahbazpour of National Grid explains the critical role of biogas and renewable natural gas (RNG) in decarbonizing gas networks, reducing methane emissions, and helping companies achieve net-zero goals. He highlights biogas's carbon-negative potential, reliability, and compatibility with existing infrastructure, positioning it as a significant solution for the energy transition. The article also discusses how major companies like IKEA, Ben & Jerry's, and AstraZeneca are incorporating biogas into their ESG strategies, despite a need for clearer accounting standards in the voluntary carbon market.

feed.title: MingZhu Logistics prices 8M units at $1.00 in registered direct offering
feed.summary: MingZhu Logistics announced it has priced a registered direct offering of 8 million units at $1.00 per unit. Each unit consists of one ordinary share and one warrant to purchase an ordinary share. The offering is expected to close on or about January 16, 2026, and is being made without an underwriter or placement agent.

feed.title: Ardmore Shipping (NYSE:ASC) Stock Crosses Below 50 Day Moving Average - Time to Sell?
feed.summary: Ardmore Shipping (NYSE:ASC) stock recently fell below its 50-day moving average, trading as low as $11.40. Despite this, analyst sentiment remains mildly positive with a "Moderate Buy" rating and an average target price of $13.67. The company reported strong quarterly earnings, raised its dividend, and maintains low leverage, though revenue was down year-over-year.

feed.title: GreenPower Motor Company Chooses New Mexico Border Hub for U.S. Manufacturing Expansion
feed.summary: GreenPower Motor Company has selected Santa Teresa, New Mexico, as the site for its new U.S. manufacturing headquarters and North American base for operations. This decision was influenced by New Mexico's growing electric vehicle ecosystem, the Santa Teresa Foreign Trade Zone, and competitive state and local incentives. The project is expected to create over 340 jobs and generate more than $200 million in economic impact.

feed.title: New Mexico backs new electric bus factory bringing 340 jobs
feed.summary: GreenPower Motor Company (NASDAQ: GP) is opening a manufacturing facility in Santa Teresa, New Mexico, supported by $14.6 million in state incentives. This project is expected to create 340 permanent jobs and is driven by New Mexico's growing EV ecosystem and the benefits of the Santa Teresa Foreign Trade Zone. The investment aligns with the state's broader "Electrify New Mexico" initiative, which includes a $400 million investment to electrify state fleets and school buses.

feed.title: Tuscaloosa County Celebrates Billion-dollar Blue Creek Mine Launch
feed.summary: Warrior Met Coal celebrated the completion of its $1 billion Blue Creek Mine project in Tuscaloosa County, which is expected to create over 300 new jobs and produce 6.0 million short tons of metallurgical coal annually. This project, along with significant investments from Norfolk Southern, the Alabama Port Authority, and Parker Towing Company, will strengthen Alabama's economy and infrastructure for the next 40 years. The mine started longwall operations eight months ahead of schedule, contributing to record quarterly sales volumes for Warrior Met.

feed.title: Neuberger Berman Energy Infrastructure and Income Fund (NYSEAMERICAN:NML) Share Price Passes Below Two Hundred Day Moving Average – What’s Next?
feed.summary: Neuberger Berman Energy Infrastructure and Income Fund (NML) saw its share price drop below its two hundred-day moving average. The company recently declared a monthly dividend of $0.0584 per share, yielding 8.2% annually. Additionally, Portfolio Manager Douglas A. Rachlin increased his stake in the company by acquiring 40,000 shares, and several institutional investors adjusted their holdings.

feed.title: Securian Asset Management Inc. Buys Shares of 30,782 TechnipFMC plc $FTI
feed.summary: Securian Asset Management Inc. acquired a new position of 30,782 shares in TechnipFMC plc during the third quarter, valued at approximately $1.21 million. The company has also authorized a $2.00 billion share buyback program and pays a quarterly dividend.

feed.title: Cerity Partners LLC Increases Stock Position in American Electric Power Company, Inc. $AEP
feed.summary: Cerity Partners LLC significantly increased its stake in American Electric Power Company, Inc. (AEP) by 59.7% in Q3, now holding 184,988 shares valued at approximately $20.8 million. The utility company also raised its quarterly dividend and maintains a "Moderate Buy" consensus rating from analysts, despite a recent insider stock sale.

feed.title: BMO Lowers Vistra (VST) Target to $230 but Keeps Outperform Rating
feed.summary: BMO Capital analyst James Thalacker has lowered the price target for Vistra Corp. (VST) to $230 from $245, while maintaining an "Outperform" rating. This adjustment follows Vistra's acquisition of Cogentrix Energy, which includes 10 natural gas-fired power plants, for approximately $4.7 billion to meet rising power demands. Despite the target reduction, BMO remains positive on Vistra, citing the company's intact long-term cash growth and raising future adjusted EBITDA and free cash flow estimates.

feed.title: Why Evercore Expects Tesla (TSLA) Shares to Trade Sideways in the Near Term
feed.summary: Evercore ISI has reiterated an "In Line" rating for Tesla (TSLA), predicting that its stock will trade sideways in the near term due to a balance between "lackluster legacy" performance and thematic focus on its Austin "driver out" initiatives. This comes as Nvidia launched a new AI platform for self-driving cars, Alpamayo, which caused a negative reaction among Tesla investors despite Elon Musk's positive remarks. The article suggests that while Tesla has potential, other AI stocks may offer greater upside with less risk.

feed.title: GreenPower Motor to open electric vehicle facility in New Mexico
feed.summary: GreenPower Motor Company Inc. plans to open a new electric vehicle manufacturing facility in Santa Teresa, New Mexico, driven by the state's EV ecosystem, foreign trade zone benefits, and a $14.6 million incentive package. This expansion is expected to create 340 permanent jobs. Despite a significant recent stock decline and debt burden, the company anticipates substantial revenue growth, leveraging New Mexico's policies promoting zero-emission vehicles and Santa Teresa's strategic trade hub location.

feed.title: BP stock jumps with oil prices as buyback rolls on — here’s what investors watch next
feed.summary: BP PLC shares rose 2.39% to 426 pence, driven by an increase in oil prices due to supply risks. The company also continued its share buyback program, repurchasing over 3 million shares. Investors are now looking forward to upcoming macro data, including U.S. and UK CPI releases, and BP's next earnings report for updates on cash returns.

feed.title: ONEOK Inc.: The Midstream Workhorse Powering America’s Natural Gas Future
feed.summary: ONEOK Inc. operates as a critical midstream platform in North America, specializing in moving, processing, and monetizing natural gas and natural gas liquids (NGLs). The company provides an integrated system across major basins, offering end-to-end logistics with a fee-based, contract-driven model. Its strategic acquisition of Magellan Midstream Partners has diversified its portfolio into refined products and crude oil, positioning it as a key player in the energy transition era.

feed.title: Xtrackers RREEF Global Natural Resources ETF (NASDAQ:NRES) Shares Up 0.4% – Time to Buy?

feed.title: Is Getty’s 2025 Investment Surge And 2026 Guidance Altering The Investment Case For Getty Realty (GTY)?
feed.summary: Getty Realty Corp. invested approximately US$269 million in convenience and automotive retail properties in 2025 and has a committed pipeline exceeding US$75 million for future development and acquisitions. The company also issued its initial full-year 2026 earnings guidance, reinforcing its growth-through-acquisitions strategy. While these developments provide clearer visibility into future cash flows, they also increase exposure to long-term risks associated with evolving transportation habits and fuel demand, particularly concerning electric vehicle adoption.

feed.title: What the Big Oil executives told Trump about investing in Venezuela
feed.summary: Leading U.S. oil executives, including CEOs from ExxonMobil and ConocoPhillips, met with President Trump to discuss investing in Venezuela. While Trump spoke of a $100 billion investment, the executives stated that significant reforms are needed because, in its current state, Venezuela is "uninvestable." Exxon and ConocoPhillips highlighted past asset seizures and the need for legal and commercial construct changes, while Chevron, the only U.S. major still operating there, expressed readiness to increase production.

feed.title: A Look At Eversource Energy (ES) Valuation After Recent Regulatory Setbacks And Rate Settlement
feed.summary: Eversource Energy (ES) is facing investor scrutiny after Connecticut regulators rejected a water utility sale and its NStar Gas unit settled with the Massachusetts Attorney General. These regulatory issues have impacted short-term sentiment, despite a strong long-term shareholder return. The stock currently trades below analyst targets and its estimated intrinsic value, suggesting it might be undervalued, but potential future regulatory challenges could affect this outlook.

feed.title: Cenovus Energy Inc. (CVE:CA) National Bank Reiterates Bullish View on Cenovus Energy
feed.summary: National Bank of Canada has reaffirmed its "Outperform" rating for Cenovus Energy Inc. (CVE:CA) and raised its 12-month target price to $29.00 from $28.00. This increase is driven by improved confidence in the company's cash flow outlook, balance sheet strength, stable heavy oil pricing, and a commitment to shareholder returns through dividends and share buybacks. The bank believes Cenovus is well-positioned to benefit from a favorable energy price environment.

feed.title: FedEx Corp.: How a Legacy Logistics Giant Is Rebuilding the Next?Gen Delivery Machine
feed.summary: FedEx Corp. is transforming itself from a traditional parcel carrier into a data-driven, AI-powered logistics platform, exemplified by its Network 2.0 integration program and expanded digital services. This strategy aims to provide faster, more predictable, and cost-effective delivery while competing fiercely with UPS and Amazon Logistics. The company's competitive edge lies in its global multimodal scale, neutrality as a platform, focus on data and visibility, diversified customer base, and continuous cost optimization efforts.

feed.title: Is Global Ship Lease (GSL) Stock Undervalued Right Now?
feed.summary: Global Ship Lease (GSL) appears to be undervalued based on Zacks' ranking system, holding a Zacks Rank #2 (Buy) and a Value grade of A. Its P/B ratio of 0.69 is significantly lower than its industry average of 1.66, further supporting the undervaluation claim. The article suggests GSL, with its strong earnings outlook, is an attractive option for value investors.

feed.title: Nabors Industries Ltd. (NYSE:NBR) Receives Consensus Rating of "Hold" from Analysts

feed.title: Greenbrier Companies, Inc. (The) (NYSE:GBX) Announces Quarterly Dividend of $0.32

feed.title: TD Cowen initiates Constellation Energy stock with Buy rating, $440 target
feed.summary: TD Cowen has initiated coverage on Constellation Energy (NASDAQ:CEG) with a Buy rating and a $440 price target, citing the Calpine integration as a "compelling opportunity for contracting" and intriguing upside potential from gas PPA deals. While acknowledging elevated regulatory risk, the firm's outlook is supported by Constellation's recent acquisition of Calpine, making it the largest electricity producer in the U.S., and recent regulatory approvals for nuclear facility modernizations and license renewals.

feed.title: An Oil Exec on ‘Landman,’ Venezuela, and Beating the S&P 500
feed.summary: Mark Lashier, CEO of Phillips 66, discussed various topics including the energy company’s new directors, its relationship with activist investor Elliott Management, and the origins of the company's name. The interview, recorded in December 2025, also touched on broader industry issues like Venezuela and outperforming the S&P 500.

feed.title: XCF Global and Impact Jets Sign MOU to Supply Private Jet Market with Sustainable Aviation Fuel

This partnership aims to accelerate SAF adoption among private jet operators and clients by launching a "Powered by XCF SAF" program. The initiative targets the high-growth U.S. private aviation sector, which represents a significant untapped market for SAF.

feed.title: Textron Inc.: How a Quiet Industrial Powerhouse Is Rewiring the Future of Mobility and Defense
feed.summary: Textron Inc. is transforming from a traditional industrial conglomerate into a high-tech mobility and defense platform, focusing on business jets, military rotorcraft, eVTOL air taxis, and autonomous ground systems. The article details Textron's integrated business model across aviation, Bell, Textron Systems, and urban air mobility, highlighting its strategic shift and competitive advantages in the diverse aerospace and defense sectors. This evolution positions Textron as a diversified growth story, balancing cyclical business aviation with long-cycle defense and emerging technologies.

feed.title: Frontline plc (NYSE: FRO) details fleet renewal, adding nine vessels and selling eight
feed.summary: Frontline plc announced a strategic fleet renewal initiative to modernize its vessel portfolio. The company plans to acquire nine new vessels while selling eight older ones, aiming for potential efficiency gains and updated fleet mix. This move is detailed in an SEC Form 6-K filing, with more specifics expected in a linked press release.

feed.title: Textron Inc.: How a Quiet Industrial Powerhouse Is Rewiring the Future of Mobility and Defense
feed.summary: Textron Inc. is transforming from a traditional industrial conglomerate into a high-tech mobility and defense platform, focusing on business jets, military rotorcraft, eVTOL air taxis, and autonomous ground systems. The company's strategy involves building a flexible technology ecosystem that integrates manufacturing, certification, and defense-grade reliability with next-generation platforms across its various brands like Cessna, Beechcraft, Bell, and Textron Systems. This strategic shift positions Textron Inc. as a diversified aerospace and defense growth story, offering a coherent and flexible portfolio that dampens volatility for both customers and investors.

feed.title: ENTO Subsidiary Grid AI Announces Letter of Intent with First Hyperscaler AI Data-Center Customer
feed.summary: Entero Therapeutics' subsidiary, Grid AI, has signed a Letter of Intent with a hyperscaler AI data-center developer to implement its power-cluster optimization platform. This agreement marks Grid AI's first hyperscaler deal, with revenue generation expected to start in Q3 2026, scaling to over $50 million by 2029. The partnership aims to address the significant infrastructure challenges posed by hyperscale AI development through advanced power orchestration.

feed.title: How CCEC’s First Multi-Cargo LCO2 Carrier Delivery Has Changed Its Investment Story
feed.summary: Capital Clean Energy Carriers Corp. (CCEC) recently received its first multi-cargo LCO2 carrier, the Active, enhancing its flexibility in gas trades and carbon capture. While this vessel supports CCEC's long-term thesis on specialized shipping, the company still faces challenges with securing long-term employment for its expanding fleet and managing debt from a large newbuild program. Analysts project significant revenue and earnings growth for CCEC by 2028, with fair value estimates suggesting a potential upside for investors.

feed.title: XCF Global Strengthens Leadership to Accelerate Commercial Growth in Sustainable Aviation Fuel
feed.summary: XCF Global (Nasdaq:SAFX) has announced key leadership appointments to strengthen its position in the Sustainable Aviation Fuel (SAF) market. Chris Cooper, a seasoned energy-transition executive, has been appointed CEO and Board Director. Wray Thorn will serve as Interim Board Chair, and Randy Soule, founder of New Rise Renewables, will be the Senior Operations Adviser.

feed.title: Brenmiller Energy Founder & CEO Avi Brenmiller Wins Merage Industry Leader Award
feed.summary: Avi Brenmiller, Founder and CEO of Brenmiller Energy, received the Merage DeserTech Industry Leader Award for his significant contributions to clean energy innovation. The award recognizes his leadership in developing cutting-edge thermal energy storage solutions and guiding Brenmiller Energy to become the first TES company listed on Nasdaq. Brenmiller's career also includes leading Solel Solar Systems Ltd. to global prominence before its acquisition by Siemens.

feed.title: Horizon Aircraft to Participate in November and December Conferences
feed.summary: Horizon Aircraft (NASDAQ:HOVR) announced its participation in several conferences in November and December 2025. Management will attend the Helicopter Association Canada Annual Conference & Trade Show, Corporate Jet Investor – Miami 2025, MINERVA, and OAC’s Aerospace Unplugged & AGM 2025 event. These events will provide opportunities for 1x1 meetings and informal discussions regarding their hybrid eVTOL aircraft.

feed.title: CVX Stock Price, Forecast & Analysis | CHEVRON CORP (NYSE:CVX)
feed.summary: This article provides a comprehensive analysis of Chevron Corp. (CVX) stock, covering its current price, key statistics, performance over various periods, and analyst forecasts. It details the company's profile, including its segments (Upstream and Downstream) and its role in the energy sector. The report also includes technical and fundamental ratings from ChartMill, financial highlights, and an overview of ownership and competitor information.

feed.title: Trilogy Metals (TSX:TMQ) Is Up 14.8% After US Backs Ambler Road Access Project
feed.summary: Trilogy Metals (TSX:TMQ) shares surged 14.8% after the US government, which holds a 10% equity stake, approved the Ambler Road Access Project. This decision significantly reduces a major risk for Trilogy, facilitating access to the mineral-rich Upper Kobuk Mineral Projects. While government backing eases permitting and funding concerns, investors still need to consider execution, environmental, and cost risks for the zero-revenue company.

feed.title: Coterra Energy (CTRA) Stock Declines While Market Improves: Some Information for Investors
feed.summary: Coterra Energy (CTRA) stock declined by 2.32% in the most recent trading session, underperforming the broader market. Over the last month, the stock has decreased by 4.08%, while the Oils-Energy sector gained 0.68%. Investors are awaiting Coterra Energy's upcoming earnings report, with an anticipated EPS of $0.59 and revenue of $1.88 billion, indicating significant year-over-year increases.

feed.title: CHS to operate COFCO grain terminal near St. Louis
feed.summary: CHS Inc., the largest farmer-owned cooperative in the U.S., will take over operations of a grain transloading terminal near St. Louis owned by China's COFCO International Ltd. This facility, located on the Mississippi River, has access to major railroads and serves as a high-speed rail and truck-to-barge loading site. CHS will be leasing the facility, which previously raised national security concerns when COFCO acquired the entire terminal.

feed.title: How CCEC’s First Multi-Cargo LCO2 Carrier Delivery Has Changed Its Investment Story
feed.summary: Capital Clean Energy Carriers Corp. (CCEC) recently received its first multi-cargo LCO2 carrier, the Active, from Hyundai Mipo Dockyard, which offers flexibility by transporting LCO2, LPG, ammonia, and petrochemicals. While this delivery supports CCEC's long-term investment thesis in specialized gas shipping, the company still faces near-term challenges such as securing long-term employment for its expanding fleet and managing a significant floating-rate debt tied to its $2.3 billion newbuild program. The article highlights CCEC's projected revenue and earnings growth, along with fair value estimates, but emphasizes the need for investors to consider the risks associated with securing future contracts in emerging LCO2 and multi-gas markets.

feed.title: Phillips 66 CEO on Fuel Demand, Venezuela, and What 'Landman' Gets Right
feed.summary: Mark Lashier, CEO of Phillips 66, discusses the company's downstream operations, the health of the oil and gas sector, and its strategic integration efforts. He addresses the company's relationship with activist investor Elliott Management, the reasons for closing a California refinery, and the importance of consistent regulation for infrastructure projects. Lashier also touches on global fuel demand, the need for diverse crude access, and the political engagement required to support the energy industry.

feed.title: Valero Energy (VLO) stock slides as Venezuela oil moves and analyst targets reset ahead of earnings
feed.summary: Valero Energy stock fell as investors reacted to potential changes in crude supply from Venezuela and fresh analyst notes. Refinery earnings are highly sensitive to feedstock costs and crack spreads, with Venezuelan heavy crude potentially impacting Valero's 2026 margins. Analysts have issued mixed price targets, and the company is set to report its Q4 and full-year 2025 earnings on January 29th.

feed.title: Nucor Corporation: How a Steel Traditionalist Turned Itself into a Decarbonization Product Platform
feed.summary: Nucor Corporation is transforming from a basic steel producer into a high-tech, low-carbon product platform by leveraging advanced electric arc furnaces, green steel initiatives, and integrated downstream solutions. The company is positioning itself as a key supplier for industries seeking to decarbonize their supply chains, offering engineered solutions and a national footprint for major infrastructure projects. This strategic shift aims to provide a competitive edge in a market increasingly focused on sustainability and product differentiation, influencing its valuation and stock performance.

feed.title: Duke Energy compensating customers who incurred damage of equipment error
feed.summary: Duke Energy is fulfilling its commitment to compensate Creedmoor homeowners for damages resulting from a power outage caused by equipment error late last year. A representative from "5 On Your Side," Keely Arthur, has been vital in ensuring these customers receive their payments and provides an update on the situation.

feed.title: Diana Shipping Inc. announces direct continuation of time charter contract for m/v Maia with Paralos Shipping

feed.title: Diana Shipping Inc.'s (NYSE:DSX) market cap up US$20m last week, benefiting both retail investors who own 59% as well as insiders

(NYSE:REPX) has announced a quarterly dividend of $0.40 per share, payable on February 5th to shareholders of record on January 22nd, implying a 6.1% annual yield.
