Shares of the company traded up 2.2% to $26.35 following the announcement.

feed.title: Dorian LPG (LPG) CEO buys $409k in company stock
feed.summary: Dorian LPG's CEO, John C. Hadjipateras, purchased 15,000 shares of company stock for $409,500, increasing his direct holdings. This transaction follows the company's recent Q2 2026 earnings report, where Dorian LPG missed analyst expectations for EPS and revenue, leading Freedom Capital Markets to adjust its price target downward while maintaining a Buy rating.

feed.title: Renewables Announces Collaboration With Monolithic Power Systems: High-Speed Wireless Charging for e2T Electric Tractor
feed.summary: Renewables has partnered with Monolithic Power Systems (MPS) to integrate high-speed wireless charging technology into its e2T electric two-wheel tractor. This collaboration aims to showcase MPS's zero-mechanical-contact charging solution for robust electric and robotic systems, particularly those operating in harsh environments. The partnership highlights the potential for advanced power electronics to enhance practical agricultural equipment by improving energy transfer efficiency and reducing maintenance needs.

feed.title: Exxon Mobil stock pops after-hours as CEO opens door to Venezuela return, earnings loom
feed.summary: Exxon Mobil shares rose after CEO Darren Woods indicated the company is open to re-entering Venezuela, provided there are legal and security changes, following the removal of President Nicolas Maduro. This move comes as the company anticipates a fourth-quarter hit to upstream earnings due to weaker crude prices, partially offset by stronger refining margins. Investors are closely watching for further details on Venezuela and Exxon's upcoming quarterly results on January 30th.

feed.title: Is Halliburton (HAL) Pricing Look Attractive After Recent Share Price Gains?
feed.summary: Halliburton's stock has seen significant gains recently, with a 24.6% return over the last year. A Discounted Cash Flow (DCF) analysis suggests Halliburton is undervalued by 55.9% at its current price of $32.63, indicating an intrinsic value of $73.91 per share. However, its P/E ratio of 20.98x is close to the Energy Services industry average and Simply Wall St's "Fair Ratio" of 21.14x, suggesting the price is "about right" based on earnings.

feed.title: BofA Securities Maintains CSX Corp(CSX.US) With Buy Rating, Maintains Target Price $41
feed.summary: BofA Securities analyst Ken Hoexter has reiterated a Buy rating for CSX Corp (CSX.US) and maintained a target price of $41. According to TipRanks data, Hoexter has a 48.1% success rate and a 1.8% average return over the past year. The information is for informational purposes only and does not constitute investment advice.

feed.title: How Investors Are Reacting To Range Resources (RRC) Retiring High-Coupon 2029 Notes With Revolver Borrowings
feed.summary: Range Resources Corporation has redeemed US$600 million of its 8.25% senior notes due 2029, funding the redemption through its existing revolving credit facility. This strategic move aims to reshape the company's debt profile and lower interest costs by replacing higher-coupon bonds with revolver borrowings. The analysis suggests this action, while not changing exposure to Appalachian price differentials, contributes to disciplined balance sheet management in a capital-intensive industry.

feed.title: Lucid, Nuro and Uber Unveil Autonomous Taxi
feed.summary: Lucid Group Inc., Nuro Inc., and Uber Technologies Inc. have unveiled their new autonomous vehicle, a robotaxi based on Lucid's Gravity SUV, which will be built in Casa Grande, AZ. The vehicle features advanced sensory systems including high-resolution cameras, lidar, and radar for 360-degree perception, integrated seamlessly into its design. Autonomous on-road testing has already begun in the San Francisco Bay Area, with plans for a service launch later this year, leveraging Lucid’s vehicle architecture, Nuro’s Level 4 autonomy, and Uber’s extensive network.

feed.title: Green Power Motor Co. to Build EV Factory in Arizona
feed.summary: GreenPower Motor Co., a Canadian manufacturer of electric school buses and commercial vehicles, is establishing a new 135,000-square-foot assembly plant in Santa Teresa, New Mexico. This facility will serve as the company's North American operational base. The strategic location, including Santa Teresa's Foreign Trade Zone designation and skilled workforce, was a key factor in GreenPower's decision to expand.

feed.title: Joby to Expand Manufacturing Footprint in Ohio
feed.summary: Joby Aviation Inc. is expanding its manufacturing operations in Dayton, Ohio, by acquiring a 700,000-square-foot facility. This expansion aims to double production to four air taxis per month by 2027 and positions Dayton as a central hub for future aerospace innovation and manufacturing in the U.S. Operations at the new facility are expected to commence this year, complementing Joby's existing production sites in California and Ohio.

feed.title: Enlight Renewable Energy Ltd stock hits all-time high at 51.78 USD
feed.summary: Enlight Renewable Energy Ltd's stock has hit an all-time high of $51.78, marking a 200.42% increase over the past year, reflecting strong investor confidence and company performance. This surge follows a Q3 2025 earnings report where EPS significantly beat analyst expectations, despite revenue falling short. The company continues to capitalize on the growing demand for sustainable energy solutions.

feed.title: Clean-energy pioneer behind $400M solar deal earns new industry honor
feed.summary: Avi Brenmiller, Founder and CEO of Brenmiller Energy (Nasdaq: BNRG), has been honored with the Merage DeserTech Industry Leader Award for his contributions to climate innovation and commercializing thermal energy storage solutions. The award recognizes his leadership in establishing the world's first TES gigafactory and guiding Brenmiller Energy to become the first TES company listed on Nasdaq. His career highlights also include the acquisition of Solel Solar Systems by Siemens for over $400 million under his leadership.

feed.title: US' Montrose Environmental launches VeriPlume Capture System
feed.summary: Montrose Environmental Group, Inc. has launched its new patent-pending VeriPlume Capture System, designed to safely and accurately measure methane emissions from high-volume vents up to 60 feet high. This system allows technicians to work from the ground, enhancing safety and reducing costs for oil and gas firms while helping them comply with EPA regulations. Montrose also highlighted other innovative technologies, including PFAS and VOC abatement systems, demonstrating its commitment to environmental solutions.

feed.title: Dorian LPG (NYSE:LPG) CEO John Hadjipateras Buys 15,000 Shares
feed.summary: Dorian LPG CEO John Hadjipateras recently purchased 15,000 shares of the company's stock for $409,500, increasing his total holdings to 153,500 shares. Despite the 50.6% year-over-year revenue growth to $124.06 million, the company's EPS of $1.31 missed estimates, leading to a slight stock dip to $27.22. Analysts maintain a "Hold" rating with an average target price of $35.00, and the company also increased its quarterly dividend to $0.65 per share.

feed.title: Nessel and advocates seek rehearing on conditional approval of DTE data center contracts
feed.summary: Michigan Attorney General Dana Nessel and a coalition of environmental and consumer advocacy groups have petitioned regulators to rehear the case regarding the Michigan Public Service Commission's conditional approval of DTE Energy's contracts to power a data center in Saline Township. They argue that the ex parte approval process, which allowed the contracts to move forward without external intervention or a contested hearing, was irresponsible and failed to protect DTE customers from potential increased energy rates. While the Commission states its staff thoroughly reviewed the contracts and imposed strong consumer protections, Nessel and the advocacy groups question the efficacy and enforcement of these conditions.

feed.title: Duke Energy Florida uses solar-made hydrogen to reinvent gas power
feed.summary: Duke Energy Florida has launched a pioneering hydrogen-based power system in Volusia County, claiming it's the first U.S. project capable of producing, storing, and combusting up to 100% green hydrogen using an integrated setup. Located at the DeBary solar site, the system uses solar power to create hydrogen via electrolyzers, stores it, and then feeds it into a modified gas turbine to generate electricity during peak demand. This demonstration aims to show how green hydrogen can enhance grid reliability, integrate more renewable energy, and allow existing power plants to transition away from fossil fuels, despite hydrogen's current higher cost compared to natural gas.

feed.title: The 6.2% return this week takes LATAM Airlines Group's (SNSE:LTM) shareholders three-year gains to 455%
feed.summary: LATAM Airlines Group (SNSE:LTM) shareholders have seen an impressive 455% total shareholder return over the last three years, largely driven by its dividend payments, with a 6.2% return this past week alone. The company has become profitable within this period, contributing to the strong share price increase which is up 412% in three years and 29% in the last quarter. While long-term performance had shown past losses, short-term gains suggest a brighter outlook for the airline.

feed.title: Vistra Energy Expands with Strategic Acquisition of Cogentrix
feed.summary: Vistra Energy has announced the strategic acquisition of Cogentrix Energy for $4.7 billion, significantly expanding its power generation capabilities with an additional 5,500 megawatts of natural gas assets. This move is expected to bolster Vistra's shareholder returns and free cash flow per share in the coming years, despite some recent stock price target downgrades. Investors have shown confidence in the acquisition, with Vistra's stock trending up following the announcement.

feed.title: California firm to bring nuclear reactors to Ohio to power Meta
feed.summary: Oklo, a California-based nuclear energy company, has partnered with Meta Platforms, Inc. to establish a 1.2-gigawatt power campus in Pike County, Ohio, using 16 advanced nuclear reactors to power Meta's data centers. This project aims to address the significant demand for electrical energy from power-hungry data centers and is expected to create numerous jobs. While proponents hail it as a "new era" for Ohio's energy sector, some local residents express concerns about environmental safety and lack of information.

feed.title: NOVAGOLD RESOURCES INC Updates on Donlin Gold Infrastructure and Energy Supply
feed.summary: NOVAGOLD RESOURCES INC announced a non-binding Letter of Intent (LOI) with Glenfarne regarding the supply of natural gas for the Donlin Gold project. This LOI involves evaluating a gas sales agreement for up to 50 million cubic feet per day, delivered via a new pipeline from Southcentral Alaska, aimed at reducing costs and enhancing project value. The selection of a prime contractor for a feasibility study is expected in Q1 2026.

feed.title: Polestar stock drops despite “best year ever” sales; Feb. 18 update is next test
feed.summary: Polestar's stock dropped 5.9% despite the EV maker reporting preliminary 2025 retail sales up 34% to 60,119 cars, marking its "best year ever." The company's shift towards Europe for sales and reliance on majority owner Geely for funding underscore challenges in the U.S. and China. Investors are now looking to a February 18 strategy update for details on profitability, gross margin, and cash burn.

feed.title: Helix to Participate in Upcoming Event
feed.summary: Helix Energy Solutions Group, Inc. (NYSE: HLX) announced its participation in the Fearnley Securities Annual Offshore Drilling & Services Seminars in New York on January 14, 2026, and in London on January 15, 2026. Any investor presentation from these events will be accessible on Helix's website. The company specializes in offshore energy services, focusing on well intervention, robotics, and decommissioning.

feed.title: NANO Nuclear to Participate in and Present at Needham’s 28th Annual Growth Conference
feed.summary: NANO Nuclear Energy Inc. announced its participation in Needham's 28th Annual Growth Conference on Tuesday, January 13, 2026, where its management will present at 3:45 p.m. ET. The presentation replay will be available on the company's investor relations website for approximately 30 days. The company is inviting interested parties to request an invitation or schedule a one-on-one meeting through Needham investment bank representatives.

feed.title: C.H. Robinson Worldwide: Can a Legacy Logistics Giant Win the Digital Freight War?
feed.summary: C.H. Robinson Worldwide is transforming from a traditional freight broker into a software-driven logistics platform, aiming to lead the digital freight race. The company's Navisphere platform offers a comprehensive digital operating system for shippers and carriers, leveraging a vast network, real-time visibility, and automation. C.H. Robinson faces tough competition from digital-native rivals like Uber Freight and integrated logistics providers like Maersk, but maintains a competitive edge through its network density, global multimodal coverage, enterprise system integration, and a hybrid model of human expertise and automation.

feed.title: CF Industries says JERA ownership option in Blue Point joint venture has expired
feed.summary: CF Industries announced that JERA Co., Inc.'s conditional ownership option in the Blue Point Number One, LLC joint venture has expired, meaning CF Industries will not be required to increase its stake. The joint venture, which includes CF Industries, JERA, and Mitsui & Co., Ltd., focuses on low-carbon ammonia production. This development follows CF Industries' recent strong Q3 2025 earnings report and Wells Fargo maintaining an "Overweight" rating due to the company's positive outlook for nitrogen and strong free cash flow.

feed.title: B.C.’s GreenPower signs deal for EV production facility in New Mexico
feed.summary: GreenPower, a Vancouver, B.C.-based manufacturer of electric school buses and other commercial EVs, has signed a deal to build a new 135,000 sq.-ft. production facility in Santa Teresa, New Mexico. The facility, which will create 340 new jobs, was attracted by $14.6 million in financial incentives from New Mexico and the benefits of being located in a Foreign Trade Zone. This move builds on a previous $5 million contract for GreenPower to supply electric school buses to New Mexico.

feed.title: Proficient Auto Logistics Announces Conference Participation and Financial Results Call
feed.summary: Proficient Auto Logistics (PAL) announced its participation in the Stifel Transportation Conference on February 10-11, 2026. The company also scheduled an investor call for February 9, 2026, to discuss preliminary Q4 2025 financial results, which will be released at 4:00 p.m. EST on the same day. These preliminary results are subject to adjustments upon audit completion.

feed.title: XTI Aerospace Is Betting Big On The TriFan, But Burning Cash Fast
feed.summary: XTI Aerospace (XTIA) is developing the TriFan 600, a vertical lift crossover airplane, while also operating a growing Industrial IoT business. Despite significant share price decline and cash burn due to the pre-revenue aircraft program, the company has cleared FAA certification milestones and maintains a debt-free balance sheet. Investors should monitor certification progress, cash flow, and potential dilution risks as the company aims for the TriFan's first flight in 2026 and certification in 2027.

feed.title: Steinberganna Wealth Management Invests $1.56 Million in Peabody Energy Corporation $BTU
feed.summary: Steinberganna Wealth Management has initiated a new position in Peabody Energy Corporation (NYSE:BTU), purchasing 58,645 shares valued at approximately $1.56 million, making it their 27th largest holding. Institutional ownership of Peabody Energy is high at 87.44%, with other major investors also adjusting their stakes. Analyst sentiment is generally mixed, with an average "Hold" rating and a target price of $28.33, despite recent positive price target revisions from some firms.

feed.title: Valero Energy stock dips on Piper Sandler target cut as Venezuela talks keep traders guessing
feed.summary: Valero Energy Corp's stock dipped after Piper Sandler cut its price target, amidst ongoing speculation regarding Venezuela's energy sector and its potential impact on refining companies. Traders are closely watching crude oil movements, crack spreads, and the implications of White House discussions with oil companies about potential Venezuelan investments, as Valero prepares to release its fourth-quarter and full-year 2025 results. The company also faces issues related to its California operations, with its Benicia refinery ceasing operations in April 2026.

feed.title: Alaska Airlines announces largest aircraft order in company history
feed.summary: Alaska Airlines has announced its largest-ever aircraft order, including 105 Boeing 737-10 narrowbody jets and five Boeing 787 widebody Dreamliners. This significant investment aims to expand the airline's domestic and international routes, renew its fleet for fuel efficiency, and support growth, particularly for long-haul service to Europe and Asia. The order increases Alaska's total Boeing order book to 245 aircraft, with projections to operate over 550 aircraft by 2035.

feed.title: Alliant Energy appoints former PJM Interconnection CEO to board By Investing.com
feed.summary: Alliant Energy (NASDAQ:LNT) has appointed Manu Asthana, former President and CEO of PJM Interconnection, to its Board of Directors, effective February 23, 2026. Asthana brings extensive experience in the energy and financial sectors, and his appointment is expected to bolster Alliant Energy's leadership in utility operations and energy markets. The company, trading at $65.55 with a $16.8 billion market cap, boasts 55 consecutive years of dividend payments and a 3.14% current yield.

feed.title: Royal Caribbean’s Discovery Class May Become Reality
feed.summary: Royal Caribbean is reportedly preparing to order a new class of mid-sized ships, tentatively named the "Discovery Class," from Chantiers de l’Atlantique. While the cruise line has not confirmed details, this aligns with previous statements by CEO Michael Bayley about introducing smaller vessels. These new ships would likely be around 140,000–150,000 gross tons, capable of accessing ports too small for the Icon Class, and potentially replacing older ships like Vision of the Seas and Radiance of the Seas.

feed.title: FirstEnergy announces $249 million settlement. How your bill will change
feed.summary: The Public Utilities Commission of Ohio (PUCO) has approved a $249 million settlement with FirstEnergy Corp. to resolve investigations related to House Bill 6. This settlement will provide bill credits to FirstEnergy customers over three billing periods and allocate an additional $20 million for low-income assistance and energy efficiency programs. Customers of Ohio Edison, The Illuminating Company, and Toledo Edison are expected to see reduced bills, with an average residential customer receiving about $65.61 in credits over three months.

feed.title: Old Dominion Freight Line (NASDAQ:ODFL) Price Target Raised to $167.00 at TD Cowen
feed.summary: TD Cowen has increased its price target for Old Dominion Freight Line (NASDAQ:ODFL) to $167.00 from $154.00, while maintaining a "hold" rating. This new target suggests a potential downside of 3.25% from the stock's previous closing price. The company recently reported an EPS of $1.28, beating analyst estimates, despite a slight revenue decline.

feed.title: GreenPower Motor Expands Operations, Secures Financing
feed.summary: GreenPower Motor Company Inc. has announced significant expansion plans, including a new 135,000 sq. ft. facility in Santa Teresa, New Mexico, which is expected to create over 340 jobs. The company has also secured $10 million in new financing from CIBC, complementing $5 million from LEDA, to bolster its production of zero-emission vehicles. These strategic moves signal a period of growth and increased market traction for GreenPower, with its stock trading up by 54.69 percent.

feed.title: Horizon Aircraft to Provide a Business Update and Second Quarter 2026 Results on January 14, 2026 at 8:30 AM EST
feed.summary: Horizon Aircraft (NASDAQ:HOVR) will release its Q2 2026 financial results on January 14, 2026, at 8:30 AM EST. The company will host a conference call and webcast to discuss these results and provide a business update, inviting shareholders to submit questions in advance. Horizon Aircraft is an advanced aerospace engineering company developing a hybrid-electric VTOL aircraft.

feed.title: Keeping the Warfighter Safer: How Textron Systems’ New Integration Expands UAS Capability
feed.summary: Textron Systems has integrated a new low SWaP, low-cost LEO beyond-line-of-sight (BLOS) transceiver into its Aerosonde UAS platform, enhancing mission flexibility and connectivity. This development paves the way for future incorporation of Starshield’s Department of Defense pLEO solution, allowing the UAS to overcome traditional line-of-sight limitations for extended ISR and distributed operations. The technology aims to empower warfighters by improving situational awareness, shortening decision cycles, and enabling a smaller, more secure operational footprint while reducing the number of personnel in harm's way.

feed.title: Proficient Auto Logistics Announces Participation in Stifel Transportation & Logistics Conference
feed.summary: Proficient Auto Logistics, Inc. (NASDAQ: PAL) announced that its executives will participate in the Stifel Transportation & Logistics Conference on February 10 and 11, 2026. The company will also host an investor conference call on February 9, 2026, to discuss its preliminary unaudited operating and financial results for the fourth quarter and full year ended December 31, 2025. A press release detailing these results will be issued an hour before the call.

feed.title: GTLS - Ballard and Chart Successfully Test a Fuel Cell Powered by Liquid Hydrogen
feed.summary: Ballard Power Systems and Chart Industries have successfully tested a fuel cell powered by liquid hydrogen. This collaboration, building on over 90 years of combined hydrogen experience, demonstrates that heavy-duty vehicles using Ballard fuel cells can employ Chart's liquid onboard hydrogen (HLH2) vehicle fuel systems. Liquid hydrogen offers significant advantages for heavy-duty mobility, such as increased range and simplified fueling infrastructure, and the companies plan to identify applications for further testing.

feed.title: FirstEnergy announces $249 million settlement. How your bill will change
feed.summary: The Public Utilities Commission of Ohio (PUCO) has approved a $249 million settlement with FirstEnergy Corp. resolving investigations related to House Bill 6. FirstEnergy customers, specifically those of Ohio Edison, The Illuminating Company, and Toledo Edison, will receive bill credits over three billing periods, averaging about $65.61 for residential customers using 1,000 kWh per month. Additionally, $20 million from the settlement will fund low-income assistance and energy efficiency programs.

feed.title: EQT stock slips as U.S. natural gas price drops 6% in midday trade
feed.summary: EQT Corp shares fell about 2.4% due to a 6.1% drop in front-month Henry Hub natural gas futures. Despite a larger-than-usual storage draw, U.S. natural gas inventories remain above the five-year average, keeping prices under pressure. Investors are watching upcoming EIA storage reports and EQT's earnings commentary for further market direction.

feed.title: Chevron eyes up to $700 million cash flow upside from Venezuela
feed.summary: Chevron Corp. could boost its annual cash flow by $400 million to $700 million by increasing oil production in Venezuela, an analyst from TD Cowen suggests. This potential increase, representing 1% to 2% of the company's cash flow from operations, is seen as a "differentiated opportunity" for Chevron, the only U.S. oil major currently in Venezuela. Despite the long-term attractiveness of Venezuela's vast oil reserves, Chevron is expected to prioritize boosting output from existing assets rather than making significant new capital investments until there is a stable government and fiscal regime.

feed.title: Ti mill partnership considers waste-to-energy sustainability hub
feed.summary: Sylvamo is partnering with Bright Sand Industries to explore the creation of a waste-to-energy sustainability hub in Ticonderoga. This initiative aims to convert waste products into energy, contributing to sustainable practices within the mill's operations. The collaboration focuses on enhancing environmental sustainability through innovative waste management.

feed.title: Phillips 66 (PSX) Stock Dips While Market Gains: Key Facts
feed.summary: Phillips 66 (PSX) stock decreased by 1.43% to $142.16 in its latest trading session, underperforming the broader market. The company is set to announce its earnings on February 4, 2026, with an anticipated EPS of $2.24 and revenue of $30.09 billion. Phillips 66 currently holds a Zacks Rank #1 (Strong Buy) and is trading at a Forward P/E ratio of 11.79, indicating a discount relative to its industry average.

feed.title: Will Valero Energy (VLO) Beat Estimates Again in Its Next Earnings Report?
feed.summary: Valero Energy (VLO) is anticipated to continue its streak of beating earnings estimates, according to Zacks. The company has surpassed earnings estimates by an average of 27.93% in its last two quarters. With a positive Zacks Earnings ESP of +5.27% and a Zacks Rank #3 (Hold), VLO is positioned for another potential earnings beat in its upcoming report, expected on January 29, 2026.

feed.title: Bernstein Raises Price Target for FedEx (FDX) to $306 | FDX Stoc
feed.summary: Bernstein has raised its price target for FedEx (FDX) to $306 from $250, while maintaining a 'Market Perform' rating. This adjustment reflects an overall positive sentiment among analysts, with several firms recently increasing their price targets for the logistics giant. Despite the increased target, the average analyst forecast suggests a slight downside from FedEx's current price, though the consensus recommendation remains "Outperform."

feed.title: Cabot to Supply Battery Materials to PowerCo
feed.summary: Cabot Corporation has secured a multi-year supply agreement with PowerCo, Volkswagen's battery subsidiary. Cabot will provide conductive carbon products and dispersions for lithium-ion battery electrodes, which are expected to enhance cell performance and extend battery life. This partnership strengthens Cabot's presence in the European battery materials market.

feed.title: Calumet to Attend UBS Global Energy Conference and Hold Investor Meetings
feed.summary: Calumet, Inc. is set to attend the UBS Global Energy & Utilities Winter Conference on January 13, where it will present its market position in renewable fuels and specialty products and engage in one-on-one investor meetings to boost visibility. Analysts currently forecast an average 1-year price target of $23.67 for CLMT, with several firms maintaining "Buy" or "Hold" ratings and raising price targets based on strong business dynamics and favorable regulatory developments for renewable fuels. The company, headquartered in Indianapolis, operates extensively across North America, focusing on a diversified portfolio crucial for the energy transition.

feed.title: Bullish Atlas Energy Solutions Insiders Loaded Up On US$6.33m Of Stock
feed.summary: Insiders at Atlas Energy Solutions Inc. (NYSE:AESI) have significantly increased their holdings over the past year, with US$6.33 million worth of shares purchased. While there has been some recent selling, particularly by Chris Scholla, the overall sentiment is positive due to high insider ownership (24%) and past substantial purchases at prices higher than the current market value.

feed.title: Jeep and Chrysler kill plug-in hybrid models for 2026
feed.summary: Jeep and Chrysler are discontinuing their plug-in hybrid (PHEV) models for the 2026 model year, confirmed by Stellantis NV. This strategic shift is driven by changing customer demand and a focus on "more competitive electrified solutions" like mild hybrids and range-extended vehicles. The decision follows a series of recalls for Jeep's PHEV models, easing emissions regulations, and slower market growth for PHEVs compared to full hybrids and EVs.

feed.title: Canadian National Railway (NYSE:CNI) Given New $119.00 Price Target at Citigroup
feed.summary: Citigroup has adjusted its price target for Canadian National Railway (NYSE:CNI) to $119.00, down from $120.00, while maintaining a "buy" rating, indicating a potential 20% upside. Analyst opinions are varied, with a consensus of "Moderate Buy" and an average price target of $117.27, yet some firms like RBC have raised their targets significantly. The company recently surpassed EPS estimates but fell short on revenue for the last quarter.

feed.title: Westport Fuel Systems (WPRT) price target decreased by 11.34% to 3.65
feed.summary: The price target for Westport Fuel Systems (WPRT) has been decreased by 11.34%, bringing it down to $3.65. This change indicates a revised outlook on the company's stock valuation by analysts.

feed.title: Devon Energy Gains From Multi-basin Portfolio, Strategic Acquisition
feed.summary: Devon Energy (DVN) is benefiting from its diverse multi-basin portfolio, astute debt and cost management, consistent free cash flow generation, and strategic acquisitions that enhance its expansion and production capabilities. The company maintains a balanced exposure to oil, natural gas, and natural gas liquids, with long-term earnings growth projected at 3.28%. Despite potential headwinds from regulatory changes and limited control over third-party operated properties, DVN's shares have outperformed the industry, reflecting strong operational performance and strategic growth initiatives.

feed.title: Babcock & Wilcox & Siemens Energy Partner on 1GW Data Center Power Project - News and Statistics
feed.summary: Babcock & Wilcox has partnered with Siemens Energy to supply steam turbine generator sets for a 1GW power project destined for an Applied Digital data center. This collaboration aims to deliver reliable power by the end of 2028, leveraging Siemens Energy's turbine technology with B&W's boiler systems. The project involves four natural gas-fired power plants, each with a 300MW capacity, and is expected to finalize a comprehensive contract in Q1 2026.

feed.title: Entergy and NiSource Could Be Winners as Utilities Spend $1 Trillion on AI. Dividend Investors Not So Much
feed.summary: Utilities like Entergy and NiSource are poised to benefit from significant AI-driven energy demand, with projections indicating over $1 trillion in spending. While this investment is expected to boost earnings growth for these companies, it presents a mixed outlook for dividend investors. The article suggests that increased capital expenditure for AI infrastructure might impact the ability of utilities to maintain or increase dividend payouts.

feed.title: CHS expands into St. Louis to strengthen Center Gulf supply chain
feed.summary: CHS Inc., the largest farmer-owned cooperative in the U.S., is expanding its presence on the Mississippi River by leasing a key grain facility in Cahokia, Illinois, from COFCO International Ltd. This strategic move, effective January 31, 2026, aims to strengthen CHS's Center Gulf export strategy, enhance market access for its owners, and integrate the facility into its existing grain network across the Midwest. The Cahokia terminal offers year-round access to the St. Louis Harbor and direct connections to all six Class I railroads, optimizing high-speed grain transport.

feed.title: Ohio regulator approves settlement to end its FirstEnergy HB 6 cases
feed.summary: The Public Utilities Commission of Ohio (PUCO) has approved a settlement agreement resolving its House Bill 6-related cases involving FirstEnergy. This settlement mandates FirstEnergy to provide $249 million in restitution to customers over three billing periods, allocates $20 million for low-income programs, and includes additional refunds for improper charges. The agreement allows FirstEnergy to move past "legacy issues" related to the H.B. 6 scandal, in which the company admitted to bribing public officials.

feed.title: UBS reitera classificação de compra para ações da Phillips 66 após impacto do fechamento de refinaria
feed.summary: UBS reaffirmed its Buy rating for Phillips 66 (NYSE:PSX) with a $160 price target, despite a recent refinery closure impacting earnings. The firm adjusted its Q4 2025 EPS estimate to $2.05, acknowledging $230 million in additional DD&A expenses related to the Los Angeles refinery closure, an impact expected to subside in Q1 2026. Phillips 66 is also anticipated to reduce debt by approximately $1.3 billion and has announced plans to acquire Lindsey Oil Refinery assets in the UK.
feed.source: Investing.com Brasil - Finanças, Câmbio e Investimentos
feed.source_domain: Investing.com Brasil - Finanças, Câmbio e Investimentos

feed.title: General Motors writes down $6 billion as domestic EV sales plans change
feed.summary: General Motors announced a $6 billion write-down due to changes in its domestic EV sales strategy, including canceled contracts and scaled-back product plans. This follows a $1.6 billion charge in October 2025 and the shutdown of its BrightDrop electric delivery van brand. Despite these setbacks and a rival Ford's larger write-down, GM still grew sales in 2025, particularly in China with New Energy Vehicles.

feed.title: How United States Oil Fund (USO) Affects Rotational Strategy Timing
feed.summary: The article analyzes the United States Oil Fund (USO) with a neutral sentiment across all time horizons. It highlights an exceptional risk-reward setup targeting an 8.1% gain versus 0.3% risk if support holds, and provides three distinct AI-generated trading strategies: Position Trading, Momentum Breakout, and Risk Hedging. These strategies are tailored for different risk profiles, offering entry, target, and stop-loss levels for potential investors.

feed.title: Caterpillar & NVIDIA: Expand Physical AI for Manufacturing
feed.summary: Caterpillar and NVIDIA have expanded their collaboration, announced at CES 2026, to integrate physical AI into manufacturing processes. The partnership focuses on deploying edge AI, autonomy, and digital twins across construction, mining, and power equipment to enhance safety and productivity. Key initiatives include using NVIDIA Jetson Thor for real-time processing and autonomous operations, implementing generative AI with Cat AI Assistant for operator support, and leveraging NVIDIA AI Factory to create digital twins for optimizing factory and supply chain operations.

feed.title: Phillips 66 to buy idle UK refinery site but will not restart operations
feed.summary: US refiner Phillips 66 has agreed to buy the site of the former Lindsey refinery in Lincolnshire, UK, but explicitly stated it will not restart petroleum refining operations. Instead, Phillips 66 plans to integrate key assets like storage facilities into its nearby Humber refinery. While the move secures some jobs temporarily and aims to boost energy security by expanding the Humber refinery's capacity, critics worry the Lindsey site will become a "glorified storage tank" without full refining capabilities.

feed.title: Energy Capital Partners Completes Sale of Symmetry Energy Solutions
feed.summary: Energy Capital Partners (ECP) has completed the sale of Symmetry Energy Solutions to NextEra Energy Resources, LLC. During its five-year ownership, ECP worked with Symmetry's management to optimize its contract portfolio and expand its access to physical assets, enhancing its performance and market position as a national natural gas supply, logistics, and asset management platform. This transaction highlights the vital role of reliable natural gas providers in supporting economic resilience and the energy transition.

feed.title: CleanSpark’s Tightrope Walk: Expansion Pains and Power Grid Friction Spark Volatility in Bitcoin Mining Sector
feed.summary: CleanSpark (NASDAQ: CLSK) is facing significant challenges as it attempts to expand its Bitcoin mining operations while dealing with financial strain, increasing network difficulty, and infrastructure constraints. The company is pivoting towards becoming a diversified digital infrastructure provider, including AI and HPC data centers, but this transition presents its own set of hurdles, including massive capital expenditures and regulatory pushback on energy consumption. The article highlights CleanSpark's precarious position as it tries to balance debt, expansion goals, and the competitive landscape of the digital asset industry.

feed.title: The 2026 Mazda3 Is Proof That Compact Sedans Can Be Fun to Drive: Review
feed.summary: The 2026 Mazda3, despite its aging design, continues to be a highly engaging and athletic compact car, standing out with its powerful engine options and available all-wheel drive, a rarity in its segment. While it excels in driving dynamics and offers an upscale interior feel, its main drawbacks include a cramped backseat and an outdated infotainment system controlled by a console knob. The article concludes that the Mazda3 offers a strong value proposition for buyers prioritizing driving pleasure and style over interior space and modern infotainment features.

feed.title: The future depends on copper, but a coming shortage makes it a 'systemic risk' to the economy
feed.summary: A report from S&P Global warns that a coming copper shortage poses a "systemic risk" to the economy and technological advancement. Demand for copper is projected to jump 50% by 2040, leading to a significant shortfall due to slow mining development and geopolitical concentration of production. This highlights copper's crucial role in various sectors, from electrification and AI to defense.

feed.title: Chevron Stock Rises Friday As Oil Market Reacts To Venezuela Uncertainty
feed.summary: Chevron (NYSE: CVX) shares saw a marginal increase on Friday due to market reactions to uncertainty surrounding Venezuela's oil sector investments. Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent noted that major oil companies, including Chevron, are hesitant to invest in Venezuela without "serious guarantees." The article also details Chevron's technical indicators, upcoming earnings estimates, analyst outlooks, and Benzinga Edge rankings.

feed.title: Why SolarEdge (SEDG) Stock Is Trading Up Today
feed.summary: SolarEdge Technologies (SEDG) stock surged 5.8% after TD Cowen upgraded its rating to Buy from Hold and increased its price target, citing the company's successful turnaround plan and new product launches improving profit margins and market share. Other analysts, including Morgan Stanley and Jefferies, also raised their ratings or price targets, reflecting a more favorable view of the company. Despite the recent gains, SEDG is still trading significantly below its 52-week high, indicating potential for further growth as its new products gain traction.

feed.title: RXO (RXO) Is Up 8.3% After Improved Results and Insider Buying - What's Changed
feed.summary: RXO Inc. has seen an 8.3% stock increase following stronger quarterly revenues and reduced GAAP losses, alongside insider share purchases. While analysts note improved confidence due to these operational gains, they still highlight ongoing margin pressures and freight market headwinds. The upcoming Q4 2025 earnings call on February 6, 2026, will be crucial for investors seeking more clarity on the company's future performance and market conditions.

feed.title: Why Texas Pacific Land (TPL) stock is up today: oil climbs, insider filings add color
feed.summary: Texas Pacific Land (TPL) stock rose 1.5% due to an increase in oil prices and recent insider filings. The company, which owns significant acreage in the Permian Basin, benefits from oil and gas royalties and water services. Additionally, recent SEC Form 4 filings showed directors and a major institutional owner acquiring TPL shares.

feed.title: Meta signs nuclear energy deals to power Prometheus AI supercluster
feed.summary: Meta has announced agreements with three nuclear power providers—Vistra, TerraPower, and Oklo—to power its Prometheus supercluster AI computing system being built in New Albany, Ohio. These deals are crucial for supporting Meta's ambitious AI development, with a goal to add 6.6 gigawatts of power by 2035. The move reflects a broader trend among tech giants investing in nuclear energy to meet the massive power demands of AI infrastructure.

feed.title: CEG Stock Is Trading Above 200-Day SMA: Time to Buy, Hold or Sell?
feed.summary: Constellation Energy Corporation (CEG) stock is trading above its 200-day Simple Moving Average, indicating a bullish trend, largely due to its robust nuclear operations and focus on clean energy. The company is benefiting from rising clean-energy demand, strategic investments in renewables and acquisitions, and strong earnings growth estimates. While exhibiting good financial health and a capital return program, the stock is currently trading at a premium, suggesting new investors might want to wait before buying this Zacks Rank #3 (Hold) stock.

feed.title: Tesla stock surges nearly 2% today: here’s why analysts see more upside
feed.summary: Tesla's stock rose nearly 2% on optimism surrounding its Cybercab production timeline and Full Self-Driving advancements, leading analysts to increase price targets. The company is transitioning its narrative from a traditional automaker to a leader in AI and autonomous mobility, with Cybercab production set to begin in April 2026 and the robotaxi service expanding. Analysts like Wedbush Securities, Mizuho Securities, and Piper Sandler highlight the potential for high-margin autonomous services and energy infrastructure to drive significant profitability.

feed.title: Kodiak AI partners with Bosch to scale autonomous trucking hardware
feed.summary: Kodiak AI has partnered with Bosch to scale the manufacturing of its autonomous technology platform, Kodiak Driver, enabling both production line integration and fleet upfitting. This collaboration supports Kodiak AI's goal of deploying driverless trucks in long-haul trucking by the end of 2026, with Bosch providing hardware components and expertise to develop a redundant autonomous platform. The partnership highlights a broader trend among autonomous technology firms leveraging collaborations to accelerate production and growth.

feed.title: Kodiak AI partners with Bosch to scale autonomous trucking hardware
feed.summary: Kodiak AI has partnered with Bosch to scale the manufacturing of its Kodiak Driver autonomous technology platform. This collaboration will enable Kodiak AI to integrate its specialized hardware and software into vehicle production lines or through upfitters, helping the company achieve its goal of fully deploying its driverless platform in long-haul trucking by late 2026. Bosch will provide automotive-grade hardware components, sensors, and steering technologies, supporting the development of a redundant autonomous platform.

feed.title: Frontline Rolls Out $2 Billion Fleet Overhaul With Strategic Vessel Swap
feed.summary: Frontline plc, an Oslo-listed tanker company, is undertaking a major fleet renewal by trading eight older VLCCs for nine new, more efficient vessels in a deal exceeding $2 billion. This strategic move, involving John Fredriksen's investment vehicle, aims to modernize Frontline's fleet with latest-generation, scrubber-fitted ECO VLCCs, enhancing fuel efficiency and reducing emissions. The transaction is expected to generate significant net cash and positions Frontline with one of the most modern fleets in the market, with new deliveries scheduled through 2027.

feed.title: Icon Energy Corp. Enacts 1-for-5 Reverse Stock Split to Support Nasdaq Compliance
feed.summary: Icon Energy Corp. (ICON) implemented a 1-for-5 reverse stock split, effective January 8, 2026, on the Nasdaq Capital Market. This action aims to ensure compliance with Nasdaq listing standards and potentially enhance investor appeal by increasing the share price. Despite a "Hold" analyst rating and concerns about the company's financial quality, the reverse split is expected to improve market perception and liquidity for the international shipping company.

feed.title: APA stock slips after Thursday’s 8% jump as oil climbs and jobs data nears
feed.summary: APA Corporation's stock dipped on Friday after an 8.5% jump the previous day, influenced by rising oil prices due to geopolitical concerns in Venezuela and Iran. Traders are closely watching upcoming U.S. nonfarm payrolls data and APA's next earnings report for further market direction. The company's CEO also received a significant stock award, as disclosed in a recent SEC filing.

feed.title: ZTO Express (Cayman) (NYSE:ZTO) Lowered to Hold Rating by Zacks Research
feed.summary: Zacks Research has downgraded ZTO Express (Cayman) (NYSE:ZTO) from a "strong-buy" to a "hold" rating, despite mixed analyst coverage that still results in a "Moderate Buy" consensus and an average price target of $22.36. The company recently missed quarterly earnings estimates, reporting $0.43 EPS against a $2.51 consensus, though revenue grew 11.1% year-over-year and it maintains healthy profitability with an 18.61% net margin. ZTO Express is a leading Chinese express delivery company that utilizes a technology-enabled network and a franchise-style operating model.

feed.title: ZTO Express (NYSE:ZTO) Presents a Compelling Value Investment Case
feed.summary: The article presents ZTO Express (NYSE:ZTO) as a compelling value investment due to its strong financial condition, significant earnings, and consistent growth in China's e-commerce logistics market. Despite cautious market valuation, ZTO exhibits favorable Price-to-Earnings and cash flow ratios compared to industry peers, suggesting it is undervalued. The company's robust balance sheet and projected revenue growth further support its potential as a sound investment for value-oriented investors.

feed.title: Enlight Renewable Energy (NASDAQ:ENLT) Hits New 1-Year High - Should You Buy?
feed.summary: Enlight Renewable Energy (NASDAQ:ENLT) recently reached a new 52-week high of $52.29, significantly above its moving averages and analyst consensus target. While the company beat last quarter's earnings and revenue estimates, it faces mixed analyst ratings, a high P/E ratio, and elevated debt-to-equity. Institutional investors have shown increased interest, though the stock is not among MarketBeat's top recommendations for immediate purchase.

feed.title: Nessel challenges MPSC approval of DTE's data center electricity deal
feed.summary: Michigan Attorney General Dana Nessel is challenging the state energy regulators' approval of DTE Energy Co.'s special electricity contracts for a high-profile data center in Saline Township. Nessel argues that the Michigan Public Service Commission (MPSC) lacked the statutory authority to approve these contracts without a contested process, thereby preventing public intervention to protect ratepayers. She has filed a petition for rehearing, expressing concern over the fast-tracked decision and the unclear conditions imposed by the MPSC.

feed.title: Royal Caribbean breaks ground on new Miami cruise terminal
feed.summary: Royal Caribbean Group and Miami-Dade County have broken ground on the new $345 million Cruise Terminal G at PortMiami, designed to accommodate up to 7,000 passengers and the world's largest Icon Class vessels, with an estimated completion in late 2027. This development follows PortMiami's record-breaking 2025 fiscal year, which saw 8.5 million cruise passengers, and highlights the port's continued growth as a major cruise hub. The new terminal will feature advanced technology and sustainable design to enhance the guest experience.

feed.title: Trump says Big Oil will invest $100 billion in Venezuela as Chevron, Exxon come to the White House today. Here’s what to watch.
feed.summary: President Trump is holding a meeting at the White House with major U.S. oil companies, traders, and refiners to discuss his ambitions for Venezuela's crude oil. Companies like Chevron and Exxon Mobil are expected to attend, alongside refiners Marathon Petroleum and Valero Energy. The meeting aims to explore the potential for U.S. oil companies to expand into Venezuela.

feed.title: Novagold unveils natural gas supply LOI for Alaska gold project
feed.summary: Novagold Resources Inc., through its Donlin Gold LLC joint venture, has signed a non-binding letter of intent with Glenfarne Alaska LNG for a potential natural gas supply to power the proposed Donlin Gold mine. This arrangement could lower fuel and logistics costs and enhance project economics. The Donlin Gold project is advancing a bankable feasibility study and holds one of the world's largest undeveloped open pit gold endowments.

feed.title: Alaska Airlines Pilot Files $10M Lawsuit Against Boeing, Alleges Company Shifted Blame After Mid-Air Blowout
feed.summary: Captain Brandon Fisher, the pilot of the Alaska Airlines Boeing 737 Max 9 that experienced a mid-air door plug blowout, has filed a $10 million lawsuit against Boeing. He alleges that Boeing attempted to shift blame for the incident, which was later determined by the NTSB to be due to manufacturing defects, onto him. Fisher claims Boeing's legal defense strategy in a class-action lawsuit intentionally painted him as a "scapegoat," causing him severe emotional distress.

feed.title: Eversource completes $7.2M Plainfield substation upgrade to support solar growth, capacity
feed.summary: Eversource has completed a $7.2 million upgrade to a substation in Plainfield, Massachusetts, replacing a 70-year-old transformer with a new, larger unit. This upgrade is designed to support the growing demand for energy from new solar developments and increased electricity use for vehicles and homes in Plainfield and surrounding towns. The project, part of the state’s Electric Sector Modernization Plan, was completed a year ahead of schedule and $2 million under budget, aiming to improve capacity, reliability, and resiliency in the region.

feed.title: Vistra Seizes Opportunity Through $4.7 Billion Cogentrix Energy Acquisition
feed.summary: Vistra Corp. has acquired 90% of Cogentrix Energy's natural gas generation assets for $4.7 billion, significantly boosting its power generation capacity and market standing. The acquisition led to a rise in Vistra's stock and signals strategic foresight in the competitive energy sector, with Quantum Capital Group retaining a stake. While some analysts slightly lowered price targets, they maintained a positive outlook, anticipating increased revenue and shareholder value.

feed.title: Inside a custom V8 Defender born from a new global design alliance
feed.summary: ECD Automotive Design (ECDA) and Chelsea Truck Company (CTC) have debuted the ECDxCTC Defender 02, continuing their strategic alliance in bespoke vehicle design. This factory-new Defender 110 P525 V8 features CTC's Series 2 Wide Track body kit, 22-inch wheels, exposed carbon fiber elements, and a 5.0L P525 supercharged V8 engine. The collaboration aims to deliver unique, high-performance vehicles, with more builds and expanded offerings planned for modern Defender platforms.

feed.title: Union Pacific Corp: How a 160-Year-Old Freight Giant Is Quietly Turning Into a Software-Led Platform
feed.summary: Union Pacific Corp is transforming into a data-driven logistics platform, leveraging advanced technology and its vast rail network to compete more effectively in the freight market. The company is evolving its operations to function more like a software-led product, focusing on network reach, operational technology, and digital tools for shippers. This strategic shift aims to improve reliability, reduce emissions, and increase transparency, ultimately enhancing its competitive edge against other railroads and trucking companies.

feed.title: Enterprise Products Up 6% in a Year: Time to Bet on the Stock or Wait?
feed.summary: Enterprise Products Partners LP (EPD) has gained 6.1% over the past year, outperforming the industry's composite stocks. While the company boasts inflation-protected contracts, operates a stable fee-based model, and consistently returns capital to unitholders, its high debt-to-capitalization ratio and lower distribution yield compared to the industry suggest investors should hold rather than buy immediately. The article recommends retaining existing shares but advises against new investments at this time.

feed.title: Enlight Renewable Energy Ltd stock hits all-time high at 51.78 USD
feed.summary: Enlight Renewable Energy Ltd's stock has reached an all-time high of $51.78, marking a 200.42% increase over the past year. This achievement reflects strong investor confidence and the company's growth in the renewable energy sector. The company also reported strong third-quarter 2025 earnings per share of $0.16, significantly beating analyst forecasts, despite missing revenue expectations.

feed.title: Uber’s Q4 2025 Earnings: What to Expect
feed.summary: Uber Technologies Inc. (UBER) is set to release its Q4 2025 earnings, with analysts anticipating a diluted EPS of $0.83, a significant drop from the prior year. Despite this projected short-term decline, the company's shares have risen 34.9% over the past year, outperforming major indices, and analysts maintain a "Strong Buy" consensus rating with an average target price suggesting a 28.2% upside. Recent strategic partnerships and developments, such as renewing its mapping agreement with TomTom and expanding government collaborations, are contributing to its market momentum.

feed.title: A Look At Eni (BIT:ENI) Valuation After Refinery Spin Out To Eni Industrial Evolution
feed.summary: Eni (BIT:ENI) has spun out its traditional refineries into a new entity, Eni Industrial Evolution S.p.A., to streamline operations and align with decarbonization goals. Despite a modest 90-day share price gain, the stock currently trades at a reported 28.4% intrinsic discount, suggesting potential mispricing. The article explores different valuation angles, including a 4.8% undervaluation based on a primary narrative focusing on growth in biorefining and sustainable mobility, and compares its P/E ratio to industry peers.

feed.title: Tesla Stock Is Rising -- Analysts Talk 2026 Robotaxi Catalysts
feed.summary: Tesla shares rose after New Street Research highlighted the global robotaxi market as approaching an inflection point, expecting commercial operations to expand in 2026. Analyst Peter Vogel reiterated a Buy rating and a $600 price target, emphasizing Tesla's structural advantages in lower vehicle costs, vertical integration, and a flexible supply model that leverages customer-owned vehicles. Anticipated catalysts for 2026 include progress in unsupervised self-driving and the start of Cybercab production, potentially making robotaxi services a significant revenue driver for Tesla.

feed.title: The Gas Inflection: EOG Resources Pivots Toward AI and LNG as 2026 Strategy Takes Shape
feed.summary: EOG Resources is shifting its corporate strategy for 2026, moving from being primarily an oil producer to a natural gas powerhouse, focusing on high-margin gas assets like Dorado and Utica. This pivot aims to capitalize on the global LNG export boom and the domestic electricity demand fueled by AI and data centers. The company plans a disciplined $6.5 billion capital expenditure and will return at least 70% of free cash flow to shareholders, anticipating a significant demand increase later in the year.

feed.title: DAL: Susquehanna Raises Delta Air Lines Price Target to $85 | DA
feed.summary: Susquehanna has maintained a "Positive" rating on Delta Air Lines (DAL) and increased its price target to $85, up from $70. This update follows similar positive sentiments from other analysts like TD Cowen, B of A Securities, Goldman Sachs, Wells Fargo, and UBS, all of whom have raised their price targets for DAL recently. Despite these positive analyst forecasts, which show an average target price of $77.46, GuruFocus estimates a fair value of $47.90, suggesting a potential downside for the stock.

feed.title: Phillips 66 stock rating reiterated at Buy by UBS on refinery closure impact
feed.summary: UBS has reiterated its Buy rating on Phillips 66 (NYSE:PSX) with a $160.00 price target, despite adjusting its Q4 2025 EPS estimate to $2.05 due to additional DD&A expense from a refinery closure. The firm anticipates the company will reduce debt by approximately $1.3 billion through asset sales and working capital release, alongside planned share buybacks. This comes amidst mixed analyst opinions, with Freedom Capital Markets downgrading the stock to Sell, while Mizuho maintains a Neutral rating following Phillips 66's acquisition of Lindsey Oil Refinery assets in the UK.

feed.title: Gladstone Investment acquires Rowan Energy, terms not disclosed

The company is poised for significant cash flow generation, projecting an 8% CAGR in adjusted EBITDA through 2026 and a 3% CAGR in dividends per share. With a current dividend yield of 5.94%, Enbridge offers an attractive investment compared to peers like Williams (WMB) and Kinder Morgan (KMI).

feed.title: UBS reiterates Buy rating on Targa Resources stock with $228 price target

This reiteration comes alongside Targa's recent $1.25 billion acquisition of Stakeholder Midstream, which is expected to expand its infrastructure and enhance operations in the Permian Basin.

feed.title: Riley Permian declares quarterly dividend of $0.40 per share By Investing.com
feed.summary: Riley Exploration Permian, Inc. announced a quarterly cash dividend of $0.40 per share, offering a 6.21% yield and marking the fifth consecutive year of dividend increases. This announcement follows recent strategic financial maneuvers, including the sale of midstream assets for $111 million and a new $100 million share repurchase program, aimed at deleveraging its balance sheet and enhancing shareholder value. Texas Capital Securities reiterated a Buy rating on the stock with a $63.00 price target.

feed.title: Cisco – Sustainability Trends for 2026: From Boardroom Decisions to Real-World Systems
feed.summary: Cisco outlines key sustainability trends for 2026, emphasizing its evolution from a standalone initiative to a core business discipline. The company highlights the integration of sustainability into strategic planning, advancements in circularity beyond basic recycling, the scaling of innovation in energy systems, and the growing impact of AI on energy demand. Cisco also discusses the emerging need for quantum-safe networks and preparing for future quantum technologies.

feed.title: Southwest Airlines stock hits 52-week high at $44.20

feed.title: Alaska Airlines Pilot Files $10M Lawsuit Against Boeing, Alleges Company Shifted Blame After Mid-Air Blowout
feed.summary: Captain Brandon Fisher, the pilot who safely landed an Alaska Airlines Boeing 737 Max 9 after a door plug blew out, is suing Boeing for $10 million. He alleges that Boeing attempted to shift blame onto him following the incident, despite an NTSB investigation concluding it was due to manufacturing defects. Fisher’s lawsuit claims severe emotional distress and states the FBI told him he may have been a victim of criminally negligent conduct by Boeing.

feed.title: Blackstone acquires Alliance Technical Group
feed.summary: Blackstone has acquired Alliance Technical Group (ATG), a leading provider of environmental testing, monitoring, and compliance services. This acquisition expands Blackstone's presence in the environmental services industry and is part of their strategy to invest in businesses benefiting from the growing demand for electricity and the energy transition. ATG, founded in 2000, offers solutions like source and lab testing and emissions monitoring, with over 2,200 employees across North America.

The company also boasts an attractive dividend yield and has maintained dividend payments for 13 consecutive years, making it an appealing option for income-focused investors.

This service aims to reduce costs for parcel delivery in one of the region's highest-traffic corridors, with Cainiao controlling key logistical nodes including sorting, line-haul transfer, and last-mile delivery using its own local networks. The company expects to cover 99% of the Mexican market and offer prices approximately 60% lower than the current market average.

feed.title: If You'd Invested $10,000 in This Nuclear Energy ETF 1 Year Ago, You Might Be Surprised How Much You'd Have Today
