Investors bullish on the nuclear sector but seeking diversification might find an ETF like NLR appealing.

feed.title: Otter Tail Corporation (NASDAQ:OTTR) Plans Quarterly Dividend of $0.58
feed.summary: Otter Tail Corporation (NASDAQ:OTTR) has announced a quarterly dividend of $0.5775 per share, representing a 10.0% increase from its previous dividend. This dividend is payable on March 10th to shareholders of record on February 13th, resulting in an annualized dividend of $2.10 and a yield of 2.7%. The company has consistently raised its dividend for 12 consecutive years, with analysts expecting a future payout ratio of 59.0%.

feed.title: Are Options Traders Betting on a Big Move in Avis Budget Group Stock?
feed.summary: Options traders are showing significant interest in Avis Budget Group (CAR) stock, indicated by the high implied volatility of its Jan 16, 2026 $80 Call options. This suggests expectations for a substantial price movement in either direction. However, analysts are bearish on the company, with the stock holding a Zacks Rank #4 (Sell) and recent downward revisions to earnings estimates, potentially signaling a strategic opportunity for options traders to sell premium.

feed.title: CarMax resets pricing strategy as it pushes for 2026 recovery
feed.summary: CarMax is implementing a new strategy to recover in 2026, focusing on lowering average selling prices and adjusting spending by increasing marketing and cutting administrative expenses. This move comes as the company experienced significant declines in sales, net earnings, and used-vehicle unit sales in its fiscal Q3 2026. The changes signal a more aggressive competitive environment for other used-car dealerships, who will need to adapt their own strategies to compete with a "retooled CarMax."

feed.title: Phillips 66 stock jumps before the open as Venezuela oil talks keep refiners in focus
feed.summary: Phillips 66 (PSX) shares rose 4.6% in premarket trading due to investor focus on potential U.S. policy shifts regarding Venezuelan oil sales. The company's CFO noted the capacity to process Venezuelan crude at its Gulf Coast refineries, though its CEO cautioned about the long-term investment needed for full supply potential. Despite a lowered price target from Piper Sandler, the stock is approaching its 52-week high, with investors awaiting specifics from a White House meeting with oil producers and Phillips 66's Q4 and full-year 2025 earnings call on February 4.

feed.title: Enterprise Products Partners L.P. (NYSE:EPD) Announces Dividend Increase - $0.55 Per Share
feed.summary: Enterprise Products Partners L.P. (NYSE:EPD) has announced an increase in its quarterly dividend to $0.55 per share, to be paid on February 13th to shareholders of record on January 30th. This represents a 0.9% increase from the previous dividend and marks the 28th consecutive year of dividend increases for the company, yielding 6.9%. Despite a recent EPS miss, analysts project robust future earnings, indicating the dividend remains well-covered.

feed.title: Uranium Energy Reaches Key Operational Milestone Amid Favorable Market Conditions
feed.summary: Uranium Energy Corp. has achieved a significant operational milestone by fully modernizing and returning its Irigaray processing plant in Wyoming to 24/7 operations, annualizing to one million pounds of uranium. This comes amidst rising uranium prices and strong U.S. government support, including the designation of uranium as a "critical mineral." The company is also pursuing vertical integration to control the entire uranium supply chain and has a robust balance sheet with substantial liquidity and no debt.

feed.title: US' Montrose Environmental launches VeriPlume Capture System
feed.summary: Montrose Environmental Group has launched its new VeriPlume Capture System, a patent-pending technology designed to safely and accurately measure methane emissions from high-volume vents up to 60 feet high. This carbon-fibre telescoping tool allows technicians to work from the ground, enhancing safety, reducing costs, and helping oil and gas companies comply with EPA regulations. The company also highlighted other environmental innovations, including PFAS and VOC abatement technologies, reinforcing its commitment to addressing critical environmental challenges.

feed.title: Otter Tail has paid dividends 88 years—and is raising them again
feed.summary: Otter Tail Corporation (OTTR) has increased its quarterly common stock dividend by 10% to $0.5775 per share, raising the annual indicated dividend rate to $2.31 per share. This marks the second consecutive year of a double-digit dividend increase and the 88th consecutive year the company will pay dividends. The increase reflects Otter Tail's strong financial position and commitment to shareholder value.

feed.title: Arrive AI Celebrates 2025 Milestones
feed.summary: Arrive AI, a company focused on autonomous delivery networks, released its 2025 Year in Review, highlighting significant achievements in public markets, product development, partnerships, and intellectual property. Key milestones include a Nasdaq debut, joining the Russell 2000 and 3000 indexes, healthcare deployments, and global expansion through strategic partnerships. The company plans to continue scaling deployments and expanding use cases in 2026, leveraging its NVIDIA Connect integration.

feed.title: ASP Isotopes Stock Surged Over 13% Today – Why The Company Stands To Gain From Meta’s Nuclear Energy Deal With TerraPower
feed.summary: ASP Isotopes (ASPI) stock surged over 13% after Meta Platforms (META) announced a long-term agreement with TerraPower to secure nuclear energy. ASP Isotopes had previously finalized agreements with TerraPower in 2025 to finance and supply fuel for advanced nuclear projects. The company's proprietary Aerodynamic Separation Process and focus on High-Assay Low-Enriched Uranium (HALEU) position it favorably for the growing demand for nuclear energy.

feed.title: AZZ Inc. (NYSE:AZZ) Q3 2026 Earnings Call Transcript
feed.summary: AZZ Inc. (NYSE:AZZ) reported record sales of $426 million in Q3 2026, driven by strong performance in its Metal Coatings segment and increased demand from infrastructure and energy transition projects. Despite some softness in construction and transportation markets impacting Precoat Metals, the company achieved a robust adjusted EBITDA of over $91 million and narrowed its fiscal 2026 guidance for sales, EBITDA, and adjusted EPS. The call also highlighted the strategic importance of data center investments, the shift from plastics to aluminum in food and beverage containers, and ongoing M&A evaluations for bolt-on acquisitions.

feed.title: Why Vistra (VST) stock is jumping premarket: Meta signs 20-year nuclear power deals
feed.summary: Vistra (VST) stock surged approximately 8% in premarket trading after Meta Platforms signed 20-year agreements to purchase nuclear power from three Vistra plants in Ohio and Pennsylvania. These deals aim to secure reliable, zero-carbon electricity for Meta's surging data center demand and AI buildout. The agreements involve over 2,600 megawatts of energy, including existing generation and output increases, with Meta's purchases starting in late 2026.

feed.title: This Overlooked Midstream Stock Is Now a Permian Powerhouse
feed.summary: Oneok (NYSE: OKE) has undergone a significant transformation, evolving from a Bakken-focused natural gas liquids company into a fully integrated midstream operator with a dominant presence in the Permian Basin. Despite its 5.8% dividend yield, consistent payouts, and strong earnings growth, the stock has been overlooked due to concerns about declining natural gas volumes. The company's strategic acquisitions and ongoing expansion projects are expected to drive substantial earnings growth through 2027, making it a compelling investment opportunity.

feed.title: Lizzie Taylor
feed.summary: Lizzie Taylor is the Head of Customer Experience at S&P Global Energy, where she is responsible for the strategic direction of customer engagement and retention. She focuses on embedding a customer-first philosophy across all aspects of the division, utilizing AI-driven insights and data-led marketing to create personalized customer journeys. Based in London, she holds a degree in Econometrics and Mathematical Economics from the London School of Economics and has over 20 years of experience in client-centric roles.

feed.title: Are Renewable and Storage Projects Supporting Quanta's Backlog?
feed.summary: Quanta Services is experiencing strong growth in its backlog due to increasing demand for renewable and storage projects from utilities. This trend reinforces the quality and visibility of Quanta's backlog, which reached a record $39.2 billion in Q3 2025. The company's integrated "Total Solutions" model is positioning it advantageously against competitors like MasTec and Fluor in the evolving infrastructure market.

feed.title: RXO Inc. price target raised to $14 from $13 at TD Cowen
feed.summary: TD Cowen analyst Jason Seidl has increased the price target for RXO Inc. (RXO) to $14 from $13 while maintaining a Hold rating. This adjustment is part of a Q4 trucking group preview, with the analyst noting that a carrier survey indicates regulation-driven capacity attrition, which is expected to benefit RXO Inc. in 2026.

feed.title: HS Management Partners LLC Has $41.15 Million Stake in Uber Technologies, Inc. $UBER
feed.summary: HS Management Partners LLC reduced its stake in Uber Technologies by 38.5% in the third quarter, holding 420,025 shares valued at $41.15 million, which constitutes 5.3% of its portfolio. Uber reported strong earnings, exceeding analyst expectations with $3.11 EPS and $13.47 billion in revenue, representing a 20.4% year-over-year increase. Despite insider sales totaling around $1.35 million in the past three months, analysts maintain a "Moderate Buy" rating for Uber with an average price target of $107.14.

feed.title: Murphy USA stock rating initiated at Underperform by BofA Securities
feed.summary: BofA Securities initiated coverage on Murphy USA (NYSE:MUSA) with an Underperform rating and a $405 price target, citing concerns over the company's dependence on fuel and nicotine sales and its valuation compared to industry averages. Despite the negative rating, BofA acknowledged positive aspects of the business such as its long-term strategy and commitment to shareholder returns. Separately, Murphy USA recently reported strong Q3 2025 earnings, surpassing analyst expectations, and appointed a new independent director to its board.

feed.title: Montrose Environmental Group Introduces Patent-Pending Veriplume System to Advance Methane Emissions Measurement Innovation
feed.summary: Montrose Environmental Group has introduced its patent-pending VeriPlume Capture System™, designed to improve the safety and accuracy of methane emissions measurement from high-volume vent releases. This innovation addresses significant challenges in methane reduction, offering a safer, more efficient, and cost-effective method for regulatory compliance. The VeriPlume system expands Montrose’s diverse portfolio of environmental solutions, which also includes technologies for PFAS removal and industrial VOC abatement.

feed.title: Nio Dec exports surge 79% from Nov to record 750 units
feed.summary: Nio's exports in December surged by 79% from November to a record 750 units, according to data from the China Passenger Car Association. The company also recorded strong domestic sales, ranking ninth in China's NEV market with 47,385 vehicles sold. Nio plans to expand its international presence to 40 countries and regions by year-end, primarily leveraging its new Firefly sub-brand for global market exploration.

feed.title: PortMiami inicia construção de novo terminal de cruzeiros do Royal Caribbean Group
feed.summary: A Royal Caribbean Group iniciou a construção do Cruise Terminal G no PortMiami, um novo terminal de cruzeiros projetado para ser um dos mais modernos e sustentáveis, com entrega prevista para 2027. O terminal terá capacidade para 7.000 passageiros e atenderá as marcas Royal Caribbean International, Celebrity Cruises e Silversea, aumentando a infraestrutura portuária de Miami. Este projeto é uma parceria público-privada que visa atender à crescente demanda do setor de cruzeiros na região.

feed.title: Indonesia Energy Moves Forward With Two New Wells at Kruh Block, Where Pre-Drilling Operations Have Commenced
feed.summary: Indonesia Energy Corporation (IEC) has announced significant progress on pre-drilling operations for two new wells, K-29 and WK-5, at its Kruh Block in Indonesia. The company expects to begin drilling the first well before the end of the first quarter of 2026, with all necessary equipment and approvals in place. IEC's President, Mr. Frank Ingriselli, will also present updates on these operations at the upcoming DealFlow Discovery Conference on January 28, 2026.

feed.title: New oil wells planned in Sumatra as Indonesia Energy readies drilling
feed.summary: Indonesia Energy (NYSE: INDO) has announced significant pre-drilling progress for two new wells, K-29 and WK-5, on its 64,000-acre Kruh Block in Sumatra. The company is on track to begin drilling the first well before the end of Q1 2026, having completed key milestones such as constructing drilling pads, delivering equipment, and securing government-controlled explosives. President Frank Ingriselli will provide further updates at the DealFlow Discovery Conference on January 28, 2026.

feed.title: Bullish Atlas Energy Solutions Insiders Loaded Up On US$6.33m Of Stock
feed.summary: Insiders at Atlas Energy Solutions Inc. (NYSE:AESI) purchased US$6.33 million worth of stock over the last year, significantly increasing their holdings, which is seen as a positive indicator despite some recent selling by a single insider. The founder's large purchase at a higher price than the current market value suggests optimism. Insiders collectively own 24% of the company, valued at US$294 million, which aligns management's interests with shareholders.

feed.title: Vistra (VST) Stock Soars in Premarket on Major Nuclear Power Deal With Meta
feed.summary: Vistra (NYSE: VST) stock surged over 13% in premarket trading after announcing a 20-year nuclear energy agreement with Meta. This landmark deal involves Vistra supplying over 2,600 megawatts of zero-carbon energy from three nuclear plants to Meta and includes significant capacity expansion and license renewals. The agreement is poised to boost Vistra's long-term growth and address the increasing power demands of AI operations, while also bringing substantial economic benefits to local communities.

feed.title: Spire Wealth Management Sells 62,674 Shares of NextEra Energy, Inc. $NEE
feed.summary: Spire Wealth Management significantly reduced its stake in NextEra Energy, Inc. (NYSE:NEE) by 63.4%, selling 62,674 shares. This move leaves them with 36,192 shares valued at approximately $2.73 million. Additionally, NextEra Energy CEO Armando Pimentel, Jr. also sold a substantial portion of his holdings, reducing his position by 47.15% through the sale of 145,140 shares for about $12.18 million.

feed.title: FedEx stock rating upgraded to Buy at BofA Securities on strong outlook
feed.summary: BofA Securities has upgraded FedEx (NYSE:FDX) stock from Neutral to Buy, increasing its price target to $365.00 from $315.00, citing strong near-term performance potential. The upgrade follows FedEx's impressive fiscal second-quarter results, including a 7% year-over-year revenue growth and a 19% increase in EPS, leading other analysts like Stifel, Truist Securities, and TD Cowen to also raise their price targets. The firm also named FedEx as one of its top transportation sector picks for 2026.

feed.title: EQT stock wobbles as U.S. natural gas prices slide on warm weather signals
feed.summary: EQT Corp stock experienced a 4.2% drop as U.S. natural gas prices, particularly the Henry Hub spot price, slid significantly due to warmer weather forecasts and steady supply. While oil-weighted peers saw gains, natural gas-linked companies like EQT faced pressure. The future direction of gas prices and EQT's stock will depend on upcoming weather shifts, weekly storage data, and the company's Q4 results expected in February.

feed.title: Public Service Ent.: How PSEG’s Grid Modernization Play Becomes a Product in Its Own Right
feed.summary: Public Service Enterprise Group (PSEG) is transforming its Public Service Electric & Gas (PSE&G) regulated utility business into a strategic product focused on grid modernization, clean energy, and digital customer tools. This approach positions Public Service Ent. as a cohesive platform driving revenue and growth through predictable regulated returns, differentiating it from competitors like Duke Energy, Consolidated Edison, and NextEra Energy. PSEG's focus on a low-risk, regulated growth engine, integrated efficiency and electrification efforts, and strong alignment with New Jersey's climate policies contribute to its competitive edge and stable valuation.

feed.title: FDX Stock Price, Forecast & Analysis | FEDEX CORP (NYSE:FDX)
feed.summary: This article provides an analysis of FedEx Corp (NYSE: FDX) stock, including its current price, performance, key statistics, and comparison with competitors. It also details FDX's business operations, financial highlights, and analyst ratings and forecasts. The stock currently stands at $312.36, with analysts anticipating a slight decrease over the next year.

feed.title: XOM's Integrated Business Model Shields Earnings Amid Lower Oil Prices
feed.summary: Exxon Mobil's integrated business model helps shield its earnings from lower oil prices by leveraging its refining operations. The company's downstream segments benefit from cheaper crude, offsetting potential declines in its upstream earnings. This strategy contributes to stabilizing profitability even during volatile commodity markets, a benefit also shared by other integrated energy majors like Chevron and BP.

feed.title: Seadrill stock price target raised to $40 from $33 at BTIG on dayrate resilience
feed.summary: BTIG has raised its price target for Seadrill Ltd. (NYSE:SDRL) to $40 from $33, maintaining a Buy rating due to resilient dayrates in the offshore drilling market. Despite a slight decrease in floater activity and working floater count, utilization rates remain strong, nearing levels where leading edge dayrates exceeded $500,000. Seadrill's recent contract wins, including the Mykonos drillship contract, underscore its financial health and operational strength.

feed.title: What happens to dead solar panels? Nevada plant can recycle them
feed.summary: Comstock Metals (NYSE: LODE) has secured final regulatory approvals for its solar panel recycling facility in Silver Springs, Nevada. The plant, designed to process over 3 million panels annually, received a Written Determination Permit and an Air Quality control permit, clearing the way for commissioning in Q1 2026. This facility aims to offer a zero-landfill, industry-scale solution for end-of-life solar panels, particularly in the southwestern U.S., where decommissioning is accelerating.

feed.title: KNOT Offshore Partners (NYSE:KNOP) Upgraded at Zacks Research
feed.summary: KNOT Offshore Partners (NYSE:KNOP) was upgraded by Zacks Research from a "hold" to a "strong-buy" rating. The company recently reported strong quarterly earnings, beating analyst expectations with $0.45 EPS and $96.87 million in revenue. Despite recent analyst downgrades from other firms, the stock is trading up and shows significant institutional ownership.

feed.title: Why Plug Power (PLUG) Shares Are Plunging Today
feed.summary: Shares of Plug Power (NASDAQ:PLUG) fell 7.3% after TD Cowen downgraded the stock to Hold from Buy, lowering its price target to $2 from $4. This downgrade reflects a challenging outlook for the broader hydrogen industry, with a report indicating 2026 as a "year of reckoning" for the sector. The stock has been volatile, previously gaining 7.3% on an analyst upgrade citing potential profitability through cost-savings, but despite this, it remains significantly down year-to-date and from its 52-week high.

feed.title: Why AerSale (ASLE) Stock Is Up Today
feed.summary: Shares of AerSale (ASLE) surged 4.8% after Truist Financial increased its price target on the company's shares to $8 from $6, while maintaining a "Hold" rating. Investors responded positively to this increased price target, signaling improved confidence in the company's future value. This follows a strong second quarter where AerSale exceeded analyst expectations for both revenue and earnings, with significant improvements in profitability and free cash flow.

feed.title: Why Greenbrier (GBX) Stock Is Nosediving
feed.summary: Greenbrier's (GBX) stock fell 6.5% after the company reported fourth-quarter results that, despite beating analyst estimates, showed significant year-over-year declines in revenue and profitability. Revenue dropped by 19.4%, and gross margin contracted by 5.2 percentage points, leading to a substantial fall in gross and operating profit. This downturn overshadowed the earnings beat, causing investors to sell off the stock, although the company had previously shown strong performance and raised guidance in the prior quarter.

feed.title: Oilfield equipment maker raises $2.3M directly from investors
feed.summary: STAK Inc., a company specializing in oilfield equipment, announced the closing of a registered direct offering on January 8, 2026, raising approximately $2.3 million in gross proceeds. The offering involved issuing 6,000,000 units, each comprising one Class A ordinary share and 1.5 warrants, directly to investors without underwriters. The net proceeds of about $2.2 million are intended for research and development, working capital, and general corporate purposes.

feed.title: Is Surf Air Mobility’s (SRFM) SurfOS Spend With Palantir Redefining Its Competitive Software Edge?
feed.summary: Surf Air Mobility is investing US$26 million into its AI-enabled SurfOS operating system, leveraging a deeper partnership with Palantir to advance products like BrokerOS, OperatorOS, and OwnerOS. This strategic move aims to position SurfOS as a unifying software layer for the fragmented private aviation market, potentially creating a higher-margin revenue stream. While this strengthens the software's commercialization prospects, investors must also consider execution risks, ongoing losses, and reliance on external capital.

feed.title: Soluna and Siemens Collaborate to Solve GPU Power Swings in Behind-the-Meter AI
feed.summary: Soluna Holdings, Inc. and Siemens have signed an MOU to address the challenge of GPU-driven power demand swings when running AI and high-performance computing workloads directly on renewable energy. A 2 MW pilot project, Project Grace, will be deployed at Soluna’s Texas site to integrate Siemens’ electrical infrastructure, controls, and monitoring. This collaboration aims to create a repeatable blueprint for future behind-the-meter AI deployments at renewable generation sites, ensuring grid stability and energy efficiency.

feed.title: Is Halliburton Stock a Buy, Sell, or Hold for January 2026?
feed.summary: Halliburton Company (HAL) stock surged after the Venezuelan president's extradition, opening opportunities for U.S. oil companies in Venezuela's oil sector. Despite a modest revenue decline in Q3 2025, Halliburton exceeded analyst expectations, and while some analysts are cautious, many maintain a "Buy" rating, forecasting industry recovery and growth from new initiatives like data center power generation. Investors with a risk appetite might consider HAL stock a buy given the potential long-term gains despite the significant investment required for Venezuela's oil infrastructure.

feed.title: Mizuho raises Valero Energy stock price target to $197 on crude differentials
feed.summary: Mizuho has increased its price target for Valero Energy (NYSE:VLO) to $197 from $192, maintaining a Neutral rating on the stock, citing wider crude differentials as a primary driver. The firm anticipates Valero will surpass Q4 2025 consensus estimates for earnings per share and cash flow from operations, partly due to increased crude availability in the Gulf Coast benefiting complex refiners. Despite some analyst downgrades reflecting concerns about the refining outlook, UBS reiterated its Buy rating, highlighting strong performance and strategic positioning.

feed.title: FTI.PA TechnipFMC plc EURONEXT 09 Jan 2026: €5.91 on 33.48M trades, catalyst ahead
feed.summary: TechnipFMC plc (FTI.PA) is actively trading on EURONEXT at €5.91, following recent contract wins and analyst upgrades. The stock's valuation shows a PE of 24.43 and EPS of €0.24, with strong operating cash flow. Significant catalysts include a recent contract with BP for a Gulf of Mexico project and upcoming Q4 2025 earnings scheduled for February 19, 2026.

feed.title: Susquehanna raises ratings for American Airlines and Sun Country based on anticipated rebound in demand
feed.summary: Susquehanna analyst Christopher N. Stathoulopoulos has upgraded American Airlines (AAL) and Sun Country Airlines (SNCY) to Positive, citing an optimistic outlook for the airline sector and specific company drivers. The upgrades are based on an anticipated resurgence in passenger demand through 2027, driven by strategic capacity management, a shift toward premium services, and major upcoming events. Both airlines received increased price targets, with American Airlines focusing on premium service expansion and technology, and Sun Country benefiting from its hybrid model and strong free cash flow.

feed.title: The 6.2% return this week takes LATAM Airlines Group's (SNSE:LTM) shareholders three-year gains to 455%
feed.summary: LATAM Airlines Group (SNSE:LTM) has seen significant returns for its shareholders, with the share price increasing 412% over the last three years and the total shareholder return (TSR) reaching 455% due to dividend payments. The company became profitable within the last three years, which largely contributed to the strong stock performance. Although there was a long-term loss over the last five years, recent short-term gains suggest a potential brighter future.

feed.title: Serve Robotics Stock Nears Record Streak As CEO Teases 'A Lot Coming Up' This Year
feed.summary: Serve Robotics is approaching its longest winning streak since its 2024 debut, fueled by growing retail optimism and expectations of profitability driven by scalability. CEO Ali Kashani indicated that the company, spun off from Uber, expects "profitable positive unit economics" after deploying over 2,000 delivery robots and expanding to numerous U.S. cities. Kashani also hinted at significant future developments, with strong interest from partners like Nvidia and Uber.

feed.title: Richardson Electronics, Ltd. (NASDAQ:RELL) Q2 2026 Earnings Call Transcript
feed.summary: Richardson Electronics (NASDAQ:RELL) reported its Q2 2026 earnings, showcasing its sixth consecutive quarter of year-over-year growth with total sales of $52.3 million, driven by its Green Energy and Canvys businesses. The company emphasized its strategic shift towards higher growth markets and engineered solutions, alongside strong operational execution and financial discipline. Management expressed optimism for continued growth in PMT and GES segments, including expanding global reach for its Green Energy products and leveraging AI for efficiency improvements.

feed.title: Fluor Accomplishes on BASF’s Verbund Site Project in South China
feed.summary: Fluor Corporation has achieved mechanical completion of BASF's Zhanjiang Verbund project in China, marking BASF's largest investment to date. The project, delivered with an exceptional safety record of over 75 million work hours without a Lost Time Injury, involved Fluor providing engineering, procurement, and construction support for integrated operations. This significant milestone underscores Fluor's commitment to safe execution and strengthens its long-standing partnership with BASF, supporting BASF's strategic growth in the world's largest and fastest-growing chemical market.

feed.title: Tesla China Sales Rise 13.2% In December To Clock Best Month Ever
feed.summary: Tesla Inc. saw a significant increase in its China sales for December, reaching 93,843 vehicles, which represents a 13.2% year-over-year and 31.2% quarter-over-quarter growth, marking its best sales month ever in the region. This growth comes even as Tesla's overall Q4 deliveries fell short of analyst expectations and its rival BYD Co. Ltd. surpassed it as the world's largest EV maker. Despite BYD's global success, its domestic sales in China have declined, and Chinese automakers' exports have grown substantially.

feed.title: Risks Still Elevated At These Prices As LiveWire Group, Inc. (NYSE:LVWR) Shares Dive 29%
feed.summary: LiveWire Group, Inc. (NYSE:LVWR) shares have dropped 29% in the last month and are down 37% over the past year. Despite this fall, the company's price-to-sales (P/S) ratio of 25.4x remains significantly higher than the industry average, which the article suggests is not justified given its declining revenues. Investors are cautioned that the current valuation may not be sustainable as recent revenue trends are likely to negatively impact the share price.

feed.title: Mizuho raises Xcel Energy stock price target to $86 on strong growth outlook
feed.summary: Mizuho has increased its price target for Xcel Energy (NASDAQ:XEL) to $86 from $81, maintaining an Outperform rating due to a strong growth outlook, despite an ongoing lawsuit concerning the Smokehouse Creek Fire. The firm projects a 10.1% EPS CAGR through 2028 and considers the lawsuit "politically motivated," suggesting overstated liability. Xcel Energy also continues strategic financial initiatives, including rate increase requests and bond repurchase offers.

feed.title: Here's How Much You Would Have Made Owning Diamondback Energy Stock In The Last 5 Years
feed.summary: Diamondback Energy (NASDAQ: FANG) has significantly outperformed the market over the last five years, with an average annual return of 17.44%. An investment of $100 five years ago would now be worth $240.91. This demonstrates the impact of compounded returns on investment growth over time.

feed.title: Mizuho raises Xcel Energy stock price target to $86 on strong growth outlook By Investing.com
feed.summary: Mizuho has increased its price target for Xcel Energy (NASDAQ:XEL) to $86 from $81, maintaining an Outperform rating due to a strong growth outlook, despite potential challenges. The firm anticipates a 10.1% EPS CAGR through 2028 and dismisses a lawsuit against Xcel as politically motivated and lacking merit. Xcel's stable utility stock characteristics, including a low beta and consistent dividend payments, further support Mizuho's positive forecast.

feed.title: Cowen initiates Entergy stock with Buy rating on strong growth outlook
feed.summary: TD Cowen has initiated coverage on Entergy Corp (NYSE: ETR) with a Buy rating and a $108.00 price target, projecting 10.5% EPS growth through 2030, driven by industrial and data center load growth. The firm emphasized the importance of supportive state regulatory bodies for Entergy's continued growth. This outlook comes amidst recent corporate activities including a $1.3 billion debenture offering, approval for a significant transmission line, and changes to its board of directors.

feed.title: Otter Tail Corporation Increases Quarterly Dividend by 10 Percent
feed.summary: Otter Tail Corporation (Nasdaq: OTTR) has announced a 10 percent increase in its quarterly common stock dividend, raising it to $0.5775 per share, resulting in an annual rate of $2.31 per share. This marks the second consecutive year of a double-digit dividend increase, reflecting the company's strong financial position and commitment to shareholder value. The dividend is payable on March 10, 2026, to shareholders of record on February 13, 2026, continuing a tradition of 88 consecutive years of dividend payments.

feed.title: NextEra Energy Is Trading Above 200-Day SMA: How to Play the Stock?
feed.summary: NextEra Energy (NEE) is showing a bullish trend, trading above its 200-day Simple Moving Average, supported by consistent earnings beats and strategic investments in clean energy. The company benefits from a strong residential customer base, a robust project pipeline, and favorable economic conditions, with an attractive dividend growth plan and a Zacks Rank #2 (Buy) rating. Despite trading at a premium, its strong return on equity and anticipated interest rate cuts make it an appealing investment for long-term returns.

feed.title: Robeco Institutional Asset Management B.V. Purchases 169,186 Shares of Phillips 66 $PSX
feed.summary: Robeco Institutional Asset Management B.V. significantly increased its stake in Phillips 66 (NYSE:PSX) by 4,764.5% in Q3, now holding 172,737 shares valued at $23.5 million. This comes despite recent insider selling by executives. Analysts currently rate Phillips 66 with a "Moderate Buy" and a consensus price target of $146.88, following the company's Q3 earnings beat.

feed.title: One of America’s biggest planned gold mines eyes 316-mile gas line
feed.summary: NOVAGOLD (NG) and Donlin Gold LLC have signed a non-binding Letter of Intent with Glenfarne Alaska LNG to explore supplying natural gas and building a 316-mile pipeline to power the proposed Donlin Gold project. This agreement seeks to formalize a gas sales agreement for up to 50 million cubic feet per day, leveraging existing permits and ongoing environmental reviews. The move is expected to enhance the project's value, reduce operating costs, and represents a significant step towards developing one of the largest gold mines in the United States.

feed.title: Will Permian Resources' New Shelf Filings and Insider Sales Reshape PR's Ownership-Driven Investment Narrative?
feed.summary: Permian Resources Corporation recently filed new universal shelf registrations and completed a corporate reorganization, alongside insider stock sales. These actions are reshaping the company's capital structure and insider ownership profile. While these changes may offer more flexibility for future equity issuance, the core investment narrative remains linked to Permian drilling performance, commodity prices, and the company's ability to convert production into free cash flow.

feed.title: Murphy Oil Corporation Announces Pricing of $500 Million of 6.500% Senior Notes Due 2034
feed.summary: Murphy Oil Corporation has announced the pricing of $500 million of 6.500% Senior Notes due 2034. The company intends to use the net proceeds to redeem its existing 5.875% notes due 2027 and 6.375% notes due 2028, repay outstanding borrowings under its revolving credit facility, cover transaction fees, and for general corporate purposes. The offering is expected to close on January 23, 2026, with BofA Securities acting as the physical book-running manager.

feed.title: NextDecade plunges 55% after InvestingPro’s July 2025 overvalued warning By Investing.com
feed.summary: NextDecade Corporation's stock (NASDAQ:NEXT) plummeted 55% in six months after InvestingPro's Fair Value analysis in July 2025 flagged it as substantially overvalued at $11.54. The stock subsequently dropped to $5.20, confirming InvestingPro's prediction which indicated a fair price closer to $5.78. This decline was further supported by worsening financial health, a downgrade from Morgan Stanley, and the CFO's resignation.

feed.title: T. ROWE PRICE LAUNCHES SEASON 5 OF "THE ANGLE" PODCAST SERIES WITH EXPLORATION OF THE GLOBAL ENERGY SECTOR
feed.summary: T. Rowe Price has launched the fifth season of its podcast, "The Angle," which focuses on the global energy sector. Hosted by Jackie Fortner, the season features company experts discussing topics such as the persistent role of fossil fuels, the energy transition, energy's role in AI evolution, and the advancement of nuclear solutions. The podcast aims to provide investors, innovators, and policymakers with insights into the dynamic energy landscape and its implications for global markets.

feed.title: Edison International (EIX) target trimmed as Morgan Stanley flags ongoing wildfire exposure
feed.summary: Morgan Stanley has lowered its price target for Edison International (EIX) due to persistent concerns about the company's exposure to wildfire risks. Despite legislative efforts in California to address utility wildfire liabilities, the firm believes these measures have not fully mitigated the financial impact on EIX. The ongoing risk is highlighted as a significant factor affecting the company's valuation.

feed.title: Frontline announces fleet renewal deals involving purchase of nine new VLCCs — SMI DIGITAL
feed.summary: Frontline plc has announced a strategic fleet renewal by acquiring nine new Very Large Crude Carriers (VLCCs) and selling eight older vessels. The sale of the older vessels is expected to generate approximately $480 million in net cash proceeds. The acquisition of the new, scrubber-fitted ECO VLCCs, costing $1.22 billion, aligns with Frontline's strategy to operate a modern, fuel-efficient fleet and increase its exposure to the VLCC segment.

feed.title: The 11% return this week takes Oil States International's (NYSE:OIS) shareholders one-year gains to 45%
feed.summary: Oil States International (NYSE:OIS) has seen an 11% return this week, contributing to a 45% gain for shareholders over the last year, significantly outperforming the market's 17% return. Despite this strong short-term performance, the company's share price is still 4.6% lower than three years ago. The company recently moved from a loss to a profit, though earnings per share fell 11% over the past twelve months, suggesting that fundamental metrics don't fully explain the stock's recent surge.

feed.title: N.J. Department of the Treasury buys Beam Global ARC Systems to bolster workplace EV charging and energy security
feed.summary: The New Jersey Department of the Treasury has acquired numerous EV ARC off-grid electric vehicle charging systems from Beam Global through a public bid using Beam’s GSA contract. This purchase, which marks the third New Jersey state division to utilize these systems, aims to support workplace EV charging and enhance energy security for government operations. The EV ARC systems generate and store their own renewable electricity, offering rapid deployment without construction and maintaining functionality during utility outages.

feed.title: EQT stock drifts as U.S. natural gas prices slide again, with storage and weather in play
feed.summary: EQT shares barely moved after a previous day's decline, as U.S. natural gas futures fell due to mild weather forecasts reducing heating demand. Traders are closely monitoring upcoming weather models and storage numbers, as small price shifts significantly impact gas producers. The stock's performance is further pressured by high inventories, consistent supply, and the potential for oversupply from new LNG infrastructure.

feed.title: C.H. Robinson Faces Q4 Earnings Test Amid Red Sea Turbulence and the Rise of 'Lean AI' Logistics
feed.summary: C.H. Robinson (NASDAQ: CHRW) is set to release its Q4 2025 earnings, with focus on CEO Dave Bozeman's "New Operating Model" and its "Lean AI" strategy, aimed at decoupling headcount from volume growth. The company is transforming structurally amid geopolitical volatility in the Red Sea and a shift towards AI-driven logistics. This report will test if C.H. Robinson's internal efficiencies can withstand external pressures and position it as a leader in the evolving "Agentic Supply Chain" landscape, especially with an anticipated U.S. trucking capacity crunch.

feed.title: CHS posts 6% rise in first-quarter net income on stronger energy segment results
feed.summary: CHS Inc. reported a 6% year-on-year increase in net income for the first quarter of fiscal year 2026, reaching US$260.5 million, primarily driven by strong performance in its Energy segment. The Grains segment, however, experienced pressure due to global trade dynamics and weaker commodity margins, leading to a decline in pretax earnings. The company has revised its financial reporting structure for greater visibility across its supply chains and operating segments.

feed.title: Frontier Group names James G. Dempsey as President and CEO
feed.summary: Frontier Group Holdings, the parent company of Frontier Airlines, has appointed James G. Dempsey as its new President and Chief Executive Officer, effective January 8, 2026. Dempsey previously served as interim CEO and has been with Frontier for over a decade. The company also updated its fourth-quarter 2025 guidance, expecting adjusted diluted earnings per share to be at the higher end of its previously provided range.

feed.title: $3M from TVA to University of Tennessee could shape our nuclear future
feed.summary: The Tennessee Valley Authority (TVA) is providing a $3 million endowment to the University of Tennessee's nuclear engineering department. This investment aims to advance clean energy, recruit faculty, and strengthen East Tennessee's role in nuclear innovation, aligning with efforts to develop a skilled local workforce for the growing nuclear sector. The funding supports the region's burgeoning nuclear industry, which saw significant private investments in Oak Ridge in late 2025.

feed.title: Ballard Power Systems Hits Day High with 22.39% Surge in Stock Price
feed.summary: Ballard Power Systems Inc. (CAD 910 million market cap) experienced a significant intraday stock surge of 22.39% to CAD 5.01, far outperforming the S&P/TSX 60. This comes after impressive weekly and monthly gains of 28.46% and 87.07% respectively, and a 116.74% return over the past year. Despite this stock performance, the company has faced financial struggles, reporting negative results for three consecutive quarters, a 22.23% decline in net sales, and a 14.2% decrease in profits over the last year.

feed.title: Uber Technologies, Inc. $UBER Shares Acquired by Elk River Wealth Management LLC
feed.summary: Elk River Wealth Management LLC significantly increased its stake in Uber Technologies, Inc. ($UBER), boosting its holdings by 113.3% to 73,733 shares, valued at approximately $7.22 million. This move makes Uber roughly 1.2% of the firm's portfolio. The acquisition comes amidst positive catalysts like robotaxi momentum, renewed TomTom mapping deals, and bullish analyst ratings, although concerns regarding insider selling and a shareholder investigation into rider safety persist.

feed.title: Corteva and BP launch biofuel feedstock joint venture
feed.summary: Corteva Inc. and BP have formed a new 50:50 joint venture named Etlas, aimed at producing oil from crops like canola, mustard, and sunflower for biofuel production, specifically sustainable aviation fuel (SAF) and renewable diesel (RD). Etlas plans to produce 1 million tpy of feedstock by the mid-2030s, using intermediate crops on existing cropland to improve soil health and provide new revenue streams for farmers. This initiative seeks to meet the rapidly growing global demand for biofuels and support the decarbonization efforts in the aviation and transportation sectors.

feed.title: The AI Power Play: How NRG Energy Reclaimed the Texas Grid and Beyond
feed.summary: NRG Energy, Inc. has transformed into an integrated energy and technology platform, leveraging AI infrastructure and smart-home services. The company has showcased strong financial performance, outperforming the utility sector, and is undergoing a leadership transition while expanding its generation capacity. NRG's strategy integrates retail customers with reliable generation, notably in the Texas market, positioning it to meet growing AI and data center electricity demands.

feed.title: Enphase Energy (ENPH): Navigating the Solar Winter and the GaN Revolution
feed.summary: Enphase Energy (ENPH) is undergoing a significant transformation, navigating a "Solar Winter" marked by legislative shifts and a maturing residential solar market. The company is innovating with Gallium Nitride (GaN) technology, bidirectional EV charging, and a strategic focus on the commercial sector to adapt its business model. Despite a significant stock price decline, Enphase aims to leverage its updated IQ9 series, battery storage, and Virtual Power Plant capabilities to recover and thrive in the evolving energy transition.

feed.title: Enphase Energy (ENPH): Navigating the Solar Winter and the GaN Revolution
feed.summary: Enphase Energy (ENPH), a leading solar microinverter company, is undergoing a significant transformation in early 2026, often referred to as the "Solar Winter." The company is adapting to recent legislative changes, high interest rates, and the maturation of the residential solar market by focusing on Gallium Nitride (GaN) innovation, bidirectional EV charging, and expanding into the commercial sector. Despite a sharp decline in stock value from its 2022 peak, the company maintains a strong financial position and is leveraging new technologies and market shifts to navigate current challenges and position itself for future growth.

feed.title: Bhattacharya leaves offshore drilling company Schlumberger's investment unit
feed.summary: Arindam Bhattacharya has departed from his role as managing director of SLB Ventures, the corporate venture arm of oilfield services company Schlumberger (doing business as SLB). Bhattacharya served SLB for over 30 years in various capacities before leading SLB Ventures, which focuses on investments in industrial decarbonisation, renewables, and energy efficiency technologies. His next career steps were not disclosed.

feed.title: PG&E could be allowed to recover over $1 billion total expenses under proposal
feed.summary: A proposed decision could allow PG&E to recover over $1.4 billion from ratepayers for various 2022 expenses, including wildfire mitigation and storm response. While this is less than the company requested, it is not expected to significantly impact customer bills. The proposal also criticizes PG&E for continuing a tree-trimming program deemed not cost-effective, with a partial settlement supported by state regulators and consumer groups.

feed.title: TEN Ltd. Featured in TIME Magazine Europe
feed.summary: TEN Ltd., a diversified crude, product, and LNG tanker operator, was recently featured in TIME Magazine Europe. The article highlighted TEN's fleet, focus on operational discipline, newbuilding program, and modernization efforts aimed at improving efficiency and environmental performance. It also recognized the company's emphasis on seamanship, maritime training, and crew development.

feed.title: The American Solar Fortress: A Deep-Dive Analysis of First Solar (FSLR)
feed.summary: First Solar (FSLR) has established itself as a leading American solar manufacturer, leveraging unique thin-film technology and strategic manufacturing expansions to maintain a strong market position despite industry headwinds. The company benefits from the re-industrialization of the U.S. and the electricity demands of AI data centers, boasting a robust financial performance, a fortress balance sheet, and a strong backlog. Its "Made in America" approach and immunity to the polysilicon cycle, coupled with ongoing innovations like the Series 7 module and perovskite tandem cells, solidify its competitive advantage in a complex geopolitical landscape, though policy volatility and supply chain risks remain.

feed.title: Clean Electricity Acquisitions
feed.summary: Constellation has acquired Calpine Corporation from Energy Capital Partners, forming the largest electricity producer in the United States by installed capacity. This transaction combines Constellation’s nuclear fleet with Calpine’s natural gas and geothermal assets, aiming to provide reliable, lower-carbon power and broaden customer offerings. The combined entity boasts approximately 55 GW of generating capacity, with an eye towards enhanced grid reliability, expanded customer solutions, and operational scale.

feed.title: What to Expect From C.H. Robinson's Next Quarterly Earnings Report
feed.summary: C.H. Robinson (CHRW) is expected to announce its fiscal Q4 2025 earnings after market close on Jan. 28, with analysts projecting an adjusted EPS of $1.13, a 6.6% decrease year-over-year. Despite a weaker-than-expected Q3 2025 revenue, the company's shares surged due to better-than-anticipated adjusted EPS driven by strong cost control and operational streamlining. The stock has outperformed major indices over the past 52 weeks, and analysts maintain a "Moderate Buy" rating.

feed.title: Chevron, Vitol and Trafigura in Talks to Export Venezuelan Crude
feed.summary: Oil major Chevron Corp, along with global trading houses Vitol and Trafigura, are competing for U.S. government deals to export crude oil from Venezuela. This competition arises as U.S. officials seek to control Venezuelan oil sales indefinitely following the capture of President Nicolas Maduro. These companies are vying for initial agreements to market up to 50 million barrels of oil accumulated by PDVSA, with Chevron potentially expanding its license to operate in Venezuela.

feed.title: Why Constellation Energy Rallied Nearly 60% in 2025
feed.summary: Constellation Energy's shares rallied nearly 60% in 2025 due to its position as a key player in the AI buildout and increasing electricity demand. The company announced a major acquisition of Calpine, adding significant natural gas and geothermal capacity to its nuclear fleet. Additionally, Constellation secured new power purchase agreements with AI hyperscalers and benefited from a more favorable regulatory environment.

feed.title: Goldman Sachs Warns US Grids Face Power Crunch by 2030
feed.summary: Goldman Sachs warns that almost all US power grids will lack critical spare capacity by 2030 due to surging demand from data centers, threatening to give China an advantage in the AI boom. Experts highlight the need for increased infrastructure investment, reduced red tape, and modernized market rules to address this looming power crunch. Rising utility bills, partly driven by data centers, are also becoming a significant political and economic challenge.

feed.title: retail investors who own 54% along with institutions invested in Nordic American Tankers Limited (NYSE:NAT) saw increase in their holdings value last week
feed.summary: Retail investors, holding 54% ownership in Nordic American Tankers Limited (NYSE:NAT), saw their holdings increase in value last week, with institutions also benefiting. The article highlights that retail investors have significant influence on the company's management and governance decisions. Institutional ownership accounts for 42% of the company, with BlackRock, Inc. being the largest single shareholder at 5.7%.

feed.title: John Deere fires up automation at CES
feed.summary: John Deere showcased its advanced automation technology at CES 2026, integrating AI and machine learning into its self-driving X9-1100 farm combine and Vogele road paver. This initiative addresses the scarcity of skilled labor and automates complex, tedious tasks in agriculture and construction. The equipment uses 4G and Starlink for connectivity, enabling real-time data sharing, remote diagnostics, and coordinated operations like in-air refueling for combines.

feed.title: The Boeing Company $BA Stock Position Raised by Cerity Partners LLC
feed.summary: Cerity Partners LLC increased its stake in The Boeing Company (NYSE:BA) by 12.3% in Q3, now holding 147,578 shares valued at approximately $31.85 million. Other institutional investors also raised their positions, pushing institutional ownership to 64.82%. Despite a significant Q3 EPS miss, analysts maintain a "Moderate Buy" rating with a target price of $235.33, citing recent large aircraft orders and upcoming Q4 earnings as potential catalysts for the stock.

feed.title: Commonwealth Equity Services LLC Sells 6,201 Shares of Cummins Inc. $CMI
feed.summary: Commonwealth Equity Services LLC reduced its holdings in Cummins Inc. by 9.9% in the third quarter, selling 6,201 shares and retaining 56,481 shares valued at $23.86 million. This happens as other institutional investors either increased or slightly decreased their stakes. Cummins recently reported strong quarterly earnings, beating analyst estimates, and announced a quarterly dividend of $2.00 per share.

feed.title: Corteva and BP launch biofuel feedstock joint venture
feed.summary: Corteva Inc. and BP have launched Etlas, a 50:50 joint venture, to produce oil from crops like canola, mustard, and sunflower for biofuel production such as sustainable aviation fuel (SAF) and renewable diesel (RD). Etlas aims to produce 1 million tons of feedstock annually by the mid-2030s, using crops grown on existing cropland between main food cropping seasons. This initiative leverages Corteva's seed technology expertise and BP's refining knowledge to meet the growing demand for biofuels while offering new revenue streams for farmers.

feed.title: Diana Shipping Inc. announces direct continuation of time charter contract for m/v Maia with Paralos Shipping
feed.summary: Diana Shipping Inc. has announced a direct continuation of a time charter contract for its Kamsarmax dry bulk vessel, m/v Maia, with Paralos Shipping Pte. Ltd. The new charter rate is US$14,000 per day, a significant increase from the previous US$11,600, and is expected to generate approximately US$7.45 million in gross revenue. The charter period is set until at least July 5, 2027, with the new period commencing on January 13, 2026.

feed.title: Frontline plc Launches Fleet Renewal Drive: Selling 8 VLCCs and Acquiring 9 Newbuilds
feed.summary: Frontline plc is undertaking a strategic fleet renewal by selling eight older ECO VLCCs for $831.5 million and acquiring nine new-generation ECO VLCC newbuildings with scrubbers for $1,224.0 million. This move aims to modernize its fleet, enhance fuel efficiency, and reduce carbon emissions, aligning with its strategy to operate a cost- and fuel-efficient fleet. Following these transactions, Frontline's fleet will comprise 81 vessels, including 42 VLCCs, 21 Suezmax, and 18 LR2/Aframax tankers.

feed.title: Cool Company investors to get $9.65 per share as stock set to leave NYSE
feed.summary: Cool Company Ltd. (CLCO) announced the completion of its cash merger with a wholly-owned subsidiary of EPS Ventures Ltd., making CoolCo entirely owned by EPS. Shareholders eligible for the merger consideration will receive $9.65 per common share. The company expects to be delisted from the New York Stock Exchange and Euronext Growth Oslo, and will file Form 15-F to terminate its SEC reporting obligations.

feed.title: GM hit with US$6 billion in charges as EV incentives cut and emissions standards fade
feed.summary: General Motors is facing approximately US$6 billion in charges due to a slowdown in electric vehicle sales, largely attributed to reduced U.S. tax incentives and eased emissions standards. These new charges, following a previous Q3 charge of $1.6 billion, force the automaker to re-evaluate its ambitious EV transition plans. The shift in policy and market conditions highlights the challenges for U.S. automakers in achieving their electric vehicle goals amidst a changing regulatory landscape and increasing global competition from companies like China's BYD.

feed.title: Themes US Infrastructure ETF (NASDAQ:HWAY) Stock Price Up 1.2% – Should You Buy?
feed.summary: Shares of Themes US Infrastructure ETF (NASDAQ:HWAY) rose 1.2% on Thursday, trading at $32.08 after reaching a high of $32.10. Trading volume was significantly lower than average. feed.title: [News] Innoviz Technologies Partners with Vueron to Accelerate AI Development for Automotive and Smart Infrastructure Applications
feed.summary: Innoviz Technologies has announced a partnership with Vueron Technology to accelerate AI development for automotive and smart infrastructure applications. This collaboration integrates Innoviz's LiDAR data from InnovizTwo and InnovizSMART into Vueron's VueX AI development platform, streamlining data annotation, training, and validation for perception systems. The joint solution will be demonstrated live at CES 2026.

feed.title: This new 22-foot surf boat packs 3,800 lbs of ballast for bigger waves

The X22 features 3,800 pounds of ballast combined with the SurfStar system for creating large, clean, and customizable waves. It comes standard with an Ilmor 6.2L GDI engine, with an optional supercharged version delivering 630 horsepower, alongside advanced helm controls and luxurious design elements.

feed.summary: FirstEnergy Transmission, LLC (FET) has announced an extension of its exchange offer for up to $450 million in 4.750% Senior Notes due 2033. The new deadline for the offer is January 21, 2026, extending it from the previously set January 7, 2026. As of the original expiration date, 99.88% of the outstanding notes had already been tendered.

feed.title: Manu Asthana Appointed to Alliant Energy Board of Directors
feed.summary: Alliant Energy Corp. (NASDAQ: LNT) has announced the appointment of Manu Asthana as a new independent director to its Board, effective February 23, 2026. Asthana brings nearly three decades of leadership experience in the energy and financial services sectors, including his most recent role as President and CEO of PJM Interconnection. His expertise in grid operations, power generation, and risk management is expected to enhance the Board's ability to guide the company's long-term strategy and support its customers and communities.

feed.title: South Africa: ASP Isotopes Closes Renergen Acquisition
feed.summary: ASP Isotopes has completed its acquisition of South Africa-based energy producer Renergen, integrating hydrogen-linked natural gas assets and a helium-rich gas field into its critical materials portfolio. This strategic move aims to scale production of helium and isotopes crucial for clean energy, semiconductors, and quantum technologies, utilizing Renergen's Virginia Gas Project. The acquisition positions ASP Isotopes as a global supplier of liquid helium, addressing supply constraints and combining isotope enrichment with upstream gas operations for cross-sector applications.

feed.title: Comstock Metals Completes All Permits for First of Its Kind Recycling Facility

The company aims to address the significant challenge of end-of-life solar panels by providing a scalable, zero-landfill recycling solution, especially for the southwestern U.S. market.
