feed.title: Black Hills Corp. Completes Ready Wyoming 260-mile Electric Transmission Expansion Project
feed.summary: Black Hills Corp. announced the completion of its 260-mile, $350 million Ready Wyoming electric transmission expansion project, which was energized in December 2025. This project interconnects the company's electric systems in South Dakota and Wyoming, aiming to provide long-term cost stability for customers, enhance system resiliency, and support economic growth. Approximately $300 million of the investment will be recovered through the Wyoming Transmission Rider.

feed.title: How Gevo’s (GEVO) COO Succession Plan Could Reshape Its Operations-Led Investment Story
feed.summary: Gevo, Inc. announced a leadership transition with COO Dr. Christopher M. Ryan retiring in June 2026, and Greg Hanselman expected to take over, bringing extensive plant-based ingredient and manufacturing experience. This change signals a focus on operational execution, which is critical for Gevo's growth and project build-out plans, especially amidst high capital expenditure needs, policy risks around tax credits, and ongoing losses. While the transition is operational, effective execution of projects and managing financial pressures will be key to the company's investment narrative and its ability to scale its alcohol-to-jet and carbon businesses.

feed.title: California Resources Corporation & Los Angeles Rams score in carbon management initiative
feed.summary: California Resources Corporation (CRC) and the Los Angeles Rams celebrated the first year of their "Football Without the Footprint" partnership, an initiative aimed at reducing and offsetting the team's carbon emissions. CRC analyzed the Rams' energy use and travel to provide independently certified environmental products and carbon credits to offset their footprint, making the Rams the first NFL team in California to purchase locally sourced credits. Key accomplishments include reducing emissions from team travel, ensuring sustainable home operations with low-carbon natural gas, and providing high-integrity carbon offsets and supporting local ecosystems.

feed.title: GATX Corp. and Brookfield Infrastructure buy Wells Fargo’s rail assets for $4.2b
feed.summary: GATX Corp. and Brookfield Infrastructure Partners, along with its institutional partners, have acquired Wells Fargo's rail operating lease portfolio for $4.2 billion. This acquisition includes 101,000 railcars for GATX, while Brookfield Infrastructure separately acquired Wells Fargo’s rail finance lease portfolio, consisting of 22,000 railcars and 400 locomotives. GATX president and CEO Robert Lyons stated that the deal expands GATX's North American platform and diversifies its fleet, positioning the company for continued growth.

feed.title: Can Enterprise Products Secure Its Future Distribution Payments?
feed.summary: Enterprise Products Partners (EPD) is a leading midstream company with a resilient business model, boasting a vast pipeline network and generating stable fee-based revenues. The company has consistently returned capital to unitholders, increasing distributions for over two decades, and has a significant backlog of capital projects to secure future payments. Other midstream companies like Kinder Morgan (KMI) and Enbridge (ENB) also focus on returning shareholder capital and have strong fundamentals.

feed.title: A Look At WEC Energy Group (WEC) Valuation As Earnings Slow And Illinois Rate Cases Draw Focus
feed.summary: WEC Energy Group (WEC) is approaching its Q4 earnings report with expectations of a 4.2% decline in earnings per share, paired with regulatory focus due to new Illinois rate case filings. Despite a recent dip in share price momentum, the company is considered 13.1% undervalued by Simply Wall St, with a fair value of $121.09, driven by significant capital investments in infrastructure and renewables. Investors are encouraged to consider if the current market price reflects a buying opportunity or if future growth is already priced in, especially given its higher P/E ratio compared to peers.

feed.title: Chart Industries, Inc. Receives Additional Limited Notice to Proceed for Cheniere's Corpus Christi Stage Three LNG Export Terminal Project
feed.summary: Chart Industries, Inc. (NYSE: GTLS) has received an additional limited notice to proceed (LNTP) for its IPMSR® process and equipment for Cheniere's Corpus Christi Stage Three LNG export terminal. This LNTP resulted in a $47.5 million order from Bechtel, with revenue recognition scheduled to begin in 2022 and deliveries staggered over multiple years. Chart Industries is a global manufacturer of highly engineered equipment for the Energy and Industrial Gas markets, focusing on clean energy technologies like LNG, hydrogen, biogas, and CO2 Capture.

feed.title: Do Allegiant Travel’s (ALGT) Analyst Re-Ratings Hint at a Deeper Shift in Its Competitive Moat?
feed.summary: Recent analyst re-ratings for Allegiant Travel (ALGT) have shifted towards a more neutral stance, indicating a reassessment of its market positioning and capacity discipline despite ongoing concerns about leverage and liquidity. While analysts are becoming more constructive, the core investment narrative still hinges on Allegiant's ability to translate constrained capacity into improved unit revenues. The article emphasizes that private investor fair value estimates can differ significantly from analyst views, highlighting the tension between potential earnings catalysts and financial pressures.

feed.title: Otis to modernize 172 escalators across London Underground network
feed.summary: Otis (NYSE:OTIS) has secured a contract with Transport for London (TfL) to modernize and service 172 escalators across the London Underground network, starting in April 2026. This contract will expand Otis's service portfolio to over 300 units on the London Underground, enhancing reliability, safety, and energy efficiency for the escalators that support approximately 1.2 billion passenger journeys annually. The company has a long history with London's transportation system, having installed the first passenger escalators in 1911.

feed.title: A Look At WEC Energy Group (WEC) Valuation As Earnings Slow And Illinois Rate Cases Draw Focus
feed.summary: WEC Energy Group is approaching its Q4 earnings report with an expected 4.2% decline in earnings per share, paired with regulatory scrutiny from new Illinois rate case filings. Despite a recent share price dip, the company is considered 13.1% undervalued by Simply Wall St, trading below analyst targets and estimated intrinsic value, suggesting a potential buying opportunity amidst its significant capital expenditure plan for infrastructure modernization and renewable energy investments. However, its P/E ratio is currently higher than industry averages, indicating less room for error.

feed.title: 5E Advanced Materials Successfully Completes LCD Glass Trial for Major U.S. LCD Glass Manufacturer
feed.summary: 5E Advanced Materials, Inc. (Nasdaq:FEAM)(ASX:5EA) announced the successful completion of a 20-ton commercial tank trial for its boric acid with a major U.S.-headquartered LCD glass manufacturer. The product met all qualification parameters, marking a significant step towards a potential initial offtake agreement and advancing the Company’s commercialization strategy. This achievement highlights 5E's capability to produce on-spec boric acid in commercial quantities for the demanding LCD glass industry.

feed.title: Grupo Aeroportuario del Centro Norte (OMAB) posts 6.9% December traffic rise
feed.summary: Grupo Aeroportuario del Centro Norte (OMA) reported a 6.9% increase in terminal passenger traffic across its 13 airports in December 2025 compared to December 2024. Both domestic and international traffic showed balanced growth, increasing by 6.9% and 6.5% respectively. The company also noted the start of operations for ten new routes during the month, contributing to the overall traffic rise.

feed.title: How (DUG) Movements Inform Risk Allocation Models
feed.summary: This article analyzes Proshares Ultrashort Energy (NYSE: DUG), identifying weak sentiment across all horizons and supporting a short bias. It details three trading strategies—Position, Momentum Breakout, and Risk Hedging—along with multi-timeframe signal analysis indicating weak signals across near-term, mid-term, and long-term horizons, while emphasizing a 33.3:1 risk-reward setup.

feed.title: National Grid Unveils New Plan for Anglo-Dutch Cable Link
feed.summary: National Grid has announced a new plan for its LionLink interconnector to the Netherlands, proposing route changes to start the cable underground in Walberswick, Suffolk. This decision follows an assessment of environmental impacts and local residents' concerns, with 84% of the UK section of the cable being offshore and all onshore parts buried. The LionLink project, a joint effort with TenneT BV, aims to carry two gigawatts of wind electricity and is expected to start operation in 2032.

feed.title: CoolCo Completes Merger with EPS Ventures, Shareholders to Receive $9.65 per Share
feed.summary: CoolCo has finalized its merger with EPS Ventures, becoming a wholly-owned subsidiary of EPS. Shareholders eligible for consideration will receive $9.65 per share on January 14, 2026. Following the merger, CoolCo plans to delist from the New York Stock Exchange and Euronext Growth Oslo, aiming for strategic privatization and flexible future operations.

feed.title: (DIG) Movement as an Input in Quant Signal Sets
feed.summary: This article provides a quantitative analysis of Proshares Ultra Energy (NYSE: DIG), detailing expert findings and several AI-generated trading strategies. It highlights strong near- and mid-term sentiment, tests of resistance, and offers specific entry zones, targets, and stop losses for position, momentum breakout, and risk hedging strategies. The analysis also includes multi-timeframe signal strengths, support, and resistance levels for DIG.

feed.title: Dawson Geophysical Company's (NASDAQ:DWSN) Shares Not Telling The Full Story
feed.summary: Dawson Geophysical Company's shares currently trade at a P/S ratio of 0.8x, lower than the industry median of 1.1x in the Energy Services sector, despite the company's strong three-year revenue growth of 43%. Although recent annual revenue declined by 22%, the medium-term growth outpaces the projected industry growth of 2.6%. The article suggests that the current P/S ratio might indicate investor reservations about future revenue fluctuations or unobserved threats despite the company's past performance.

feed.title: Winners And Losers Of Q3: Enphase (NASDAQ:ENPH) Vs The Rest Of The Renewable Energy Stocks
feed.summary: This article analyzes the Q3 performance of Enphase (NASDAQ:ENPH) and other renewable energy stocks, highlighting that despite a satisfactory quarter for the sector as a whole, share prices have generally declined. Enphase reported strong revenues exceeding expectations but its stock still fell. Bloom Energy (NYSE:BE) was the best performer with significant revenue growth, while Generac (NYSE:GNRC) had the weakest Q3 performance, missing revenue expectations and seeing a notable stock drop.

feed.title: Deutsche Bank Trims Price Target on Sunrun (RUN)
feed.summary: Deutsche Bank has lowered its price target on Sunrun (RUN) from $20 to $19, while maintaining a 'Hold' rating. This adjustment follows a recent share price fall for Sunrun, even as the company announced a significant joint venture with HA Sustainable Infrastructure to finance distributed energy assets, involving a $500 million investment over 18 months. Sunrun's CFO highlighted the innovative financing structure, which is expected to provide efficient capital for growth, despite the company being among the best-performing energy stocks in the previous year.

feed.title: DAL $71.82, Delta Air Lines, Inc. (NYSE), 08 Jan 2026: Watch Jan 13 EPS gap
feed.summary: Delta Air Lines (DAL) stock is trading at $71.82 ahead of its Q4 2025 earnings report on January 13, 2026, with consensus EPS at $1.52 and revenue at $15.96 billion. Meyka AI rates DAL with a "BUY" suggestion and projects a 12-month price target of $72.38, indicating a modest upside. The report highlights potential risks and opportunities, including leverage and liquidity concerns, alongside the positive analyst sentiment and strong profitability despite valuation below growth peers.

feed.title: ConocoPhillips CEO to attend White House meeting with Trump on Venezuela oil
feed.summary: ConocoPhillips CEO Ryan Lance is scheduled to attend a White House meeting with former President Trump to discuss Venezuelan oil. The US company stated it continues to monitor developments in Venezuela. The meeting takes place amidst ongoing US-Venezuela political and energy discussions.

feed.title: EOG Resources (EOG) Price Target Cut by $18
feed.summary: Bernstein analyst Bob Brackett has cut the price target for EOG Resources (EOG) from $144 to $126, while maintaining a 'Market Perform' rating. The reduction comes as 2026 is expected to be a "transitional year" for shale operators, with plateauing and declining shale production, pushing producers to seek inventory through acquisitions or exploration. The company and crude oil prices are also facing pressure from oversupply and increased production from Venezuela, according to EOG's finance chief.

feed.title: Trading Systems Reacting to (DBO) Volatility
feed.summary: This article analyzes the Invesco Db Oil Fund (DBO) and highlights a neutral sentiment across all time horizons, suggesting sideways action. It outlines three AI-generated trading strategies—Position Trading, Momentum Breakout, and Risk Hedging—tailored for different risk profiles, along with key support and resistance levels. The piece emphasizes the exceptional 22.5:1 risk-reward setup targeting a 7.3% gain against a 0.3% risk.

feed.title: Understanding Momentum Shifts in (DBE)
feed.summary: This article analyzes Invesco Db Energy Fund (DBE), noting a neutral sentiment across all time horizons and suggesting a wait-and-see approach due to a mid-channel oscillation pattern. It highlights an exceptional risk-reward short setup and provides specific entry, target, and stop-loss levels for position, momentum breakout, and risk-hedging trading strategies generated by AI models.

feed.title: Delta Vs United: Which Airline Stock is the Better Investment for 2026?
feed.summary: This article analyzes Delta Air Lines (DAL) and United Airlines (UAL) as investment options for 2026, comparing their profitability, liquidity, and outlook. Both airlines have shown strong performance due to increasing air travel demand, with United having an edge in free cash flow conversion and a slightly lower P/E valuation. While both are considered 'Hold' by Zacks, United is noted for stronger price performance, whereas Delta offers a more accessible entry point for investors.

feed.title: Constellation Energy Corporation stock slides after Calpine deal closes — here’s what investors watch next
feed.summary: Constellation Energy Corp (CEG) shares dropped 4.8% after closing its acquisition of Calpine, making it the largest electricity producer in the U.S. with 55 gigawatts of generation capacity. Investors are now focused on the upcoming Calpine-note exchange offer deadline on January 12 and the U.S. jobs report due Friday, which could affect utility and power stocks. The deal, valued at $26.6 billion with debt, aims to meet rising electricity demand and shift towards lower-carbon power, though an increased footprint brings integration and market risks.

feed.title: Fluor Achieves Mechanical Completion on BASF’s New Verbund Site Project in South China
feed.summary: Fluor Corporation has announced the mechanical completion of BASF’s Zhanjiang Verbund project in China, marking BASF's largest investment to date. The project was completed with an exceptional safety record of over 75 million work hours without a Lost Time Injury. Fluor provided extensive engineering, procurement, and construction support for the integrated operations, which will become BASF’s third largest Verbund site globally and supply the fast-growing Chinese chemical market.

feed.title: How Gevo’s (GEVO) COO Succession Plan Could Reshape Its Operations-Led Investment Story
feed.summary: Gevo, Inc. announced a significant leadership transition with long-time COO Dr. Christopher M. Ryan retiring in June 2026, and agribusiness executive Greg Hanselman stepping into the COO role. This change is seen as operational, bringing expertise in plant-based ingredients and manufacturing, which could impact how Gevo executes its growth plans and project buildouts, particularly given its reliance on high capital expenditure and government tax credits like 45Z. The article emphasizes that while execution might improve, Gevo's investment narrative heavily depends on scaling its alcohol-to-jet and carbon businesses amidst policy risks and ongoing losses.

feed.title: Why Is SLB Stock Back In Focus?
feed.summary: SLB (Schlumberger) stock is gaining investor attention not due to surging oil prices, but because global geopolitical factors are influencing upstream oil expectations, particularly regarding Venezuela and longer-cycle international spending. The company's strong global exposure, improving profitability, and consistent free cash flow make it an attractive investment for those seeking stability in energy infrastructure rather than direct commodity price speculation. Investors are focusing on SLB's role in potential oil production restoration in regions like Venezuela, where its expertise and scale offer a competitive advantage.

feed.title: FirstEnergy Transmission, LLC Announces Extension of Exchange Offer for its 4.750% Senior Notes Due 2033
feed.summary: FirstEnergy Transmission, LLC (FET) has announced an extension of its exchange offer for up to $450 million of its 4.750% Senior Notes due 2033. The offer, which allows holders to exchange outstanding notes for newly registered ones, was previously set to expire on January 7, 2026, and is now extended until January 21, 2026. As of January 7, 2026, approximately 99.88% of the outstanding notes had been tendered.

feed.title: APA Corp (APA) Jumps 8.5% on LNG Demand Growth, Colder Season
feed.summary: APA Corporation (NASDAQ:APA) saw its share price jump by 8.47% due to a bullish outlook for the liquefied natural gas (LNG) industry and rapidly growing demand for power. Zacks Research identified APA Corp, Coterra Energy, Antero Resources, and W&T Offshore as leading companies in the energy sector, citing high demand for natural gas driven by increased electricity needs. The report highlights APA Corporation's diverse asset base in the US, Egypt, and the North Sea, along with exploration in Suriname, as key growth drivers.

feed.title: Palmetto Grain Brokerage -
feed.summary: Norfolk Southern Corporation (NSC) is expected to announce its fiscal fourth-quarter earnings for 2025 on January 29, with analysts projecting a diluted EPS of $2.89. Despite underperforming some sector indices, NSC stock has outperformed the S&P 500 over the past year due to safety and efficiency improvements. Analysts give NSC a "Moderate Buy" rating with a potential upside of 9.1%.

feed.title: Diana deepens ties with Paralos Shipping through new kamsarmax fixture
feed.summary: Greece-based Diana Shipping has secured a direct continuation of a time charter contract with Paralos Shipping for the kamsarmax dry bulk vessel Maia. The new charter, set to begin January 13, 2026, will generate approximately $7.45 million in gross revenue, at a higher daily rate of $14,000 compared to the current $11,600. Diana Shipping's fleet currently comprises 36 dry bulk vessels, with two methanol dual-fuel new-building kamsarmax vessels expected by 2028.

feed.title: U-Haul Holding Co.: How a 79-Year-Old Brand Is Reinventing Itself as a Logistics Platform
feed.summary: U-Haul Holding Co. is transforming from a traditional truck rental company into a vertically integrated logistics platform, combining truck rentals, self-storage, packing supplies, labor marketplaces, and digital tools. This strategy aims to offer a comprehensive end-to-end moving experience, differentiating it from competitors who specialize in single services. The company's extensive physical footprint, asset-backed model, and focus on affordability provide a strong competitive edge, impacting its valuation beyond that of a mere rental business.

feed.title: Horizon Kinetics buys Texas Pacific Land (TPL) share at $296
feed.summary: Horizon Kinetics Asset Management LLC recently purchased a share of Texas Pacific Land Corp (TPL) for $296.79, while director Murray Stahl acquired additional shares as part of his annual retainer. These transactions follow the company's third-quarter earnings miss, a new strategic partnership with Bolt Data & Energy, and a three-for-one stock split announcement. KeyBanc initiated coverage with an Overweight rating and a $1,050 price target.

feed.title: Horizon Kinetics buys Texas Pacific Land (TPL) share at $296 By Investing.com
feed.summary: Horizon Kinetics Asset Management LLC purchased one share of Texas Pacific Land Corp (TPL) at $296.79, while director Murray Stahl acquired 554 shares as part of his annual retainer. These transactions increase Horizon Kinetics' ownership to over 3.4 million shares and Murray Stahl's to over 25,000 shares. Meanwhile, TPL recently reported Q3 2025 earnings below expectations, announced a strategic partnership with Bolt Data & Energy, and is implementing a three-for-one stock split.

feed.title: tgs designa un Director de Grandes Proyectos y encara una nueva etapa de expansión en Vaca Muerta
feed.summary: Transportadora de Gas del Sur (tgs) has appointed Jorge Vugdelija as its Director of Large Projects to lead strategic initiatives and expansion in Vaca Muerta. Vugdelija, an electronic engineer with extensive experience in the energy sector, will oversee projects like the Gasoducto Perito Moreno expansion and the NGL's Project, which aim to industrialize and export natural gas liquids from Vaca Muerta. This move solidifies tgs's role in Argentina's energy development, focusing on critical infrastructure and adding value to local production.
feed.source: El Economista: Últimas noticias económicas y financieras

feed.title: Quanta Services (PWR) Stock Sinks As Market Gains: What You Should Know
feed.summary: Quanta Services (PWR) stock fell 5.43% to $413.17, underperforming the broader market gains. Despite this, analysts anticipate a 2.04% increase in EPS for the upcoming earnings report and 11.57% revenue growth. The company holds a Zacks Rank of #3 (Hold) and is valued at a Forward P/E of 35.29, which is higher than its industry average.

feed.title: NOVAGOLD Provides Update on Donlin Gold Infrastructure and Energy Supply With Initial Glenfarne Letter of Intent
feed.summary: NOVAGOLD announced that Donlin Gold, co-owned by NOVAGOLD and Paulson, signed a non-binding Letter of Intent with Glenfarne Alaska LNG for natural gas supply and infrastructure development for the Donlin Gold project. This agreement aims to secure a reliable, lower-carbon energy source for the proposed mine, potentially reducing fuel costs and enhancing project economics. Donlin Gold is also progressing with its Bankable Feasibility Study, with a prime contractor expected to be selected in the first quarter of 2026.

feed.title: GREENBRIER COMPANIES INC SEC 10-Q Report
feed.summary: Greenbrier Companies Inc. (GBX) has released its Form 10-Q report for the third quarter of 2025, detailing a 19.4% decrease in total revenue to $706.1 million and a 34.2% decrease in net earnings attributable to Greenbrier, resulting in diluted EPS of $1.14. The decline is primarily attributed to a decrease in railcar deliveries and an unfavorable shift in product mix. Despite challenges, the company is focused on strategic initiatives to increase recurring revenue, expand gross margin, and improve return on invested capital, while actively managing financial operations across its global presence.

feed.title: Understanding Momentum Shifts in (BP)
feed.summary: This article analyzes BP's stock, highlighting weak near-term sentiment despite potential long-term strength. It identifies a mid-channel oscillation pattern and offers specific AI-generated trading strategies—long, breakout, and short—with detailed entry, target, and stop-loss levels. The analysis also includes multi-timeframe signal strengths and support/resistance levels for different holding periods.

feed.title: Honeywell (HON) Target Trimmed as Mizuho Warns of Uneven Industry Backdrop
feed.summary: Mizuho analyst Brett Linzey decreased the price target for Honeywell International Inc. (HON) to $240 from $250, while maintaining an Outperform rating, due to an anticipated "uneven terrain ahead" for the electrical equipment and multi-industry sector. Despite this, Honeywell announced a partnership with Technip Energies to provide modular LNG pretreatment and liquefaction solutions for Commonwealth LNG, which aims to produce about 9.5 million tonnes of LNG per year. The company believes its modular technology will accelerate timelines, simplify execution, and improve production efficiency in the growing energy demand landscape.

feed.title: SLB stock up in premarket as White House Venezuela meeting keeps oil-services trade in play
feed.summary: SLB (Schlumberger) premarket shares rose by 1% following news of a White House meeting with oil companies regarding Venezuela, sparking interest in the oilfield services sector. The potential for Venezuela to re-enter global oil markets could boost service firms, although political and cost uncertainties remain. Analysts are closely watching SLB's upcoming Q4 and full-year results on January 23rd for further company specific catalysts.

feed.title: Here's What $100 Invested in United Airlines Holdings Five Years Ago Would Amount to Now
feed.summary: This article details the five-year investment performance of United Airlines Holdings (UAL). An initial investment of $100 five years ago would have grown to $270.42, reflecting an impressive annualized return of 21.24%. The company's current market value stands at $37.39 billion.

feed.title: Devon Energy Fell 4% This Month. Here’s Why That Might Be a Buying Opportunity
feed.summary: Devon Energy (DVN) stock has dropped 4% this month, presenting a potential buying opportunity despite the company's continued profitability. The decline is attributed to overall caution in the energy sector, including concerns about oil price volatility and global economic uncertainty, rather than weakening fundamentals. A valuation model suggests a fair value of $41.84 per share, implying an upside of 21.4% and an annualized return of 10.3% over the next two years, even under conservative assumptions.

feed.title: Patterson-UTI’s Recent Growth: Is It Sustainable?
feed.summary: Patterson-UTI Energy Inc. (PTEN) stock surged after a positive quarterly earnings report, with stable drilling activity and consistent operations boosting investor confidence despite market fluctuations. The company reported $5.37 billion in revenues and maintained an average of 93 active drilling rigs, signaling operational efficiency but also facing profitability challenges with a negative EBIT margin. Analysts are now evaluating whether this steady performance indicates sustainable growth or a potential ceiling given competing narratives around fluctuating margins and market demands.

feed.title: Electric bus maker GreenPower lines up $10M to ramp up zero-emission fleet
feed.summary: GreenPower Motor Company has secured $10 million in financing and $2.95 million in standby letter of credit facilities to support its production of all-electric vehicles. The funding includes credit approvals from CIBC and term loans from two family offices, which will be used to repay an existing operating line and fund general corporate purposes. This recapitalization is expected to help GreenPower accelerate production and fulfill existing customer orders.

feed.title: Constellation Energy Completes Calpine Acquisition, Expands Generation Fleet
feed.summary: Constellation Energy (CEG) has completed its acquisition of Calpine Corporation, making Calpine a wholly-owned subsidiary and forming the nation's largest electricity producer with 55 gigawatts of generation capacity. The cash-and-stock deal involved 50 million newly issued Constellation shares and $4.5 billion in cash, with former Calpine shareholders now owning about 13.8% of Constellation's common stock. This merger aims to serve surging power demand in high-growth markets and leverage an enlarged generation fleet to scale advanced energy technologies.

feed.title: HF Sinclair Corporation’s Lubricants & Specialties Business Closes Previously Announced Acquisition of Industrial Oils Unlimited
feed.summary: HF Sinclair Corporation announced that its Lubricants & Specialties Business has closed the previously announced acquisition of Industrial Oils Unlimited, LLC (IOU). The transaction officially closed on January 8, 2026, following the satisfaction of all closing conditions. This acquisition expands HF Sinclair's lubricants portfolio as IOU is a leader in industrial lubricants and specialty fluids with robust regional manufacturing capabilities in Tulsa, Oklahoma.

feed.title: Murphy Oil Corporation Announces Pricing of $500 Million of 6.500% Senior Notes Due 2034
feed.summary: Murphy Oil Corporation has announced the pricing of $500 million of 6.500% Senior Notes due 2034. The company expects to close the offering on January 26, 2026, and plans to use the net proceeds to redeem its existing 5.875% notes due 2029 and 6.375% notes due 2030, repay outstanding borrowings under its revolving credit facility, cover transaction-related fees, and for general corporate purposes. BofA Securities is acting as the physical book-running manager for the offering.

feed.title: Murphy Oil prices $500M of 6.500% senior notes due 2034 | MUR Stock News
feed.summary: Murphy Oil Corporation has announced the pricing of $500 million in 6.500% Senior Notes due 2034. The company plans to use the proceeds to redeem outstanding 2027 and 2028 notes, repay its revolving credit facility, and for general corporate purposes. The offering is expected to close on January 23, 2026.

feed.title: Constellation Completes Acquisition of Calpine, Creating Leading Power Producer
feed.summary: Constellation has finalized its acquisition of Calpine Corporation, creating a combined power platform with 55 gigawatts of generating capacity. This merger integrates Constellation's nuclear fleet with Calpine's natural gas and geothermal generation, aiming to enhance clean energy offerings and meet rising electricity demand in the U.S. The company will maintain headquarters in Baltimore and Houston, strengthening its presence in key markets like Texas and California.

feed.title: US refiner Marathon Petroleum says it will be bidding for Venezuelan crude oil
feed.summary: US refiner Marathon Petroleum is interested in bidding for Venezuelan crude oil after the US administration prepared to allow imports following the ouster of President Nicholas Maduro. Venezuela and Washington reached a deal to export 30 million to 50 million barrels of crude, and Citgo Petroleum is also seeking to participate. This move is expected to benefit U.S. Gulf Coast refiners who are equipped to process Venezuelan-type crude.

feed.title: Diana Shipping secures new charter for Kamsarmax bulker at increased rate
feed.summary: Diana Shipping has secured a new time charter for its Kamsarmax dry bulk vessel, the Maia, with Paralos Shipping. The new rate of $14,000 per day is an increase from its current $11,600 per day, and this charter is expected to generate approximately $7.45 million in gross revenue. Diana Shipping also noted its current fleet of 36 dry bulk vessels and plans to add two methanol dual-fuel Kamsarmax vessels by 2028.

feed.title: 1 Unpopular Stock That Deserves Some Love and 2 That Underwhelm
feed.summary: This article identifies one unpopular stock, Nelnet (NNI), as a strong buy due to its outstanding revenue growth and shareholder returns, despite a negative implied return. Conversely, it advises against MDU Resources (MDU) and SAIC (SAIC) due to declining sales, low free cash flow, and flat revenue projections, respectively. The piece emphasizes independent analysis beyond typical Wall Street forecasts.

feed.title: 1 Russell 2000 Stock for Long-Term Investors and 2 We Find Risky
feed.summary: This article identifies one Russell 2000 stock, Fluence Energy (FLNC), as a promising long-term investment due to strong demand and profitable growth. Conversely, it advises caution on VSE Corporation (VSEC) and StoneX (SNEX) due to concerns like low margins, cash burn, and high debt, respectively. The piece provides financial insights and reasons for each recommendation.

feed.title: Surf Air Mobility to Attend the 28th Annual Needham Growth Conference
feed.summary: Surf Air Mobility's CEO, Deanna White, will attend and host virtual meetings at the 28th Annual Needham Growth Conference on January 16th. Interested parties can schedule meetings through their Needham representative or via email. Surf Air Mobility is an air mobility platform based in Los Angeles, utilizing its AI-enabled SurfOS software and electrification programs to modernize air operations and support next-generation aircraft.

feed.title: PortMiami, Royal Caribbean break ground for $345m Terminal G
feed.summary: PortMiami and Royal Caribbean have broken ground on the $345 million Terminal G, a single-berth facility designed to accommodate Icon-class ships. The project, a partnership between Miami-Dade County and Royal Caribbean Group, aims for late 2027 completion and will feature advanced technology, sustainable design, and iconic architecture. It is expected to enhance efficiency for passengers and support the local economy.

feed.title: Greenbrier Companies Inc (NYSE:GBX) Reports Strong Q1 2026 Earnings, Beating EPS Estimates by 47%
feed.summary: Greenbrier Companies Inc (NYSE:GBX) reported robust Q1 2026 earnings, significantly exceeding analyst expectations with a non-GAAP EPS of $1.14, a 47% beat over the estimated $0.77. Although revenue decreased by 19.4% year-over-year to $706.1 million, it still surpassed the consensus estimate of $611.3 million. The market reacted positively, showing an upward trend in after-hours trading and over the last month, reflecting investor confidence in the company's profitability and revenue outperformance.

feed.title: Press Release: ClearBridge Energy Midstream Opportunity Fund Inc. Announces Unaudited Balance Sheet Information as of December 31, 2025
feed.summary: ClearBridge Energy Midstream Opportunity Fund Inc. has released its unaudited balance sheet information as of December 31, 2025. Additionally, Unity Software reported its fourth-quarter financial results, with revenue increasing 35% year-over-year to $609 million, significantly beating analyst estimates, despite a quarterly loss of 66 cents per share.

feed.title: Driven Brands (NASDAQ:DRVN) Given "Buy" Rating at BTIG Research
feed.summary: BTIG Research has reiterated a "Buy" rating for Driven Brands (NASDAQ:DRVN) with a target price of $21.00, suggesting a potential 43% upside. The company currently holds a "Moderate Buy" consensus rating from analysts, with a collective price target of $21.22. Driven Brands recently reported its quarterly earnings with $0.30 EPS and $564.12 million in revenue, and institutional investors hold 77.08% of its stock.

feed.title: Analyst reinstates coverage of Cenovus Energy (CVE) with 'buy' rating
feed.summary: This article announces that an analyst has reinstated coverage of Cenovus Energy (CVE) with a 'buy' rating. This indicates a positive outlook on the company's stock by the analyst.

feed.title: Is First Solar (FSLR) Pricing Reflecting Recent Share Pullback And Growth Expectations
feed.summary: This article analyzes First Solar's (FSLR) recent share price performance and valuation using two methods: Discounted Cash Flow (DCF) and Price-to-Earnings (P/E) ratio. Both methods suggest that First Solar is currently undervalued, with the DCF model indicating an 18.9% undervaluation and the P/E ratio trading below its tailored "Fair Ratio" of 38.4x. The analysis encourages investors to consider different narratives and assumptions to form their own valuation conclusions.

feed.title: G.M. Books a $7.1 Billion Loss as It Scales Back E.V. Ambitions
feed.summary: General Motors announced a $7.1 billion loss for the last quarter of 2025, primarily due to scaled-back electric vehicle ambitions. The loss reflects the diminished value of battery and EV factory investments and compensation to suppliers. This shift comes after changes in federal policy under the Trump administration, including the elimination of EV tax credits and loosened environmental standards, which reduced consumer demand for electric vehicles.

feed.title: Clearway Energy Operating LLC, a Subsidiary of Clearway Energy, Inc., Announces Pricing of Upsized Offering of $600 Million of Senior Notes
feed.summary: Clearway Energy Operating LLC, a subsidiary of Clearway Energy, Inc., announced the pricing of an upsized offering of $600 million in 5.750% senior notes due 2034. The company increased the offering size from the initially planned $500 million. Proceeds will be used to finance or refinance indebtedness meeting renewable energy generation and storage criteria, specifically repaying borrowings under its revolving credit facility and for general corporate purposes.

feed.title: (AEP) Movement as an Input in Quant Signal Sets
feed.summary: This article analyzes American Electric Power Company Inc. (NYSE: AEP) using quantitative signals. It identifies a current neutral sentiment with a potential long-term positive bias and details three AI-generated trading strategies: Position Trading, Momentum Breakout, and Risk Hedging. Key findings include an exceptional short setup risk-reward ratio and multi-timeframe signal analysis for near, mid, and long-term outlooks.

feed.title: Alliant Energy appoints former PJM Interconnection CEO to board By Investing.com
feed.summary: Alliant Energy (NASDAQ:LNT) has appointed Manu Asthana, former President and CEO of PJM Interconnection, to its Board of Directors, effective February 23, 2026. Asthana brings nearly three decades of leadership experience in the energy and financial services sectors. This appointment comes as Alliant Energy reported its Q3 2025 earnings falling short of expectations but has seen analysts maintain optimism and raise price targets due to strategic initiatives and successful data center contracts.

feed.title: For Greenbrier, ‘Solid’ First Quarter Results
feed.summary: The Greenbrier Companies reported solid financial results for the first quarter of its 2026 fiscal year, with net earnings of $36 million and EBITDA of nearly $98 million. The company received orders for 3,700 railcar units and delivered 4,400, resulting in a substantial new-railcar backlog. Greenbrier also repurchased shares and approved its 47th consecutive quarterly dividend.

feed.title: Greenbrier's (NYSE:GBX) Q4 CY2025: Strong Sales
feed.summary: Greenbrier (NYSE:GBX) reported Q4 CY2025 revenue of $706.1 million, surpassing analyst estimates by 7.7% despite a 19.4% year-on-year decline. The company's GAAP EPS of $1.14 also beat consensus estimates by 31%, contributing to strong full-year revenue and EPS guidance. While sales declined, the company's operating margin increased over five years, and EPS growth outpaced revenue growth due to improved profitability and share buybacks.

feed.title: Frontline Begins Fleet Renewal Program
feed.summary: Frontline plc has announced a fleet renewal program involving the sale of eight older VLCCs for $831.5 million and the acquisition of nine new generation scrubber-fitted ECO VLCC newbuilding contracts for $1,224.0 million. This strategic move aims to modernize Frontline's fleet with more fuel-efficient vessels and reduce carbon emissions, while increasing its exposure to the VLCC segment. Upon completion, Frontline's fleet will consist of 81 vessels.

feed.title: Nio files for ES9 large electric SUV, launch set for Q2
feed.summary: Nio has filed for the ES9, a new large electric SUV intended to be its flagship model, which is set to launch in the second quarter. The ES9, larger than the current ES8, appeared in China's MIIT regulatory catalog and will feature advanced technologies shared with the ET9, including Nio's latest smart driving chips and SkyRide chassis. Nio's CEO, William Li, expressed confidence that the ES9, designed for business use, will achieve similar success to the ES8.

feed.title: Royal Caribbean Group Breaks Ground on Cruise Terminal G at PortMiami
feed.summary: Royal Caribbean Group has broken ground on its new Cruise Terminal G at PortMiami, a $345 million investment set to accommodate up to 7,000 passengers and Icon-class vessels by late 2027. The state-of-the-art facility will aim for LEED certification and feature a multi-level parking garage and intermodal facility. This development reinforces PortMiami's status as a major cruise hub and provides a dedicated terminal for Royal Caribbean, Celebrity Cruises, and Silversea.

feed.title: Is NextEra Energy (NEE) Fairly Priced After Multi Year Gains And Recent Utility Sector Reassessment
feed.summary: This article analyzes NextEra Energy's (NEE) valuation through two approaches: the Dividend Discount Model (DDM) and Price vs. Earnings (P/E). The DDM suggests NEE is 10.1% overvalued, while the P/E analysis indicates it is undervalued when compared to Simply Wall St's proprietary Fair Ratio. The article notes recent investor reassessments of large US utilities and renewables, impacting the stock's short-term performance versus its long-term gains.

feed.title: Here is Why Cenovus Energy (CVE) Fell This Week
feed.summary: Cenovus Energy Inc. (CVE) saw its share price fall by 6.32% due to concerns over Venezuelan crude entering the U.S. market, potentially impacting Canadian oil producers. Despite this, Goldman Sachs reinstated a 'Buy' rating with a $20 price target, suggesting a significant upside. The article also highlights that a market overreaction may have occurred, as Venezuela's oil infrastructure needs substantial investment and time to recover.

feed.title: Controladora Vuela Compania de Aviacion, S.A.B. de C.V. (NYSE:VLRS) Receives Average Rating of "Moderate Buy" from Brokerages
feed.summary: Controladora Vuela Compania de Aviacion, S.A.B. de C.V. (NYSE:VLRS) has received a consensus "Moderate Buy" rating from analysts, with an average 12-month price target of $8.92. Several firms have recently raised their ratings and price targets for the stock, indicating improved sentiment. The company trades around $9.27 with a market cap of approximately $1.08 billion and recently beat EPS expectations.

feed.title: Devon Energy (DVN) Price Target Lowered to $42, 'Outperform' Rating Maintained
feed.summary: Bernstein lowered its price target for Devon Energy (DVN) to $42 from $48, yet maintained an 'Outperform' rating. This decision comes as DVN's share price recently dropped amid declines in global crude oil prices and increased supply concerns due to potential Venezuelan crude entering the market. Despite the near-term challenges, Bernstein holds a balanced long-term view for crude oil.

feed.title: GM warns of $6B hit to profit on electric vehicle pullback as demand plummets
feed.summary: General Motors announced it will take a $6 billion charge to unwind electric vehicle investments, reflecting a significant pullback in its EV strategy due to the Trump administration's policies and plummeting demand. This move follows a similar, larger charge by Ford, as auto manufacturers adjust to a cooled EV market, with GM reducing planned production and facing costs related to contract cancellations with suppliers. Despite the writedown, GM states it will continue to offer its current US EV lineup, though analysts have lowered sales forecasts for the coming decade.

feed.title: Jefferies Remains Cautious on First Solar (FSLR), Cuts Target to $260
feed.summary: Jefferies downgraded First Solar (FSLR) from 'Buy' to 'Hold' and reduced its price target to $260, expressing caution due to anticipated weak bookings and management's lowered guidance. Despite this, Deutsche Bank raised its price target for FSLR to $300 with a 'Buy' rating. The article suggests that while FSLR has potential, certain AI stocks might offer greater upside and less risk.

feed.title: Deutsche Bank Trims Price Target on Sunrun (RUN)
feed.summary: Deutsche Bank recently lowered its price target for Sunrun (NASDAQ: RUN) from $20 to $19, while maintaining a 'Hold' rating, after the company's stock fell by 5.65% in the first week of January 2026. Despite the trimmed target, Sunrun announced a joint venture with HA Sustainable Infrastructure, involving a $500 million investment to finance 300 MW of solar and energy storage capacity, which provides the company with greater financing flexibility. Sunrun, recognized among the top-performing energy stocks in 2025, aims to leverage this innovative financing structure to unlock additional value for itself and its customers.

feed.title: How Much Is the 2026 Acura ADX?
feed.summary: The 2026 Acura ADX sees minimal changes and a slight price increase of $100 over the 2025 model, starting at $36,450. It introduces a new exterior color, Double Apex Blue Pearl, and continues to offer well-equipped trim levels with a 190-horsepower turbocharged 1.5-liter four-cylinder engine. The ADX aims to compete in the entry-level premium SUV segment.

feed.title: HF Sinclair Corporation Fourth Quarter 2025 Earnings Release and Conference Webcast
feed.summary: HF Sinclair Corporation announced it will release its fourth-quarter 2025 financial results on February 18, 2026, before market open. A webcast conference call is scheduled for the same day at 8:30 a.m. Eastern time to discuss these results. The company, an independent energy producer headquartered in Dallas, Texas, operates refineries and produces various fuels and lubricants.

feed.title: Cessna Citation CJ3 Gen2 Enters Into Service, Delivering the Most Significant Gen2 Updates to Date
feed.summary: The Cessna Citation CJ3 Gen2 has officially entered service, with launch customers Dave Mecartney and Shannon Day taking delivery of the updated aircraft. This new model incorporates significant enhancements driven by customer feedback, including Garmin autothrottle technology, increased pilot legroom, and a fully customizable cabin. Textron Aviation highlights the CJ3 Gen2 as its most comprehensive Gen2 investment to date, offering exceptional range, payload, efficiency, and a strong aftermarket support network.

feed.title: CSX Corp. Stock: Rail Giant Grinds Higher As Wall Street Edges Back To Bullish
feed.summary: CSX Corp. has shown a steady upward trend in its stock price, defying overall market choppiness and mixed freight demand, leading to a cautiously bullish sentiment from Wall Street analysts. The railroad company's solid dividend, disciplined cost controls, and signs of stabilizing intermodal volumes are driving renewed investor interest. Over the past year, CSX has delivered a respectable total return in the mid-to-high teens, outperforming expectations for a traditional transport stock.

feed.title: Greenbrier: Fiscal Q1 Earnings Snapshot
feed.summary: Greenbrier Companies Inc. (GBX) reported earnings of $36.4 million in its fiscal first quarter, amounting to $1.14 per share. The railroad freight car equipment manufacturer posted revenue of $706.1 million for the period and expects full-year revenue between $2.7 billion and $3.2 billion. This financial snapshot was generated using data from Zacks Investment Research.

feed.title: FRO – Strategic Fleet Renewal and Expansion
feed.summary: Frontline plc (FRO) is undertaking a strategic fleet renewal by selling eight older ECO VLCCs for $831.5 million and acquiring nine latest-generation scrubber-fitted ECO VLCC newbuilding contracts for $1,224.0 million. This initiative aims to modernize its fleet with more fuel-efficient vessels, increase its exposure to the VLCC segment, and reduce carbon emissions. The transactions are expected to be completed in stages through 2026 and 2027, financed by cash and long-term debt.

feed.title: Alabama’s new $1B Blue Creek coal mine is bringing 300 jobs to rural towns
feed.summary: Warrior Met Coal has opened its $1 billion Blue Creek Mine in Tuscaloosa County, Alabama, which is expected to create over 300 new jobs and increase the company's annual metallurgical coal production capacity by 75%. The project includes significant infrastructure investments from partners like Norfolk Southern, the Alabama Port Authority, and Parker Towing Company, further boosting the state's economy. The mine will access one of North America's largest untouched metallurgical coal reserves, with an expected operational life of over 40 years.

feed.title: Terrestrial Energy, Oklo execute DOE agreements
feed.summary: Terrestrial Energy Inc and Oklo Inc have signed agreements with the US Department of Energy (DOE) to advance nuclear reactor technologies. Terrestrial Energy will develop a pilot Integral Molten Salt Reactor (IMSR) to support its commercialization, while Oklo Inc, through its subsidiary Atomic Alchemy, will design, construct, and operate a radioisotope pilot plant for medical and research isotope production. Both agreements aim to expedite development and commercialization through the DOE's "Other Transaction Authority" framework, bypassing traditional federal contracting constraints.

feed.title: SkyWest to take investor questions in live call on 2025 results
feed.summary: SkyWest, Inc. (NASDAQ: SKYW) will host a live conference call and webcast on Thursday, January 29, 2026, to discuss its fourth-quarter and full-year 2025 financial results. The event will include an overview of the quarterly results followed by a Q&A session for investors. Interested parties can access the webcast and call details provided in the announcement.

feed.title: Cabot stock price target raised to $81 by Jefferies on PowerCo deal
feed.summary: Jefferies has increased its price target for Cabot Corp. (NYSE:CBT) to $81 from $79, maintaining a Buy rating, following Cabot's multi-year supply agreement with PowerCo for EV battery production. This comes as Cabot expects significant growth in the lithium-ion battery market. Although near-term consumer and automotive markets are weak, Cabot foresees tailwinds from credit easing in 2027-2028.

feed.title: CSX Corp. Stock: Rail Giant Grinds Higher As Wall Street Edges Back To Bullish
feed.summary: CSX Corp. stock has been quietly increasing, despite challenging markets and fluctuating freight demand, due to analyst upgrades, a strong dividend, and cost controls. The rail operator's share price saw a significant rise over the past year, reflecting investor confidence in its resilience amidst economic concerns. Wall Street analysts are becoming more optimistic, with several firms reiterating "Buy" or "Overweight" ratings and suggesting continued upside for the stock.

feed.title: AZZ sets record sales as galvanizing demand surges
feed.summary: AZZ Inc. reported record sales of $426 million in its fiscal third quarter, driven by strong demand for hot-dip galvanizing and coil coating, particularly from infrastructure, energy transition, and data center construction projects. The Metal Coatings segment saw significant sales growth, while the Precoat Metals segment is expected to stabilize due to tariffs redirecting buyers to domestic suppliers and the ramping up of a new facility. The company anticipates continued strong demand from these sectors and is actively pursuing M&A opportunities.

feed.title: Major airline to buy more than 100 Boeing jets in its largest order ever
feed.summary: Alaska Airlines has announced its largest order ever, purchasing 105 new 737-10 aircraft and five new 787 aircraft from Boeing, with options for 35 more 737-10s. This investment aims to support the airline's growth, enabling expansion to more international destinations and ensuring a modern, fuel-efficient fleet. The new 787 widebody aircraft will allow Alaska Airlines to serve at least 12 long-haul international destinations from Seattle by 2030, including new routes to London Heathrow, Rome, and Reykjavik.

feed.title: Largo Inc: Can This Vanadium Stock Turn Technical Stability Into a Real Comeback Story?
feed.summary: Largo Inc's stock is experiencing a period of consolidation, trading near its 52-week low despite its position as a vanadium producer with ambitions in energy storage. The company has seen a decline in share value over the past year, reflecting investor fatigue with vanadium prices and execution risks, yet recent trading suggests selling pressure has eased. Analysts maintain cautious ratings, with future prospects depending on vanadium mining economics and the success of its vanadium redox flow battery technology in grid-scale energy storage.

feed.title: New 260-mile power line links Wyoming and South Dakota to stabilize energy costs
feed.summary: Black Hills Corp. (NYSE: BKH) has completed and energized its 260-mile, $350 million Ready Wyoming electric transmission expansion project, interconnecting its electric systems in South Dakota and Wyoming. The project aims to enhance system resiliency, expand access to power markets, support economic growth, and maintain long-term cost stability for customers. Approximately $300 million of the investment will be recovered through the Wyoming Transmission Rider, with the remaining $50 million expected to be recovered through base rates in the next review.

feed.title: Corteva and BP launch biofuel company, promise crop innovations made for feedstocks
feed.summary: Corteva and BP have partnered to launch a new biofuel company named Lightsource Bio. This venture aims to develop innovative oilseed crops as feedstocks for sustainable aviation fuel (SAF) and renewable diesel, combining Corteva's seed and crop protection expertise with BP's energy market knowledge. The collaboration seeks to create a more efficient and diversified supply chain for the growing biofuel industry.

feed.title: Enterprise Products Partners Raises Quarterly Distribution to $0.55 per Unit From $0.545, Payable Feb. 13 to Holders of Record Jan. 30
feed.summary: Enterprise Products Partners L.P. has announced an increase in its quarterly distribution to $0.55 per unit, up from the previous $0.545. This distribution is scheduled to be paid on February 13 to shareholders who are on record as of January 30. The news was published on January 8, 2026.

feed.title: Vistra to Acquire Cogentrix Energy in $4B Natural Gas Power Deal
feed.summary: Vistra Corp. has announced its agreement to acquire Cogentrix Energy, a portfolio of 10 natural gas-fired power generation facilities, for approximately $4.0 billion. The acquisition, comprising $2.3 billion in cash, $0.9 billion in Vistra common stock, and the assumption of $1.5 billion in debt, will significantly expand Vistra's natural gas footprint across key U.S. power markets. This strategic move aims to strengthen Vistra's position in providing reliable and flexible power generation amidst increasing electricity demand from data centers, electrification, and AI-related infrastructure.

feed.title: Here's Why FTAI Aviation Stock Surged in December (And Why it Could Be Good News for GE Aerospace and GE Vernova)
feed.summary: FTAI Aviation's stock surged 13.6% in December due to the announcement of FTAI Power, a new venture converting CFM56 engines into power turbines for data centers. This move positions FTAI both in competition with and as a validator for GE Aerospace and GE Vernova technologies, leveraging its existing expertise in CFM56 engine services to tap into the growing AI data center power demand. The strategic shift is seen as beneficial for FTAI investors and could indirectly support GE's engine platforms.

feed.title: Key facts: ICE extends trading hours for gas and power contracts; UBS cuts price target
feed.summary: Intercontinental Exchange (ICE) is set to extend daily trading hours for European gas and power contracts to 22 hours, starting February 23, to align with the US Henry Hub market. Concurrently, UBS has adjusted its price target for ICE shares, lowering it from $200.00 to $195.00.

feed.title: Blackstone Launches $1B Aircraft Engine Leasing Venture with Willis Lease Finance
feed.summary: Blackstone has partnered with Willis Lease Finance Corporation (WLFC) to launch a $1 billion aircraft engine leasing venture, leveraging Blackstone Credit and Insurance’s private credit platform. This initiative targets the aircraft engine asset class, providing investors with exposure to real assets. WLFC has already identified a seed portfolio for the partnership, marking a growing trend among alternative asset managers in the aviation sector.

feed.title: Sinolam files lawsuit against energy giant AES
feed.summary: Panamanian company Sinolam has filed a civil lawsuit against AES Corporation and its partners, including InterEnergy Holdings, in a Virginia court. Sinolam alleges a multi-year scheme to illegally exclude it from Panama's LNG-to-power market, involving coercive tactics, misuse of confidential information, and undue influence over government regulators. The lawsuit claims over $4 billion in compensatory damages, stating the alleged actions destroyed Sinolam's projects and led to monopolistic control for AES in the Panamanian energy sector.

feed.title: Alaska Airlines Officially Parts Ways With “Proudly All Boeing” Slogan
feed.summary: Alaska Airlines is retiring its "Proudly All Boeing" slogan as a direct result of its merger with Hawaiian Airlines, which brings Airbus aircraft into its fleet. The integration of Airbus A321 narrowbodies and A330 widebodies will transform Alaska Airlines into a more global carrier, particularly enhancing its international long-haul capabilities. While Boeing 737s and new 787 Dreamliners will remain a core part of its fleet, the Airbus aircraft will be vital for routes to Hawaii and new international destinations, with plans for interior retrofits for the A330s.

feed.title: Chevron competes with rivals for Venezuelan oil sales, sources say
feed.summary: Chevron, Vitol, and other major oil companies are actively competing for Venezuelan crude oil export deals by lobbying U.S. officials for licenses. Chevron, currently the sole foreign company authorized to export Venezuelan oil, seeks to expand its existing license to increase exports from its joint ventures and trade state-run PDVSA's output. These companies are vying for a share in future lucrative Venezuelan oil exports following a recent $2 billion deal to supply Venezuelan oil to the U.S.

feed.title: A Look At SLB (SLB) Valuation After Venezuela Intervention And New Growth Contracts
feed.summary: SLB (NYSE:SLB) is gaining attention due to the U.S. intervention in Venezuela and new growth contracts, with a 90-day share price return of 27.89%. Despite recent momentum, its 3-year return shows a decline, raising questions about whether its current trading price of $42.37 (with a 53.26% intrinsic value gap) represents a mispricing or if future growth is already factored in. The most popular narrative suggests a fair value of $45.31, driven by the ChampionX integration and anticipated synergies.

feed.title: Battery ETF (LIMI) Touches New 52-Week High
feed.summary: The Themes Lithium & Battery Metal Miners ETF (LIMI) has reached a new 52-week high, surging 194.5% from its low. This momentum is attributed to a recent rally in global lithium prices, particularly in the Chinese market, which began in the second half of 2025 and continued into early 2026. The ETF is expected to continue its strong performance, driven by its positive weighted alpha.

feed.title: Form 6-K Central North Airport For: Jan 08
feed.summary: Grupo Aeroportuario del Centro Norte, S.A.B. de C.V. (OMA) has filed a Form 6-K reporting a 6.9% increase in passenger traffic across its 13 airports in December 2025 compared to December 2024. Both domestic and international traffic saw similar growth, and ten new routes began operations during the month. OMA, also known as Central North Airport Group, operates international airports in central and northern Mexico.

feed.title: Cabot Corporation Signs Multi-Year Supply Agreement with PowerCo SE, a Battery Manufacturing Subsidiary of Volkswagen Group
feed.summary: Cabot Corporation has announced a multi-year supply agreement with PowerCo SE, Volkswagen Group's battery manufacturing subsidiary. Under the agreement, Cabot will provide advanced conductive carbons and dispersions to enhance EV battery conductivity and efficiency. This partnership strengthens Cabot's presence in the European EV battery market and supports the global transition to clean energy.

feed.title: Will Hiring Veteran COO Peter Norgeot Reshape Algonquin Power & Utilities' (TSX:AQN) Operational Discipline?
feed.summary: Algonquin Power & Utilities Corp. (TSX:AQN) recently appointed Peter Norgeot as COO to address operational inefficiencies and improve capital deployment within its utility operations. This leadership change is expected to reinforce the company’s commitment to operational excellence and better align earned returns with regulatory allowances. Investors are watching to see if Norgeot's experience can resolve ongoing issues, including SAP-related problems and improve rate case outcomes, which are critical for Algonquin’s shift to a pure-play regulated utility focus.

feed.title: VivoPower appoints Rachel Pether to global advisory council
feed.summary: VivoPower International PLC has appointed Rachel Pether to its Global Advisory Council to strengthen its presence in the Middle East, a key growth region for the company's Sovereign AI digital infrastructure and electric mobility platforms. Pether brings nearly 18 years of experience in the UAE, including a decade at Mubadala, an Abu Dhabi-based sovereign wealth fund. Despite facing financial challenges, VivoPower's stock has surged, and the company is focusing on AI computing infrastructure and has made recent acquisitions and strategic shifts.

feed.title: Werner Rewards Shareholders With New Share Repurchase Authorization
feed.summary: Werner Enterprises, a transportation and logistics company, has announced a new share repurchase authorization of $200 million. This authorization replaces the previous $150 million program and signals the company's commitment to returning value to shareholders and confidence in future cash flow generation.

feed.title: Babcock & Wilcox Shares Rise After Agreement With Siemens Energy to Deliver Power for Applied Digital AI Factory Project
feed.summary: Babcock & Wilcox (BW) shares rose after the company reached an agreement with Siemens Energy. This partnership is for Siemens Energy to provide steam turbine generator sets for Applied Digital's AI Factory project, aiming to deliver over 1.5 gigawatts of power. The news highlights Babcock & Wilcox's involvement in advanced power generation solutions for data centers and AI infrastructure, contributing to its stock performance.

feed.title: Assessing Woodside Energy Group’s Valuation As LNG Deals And Beaumont Project Progress Shape Investor Expectations
feed.summary: Woodside Energy Group (ASX:WDS) is gaining investor attention due to progress on its Beaumont New Ammonia facility and new LNG supply contracts, despite a recent technical downtrend. The stock is currently trading at A$22.95, while a widely followed model suggests it is 16.3% undervalued with a narrative fair value of A$27.42. Analysts have a consensus price target of A$26.999, though there's a range from A$22.76 to A$42.16, indicating differing views on future earnings and growth.

feed.title: Jim Cramer Says Refiners Like Valero as Potential Winners From Venezuelan Oil
feed.summary: Jim Cramer has identified US refiners, especially Valero Energy Corporation (NYSE: VLO), as potential beneficiaries of Venezuelan oil due to their capability to process heavy crude. The article highlights Valero's strong operational performance, cost advantages from U.S. natural gas, and market consolidation as factors contributing to its success. While acknowledging Valero's potential, the piece also suggests that certain AI stocks may offer greater upside and less risk.

feed.title: TVA Spearheads University of Tennessee Nuclear Engineering Endowment
feed.summary: The Tennessee Valley Authority (TVA) has invested $3 million to endow the chair of the University of Tennessee, Knoxville's Department of Nuclear Engineering, aiming to advance academic excellence, workforce development, and faculty recruitment. This endowment will solidify UT's position as a leader in nuclear energy and help meet the growing demands of the nuclear industry in East Tennessee and beyond. The partnership will support the training of future engineers, researchers, and technicians, contributing to the development of new nuclear power initiatives and strengthening the region as a hub for nuclear innovation.

feed.title: NextEra Energy Is Trading Above 200-Day SMA: How to Play the Stock?
feed.summary: NextEra Energy (NEE) is currently trading above its 200-day simple moving average, indicating a bullish trend, and has consistently surpassed earnings expectations. The company benefits from strategic investments in clean energy, an expanding customer base primarily residential, and Florida's strong economic growth, which are tailwinds for its continued performance. With anticipated interest rate cuts, strong dividend growth plans and a Zacks Rank #2 (Buy), NextEra Energy presents a compelling opportunity for long-term investors, despite trading at a premium valuation.

feed.title: TVA invests $3 million in UT Department of Nuclear Engineering
feed.summary: The Tennessee Valley Authority (TVA) has invested a $3 million endowment in the University of Tennessee's Department of Nuclear Engineering. This funding aims to enhance academic excellence, workforce development, and faculty recruitment, crucial for supporting the growing nuclear energy sector in the region. The university plans to use the endowment to hire world-class instructors and bolster its partnership with TVA, especially in developing the workforce needed for new nuclear power plants and advancing reactor technology.

feed.title: Phillips 66 CEO on Fuel Demand, Venezuela, and What 'Landman' Gets Right
feed.summary: Mark Lashier, CEO of Phillips 66, discussed fuel demand, the situation in Venezuela, and aspects of the show 'Landman' during an interview recorded on December 16, 2025. He also touched upon the company's new directors and its engagement with the activist investor Elliott Management. The article provides a summary of his insights on these topics.

feed.title: Duke Energy submits plans for a new nuclear site in North Carolina designed to host small modular reactors
feed.summary: Duke Energy has submitted plans to the U.S. Nuclear Regulatory Commission for a new nuclear facility in North Carolina, intended to host small modular reactors (SMRs). This initiative is part of Duke Energy's goal to achieve net-zero emissions by 2050 and aligns with the US's broader strategy to increase energy production for the AI race, even as it faces some backlash from environmental groups. The company is currently evaluating six different SMR designs before making a final investment decision.

feed.title: Honeywell (HON) Target Trimmed as Mizuho Warns of Uneven Industry Backdrop
feed.summary: Mizuho analyst Brett Linzey decreased his price target for Honeywell International Inc. (NASDAQ:HON) to $240 from $250, maintaining an Outperform rating due to an "uneven terrain ahead" for the industry. Despite this, Honeywell announced a new agreement with Technip Energies to provide integrated LNG pretreatment and liquefaction solutions for Commonwealth LNG's export facility, leveraging its modular technology for faster timelines and improved efficiency. While recognizing Honeywell's potential, the article suggests that some AI stocks may offer higher returns and lower downside risk.

feed.title: CSX Lays Off 166 Managerial Employees
feed.summary: Freight railway CSX has announced the layoff of 166 management employees, approximately 5% of its managerial staff, alongside other cost-cutting measures such as reductions in management benefits and the furloughing of 193 conductors. The company attributes these actions to a "thorough evaluation of current market conditions" and a goal to streamline its management structure. This follows a previous round of layoffs in July 2025 and a CEO change in September, prompted by activist investor pressure regarding the company's financial performance.

feed.title: Oshkosh Corporation Wins 2026 CES Picks Award from TWICE for its Collision Avoidance Mitigation System (CAMS)
feed.summary: Oshkosh Corporation has been honored with a 2026 CES Picks Award from TWICE for its Collision Avoidance Mitigation System (CAMS). This AI-powered technology is designed to prevent collisions for emergency responders working on active roadways by detecting and tracking oncoming traffic and alerting crews to potential risks. CAMS was developed by Oshkosh's Pratt Miller Motorsports business and tested on Pierce fire apparatus, demonstrating a critical advancement in safety for everyday heroes.

feed.title: TotalEnergies Stock: Why This Energy Giant Could Return 50% in the Next 5 Years
feed.summary: TotalEnergies SE (TTE) is projected to offer attractive returns over the next five years, with a potential 50% increase in stock price. This forecast is based on its strategy of integrating oil, gas, and LNG operations while expanding into renewables and power. Valuation models suggest TTE could reach €93 per share by December 2029, driven by disciplined hydrocarbon investment and growth in low-carbon businesses.

feed.title: Diana Shipping secures new charter for Kamsarmax bulker at increased rate
feed.summary: Diana Shipping has signed a new time charter contract with Paralos Shipping for its Kamsarmax dry bulk vessel, the Maia, at an increased gross rate of $14,000 per day. This new charter, commencing on January 13, 2026, is expected to generate approximately $7.45 million in gross revenue. The company also announced plans to expand its fleet with two new methanol dual-fuel Kamsarmax vessels by the first half of 2028.

feed.title: Best Value Stocks to Buy for January 8th
feed.summary: This article highlights two value stocks, Array Technologies, Inc. (ARRY) and KNOT Offshore Partners LP (KNOP), identified by Zacks Investment Research as strong buys for January 8th. Both companies possess a Zacks Rank #1, indicating strong potential, and are noted for their attractive price-to-earnings ratios compared to the S&P 500, alongside favorable Value Scores. The report also mentions an investment opportunity in quantum computing stocks.

feed.title: Pro Pick: Stephanie Link says this oil stock is cheap and poised to benefit from the data center boom
feed.summary: Stephanie Link recommends SLB, the world's largest oilfield services company, as a top stock for 2026. She believes SLB is undervalued and will benefit from increased power demand driven by AI and data center expansion, as well as an improving oil industry outlook. Link highlights SLB's strong fundamentals, including recurring digital solutions revenue, strategic acquisitions, and significant shareholder returns, at an attractive valuation.

feed.title: Stellantis Stock Rises at Close Following New Recommendation
feed.summary: Stellantis shares saw a 1.4% increase, closing at 9.41 euros, after Oxcap Analytics initiated coverage with an "overweight" rating and a 12-euro target price. This positive recommendation follows a 4% rise in the automaker's Q4 2025 US sales, despite the stock still facing underlying bearish momentum and significant year-over-year losses.

feed.title: Otis Selected for Major Escalator Modernisation Across London Underground Network
feed.summary: Otis has been selected by Transport for London (TfL) to modernize 172 escalators across the London Underground network, starting in April 2026. This new contract will bring the total number of Otis-serviced units to over 300, enhancing reliability, safety, energy efficiency, and passenger experience. Otis has a long history with the London Underground, having installed the first passenger escalators in 1911 and currently supporting the Elizabeth line.

feed.title: Why Shares of Bloom Energy Are Rocketing Higher Today
feed.summary: Shares of Bloom Energy (NYSE: BE) surged today after American Electric Power (NASDAQ: AEP) announced a unit's plan to purchase $2.65 billion worth of solid oxide fuel cells. This purchase is a significant step towards developing a fuel cell power facility for data centers, building on a 2024 agreement. The stock's current valuation is high, trading at 125 times forward earnings, yet it remains a leading option for investors interested in the fuel cell and hydrogen industry.

feed.title: A new Royal Caribbean cruise terminal for big ships is coming to PortMiami
feed.summary: Royal Caribbean Group broke ground on a new $345 million Terminal G at PortMiami, set to open in late 2027. This terminal will accommodate mega cruise ships carrying up to 7,000 passengers, like the Icon of the Seas, and will also serve Celebrity Cruises and Silversea Cruises. Miami-Dade County is contributing 46% of the funding, highlighting the region's continued importance as a cruise hub.

feed.title: AEP Locks $2.65Bn Deal for 1GW Bloom Energy Fuel Cells
feed.summary: American Electric Power (AEP) has finalized a significant $2.65 billion agreement to deploy up to 1 gigawatt (GW) of Bloom Energy fuel cells. This deal underscores a major investment in fuel cell technology for large-scale energy generation. The partnership highlights a commitment to advancing clean and distributed energy solutions.

feed.title: Canadian Solar plans $200M convertible notes offering in Canada
feed.summary: Canadian Solar Inc. announced a proposed private offering of $200 million in convertible senior notes due in 2031, with an option for an additional $30 million for initial purchasers. The proceeds are intended for investments in US manufacturing, battery energy storage, solar value-chain activities, working capital, and general corporate purposes. These unsecured notes carry semi-annual interest and can be converted into common shares before their January 15, 2031 maturity.

feed.title: Do Costamare’s Latest Dividends Reveal a Durable Income Strategy or Constrained Flexibility for CMRE?
feed.summary: Costamare Inc. has announced cash dividends for its preferred and common stocks, reinforcing its income-focused strategy. While these dividends support its short-term income narrative based on contracted charter revenues, investors should consider the company's high debt and potential future revenue declines as contracts expire. The article suggests evaluating Costamare's long-term financial health through its comprehensive research report, which highlights both rewards and warning signs.

feed.title: New Jersey Department of the Treasury Purchases Beam Global
feed.summary: The New Jersey Department of the Treasury has purchased multiple Beam Global EV ARC™ off-grid electric vehicle charging systems through a GSA contract. This marks the third state division in New Jersey to deploy these systems, which provide resilient workplace EV charging and energy security without requiring grid connection or construction. Beam Global highlights the ability of these systems to support continuous operations and reduce infrastructure costs for government agencies.

feed.title: Allison Transmission acquires Dana’s off-highway drive and motion systems for US$2.7bn
feed.summary: Allison Transmission has acquired Dana Incorporated's off-highway drive and motion systems business for approximately US$2.7 billion. This acquisition aims to expand Allison Transmission's market reach and product portfolio, strengthening its position in commercial mobility and work solutions. The combined entity will operate under the Allison name, headquartered in Indianapolis, Indiana, with two distinct business units.

feed.title: Miami-Dade, Royal Caribbean break ground on massive new Cruise Terminal G at PortMiami
feed.summary: Miami-Dade County and Royal Caribbean Group have broken ground on the new $345 million Cruise Terminal G at PortMiami, scheduled for completion by the end of 2027. This state-of-the-art, LEED-certified facility will be one of the world's largest by passenger capacity, designed to handle next-generation cruise ships and streamline passenger flow with integrated intermodal transportation. The project reinforces Royal Caribbean's presence and PortMiami's status as a leading cruise hub.

feed.title: Why Joby Aviation Stock Is Rising Today
feed.summary: Joby Aviation (JOBY) stock rose 2% after the company announced plans to acquire a second manufacturing facility in Dayton, Ohio. This expansion aims to double production to four aircraft per month by 2027 and supports the company's long-term growth, aligning with U.S. aviation strategies. Despite strong gross margins, Joby remains unprofitable, and Goldman Sachs has a Sell rating on the stock due to valuation concerns.

feed.title: Inside Joby’s eVTOL pilot training plan: Who can fly and how it will work
feed.summary: Joby Aviation is advancing its commercial readiness by establishing a large-scale pilot training program for its eVTOL aircraft, seen as a critical step toward urban air mobility operations. The company has received its first advanced flight simulator from CAE, with a second full-motion simulator expected soon, aiming to train up to 250 pilots annually. Joby's training plan includes a six-week course for pilots with commercial licenses (helicopter, fixed-wing, or powered-lift), emphasizing solo vertical take-off and landing from the first flight to build critical skills efficiently.

feed.title: Do Costamare’s Latest Dividends Reveal a Durable Income Strategy or Constrained Flexibility for CMRE?
feed.summary: Costamare (CMRE) has declared consistent dividends on its preferred and common stocks, reinforcing its role as an income-focused shipping owner. While these dividends support its short-term income story, investors should consider the company's high debt and projected revenue declines as long-term contracts roll off. The article also highlights differing fair value estimates from the Simply Wall St Community, suggesting varying views on the stock's future sustainability.

feed.title: XCF Global and Impact Jets Sign MOU to Supply Private Jet Market with Sustainable Aviation Fuel
feed.summary: XCF Global has signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MOU) with Impact Jets to accelerate the adoption of Sustainable Aviation Fuel (SAF) within the private jet market. This collaboration aims to expand XCF's reach into the approximately $17 billion U.S. private aviation market by leveraging Impact Jets' network of around 130 operators.
