The initiative will involve Impact Jets launching a "Powered by XCF SAF" program, allowing private jet operators and clients to directly purchase verified and traceable SAF, positioning XCF at the forefront of sustainability in private aviation.

feed.title: Otter Tail Corporation Increases Quarterly Dividend by 10 Percent
feed.summary: Otter Tail Corporation announced that its Board of Directors has increased the quarterly common stock dividend by 10 percent to $0.5775 per share, bringing the annual indicated dividend rate to $2.31 per share. This increase reflects the company's financial strength and commitment to returning shareholder value, marking the 88th consecutive year dividends will be paid. The first quarter dividend is payable on March 10, 2026, to shareholders of record on February 13, 2026.

feed.title: If You Own AES Stock, Take a Look at This Instead
feed.summary: This article compares AES Corp. and Applied Digital as investment opportunities in the energy sector, particularly concerning AI data centers. While AES is a traditional utility company with plans to expand into data center energy, Applied Digital is presented as a more compelling investment due to its ownership of both power infrastructure and AI data centers, leading to significantly higher revenue growth and lucrative deals. The author suggests Applied Digital offers a better way to capitalize on the growth of AI's energy demands.

feed.title: Citigroup Adjusts Old Dominion Freight Line Price Target to $196 From $170, Maintains Buy Rating
feed.summary: Citigroup has increased its price target for Old Dominion Freight Line (ODFL) to $196 from $170, while reiterating a Buy rating on the stock. This adjustment comes amidst other analyst revisions for ODFL, with some maintaining neutral or underperform ratings and differing price targets. Old Dominion Freight Line specializes in less-than-truckload transportation services and other logistics, operating a network of 261 service centers.

feed.title: Firefly debuts in Singapore as Nio's 1st right-hand drive model enters global market
feed.summary: Nio's premium compact EV brand, Firefly, has launched its first right-hand drive model in Singapore, marking its official entry into overseas markets. Singaporean customers can now pre-order the Firefly EV through distributor Wearnes Automotive, with a showroom opening in late January. Nio plans to expand its international presence to 40 countries and regions by year-end, utilizing distributor partnerships for global growth.

feed.title: Exxon Mobil Cuts $8 Million From Texas Plant Explosion Verdict
feed.summary: A Texas appeals court reduced an $8 million portion of a $27 million jury verdict against Exxon Mobil Corp. related to a 2019 ethylene plant explosion near Houston. The court ordered a second trial for negligence claims for two plaintiffs and removed a third plaintiff from the case, as Exxon Mobil seeks to further decrease the verdict.

feed.title: Halliburton Co. stock outperforms competitors on strong trading day
feed.summary: Halliburton Co. (HAL) shares rose 5.89% to $32.17 on Thursday, outperforming the broader market. This gain broke a two-day losing streak for the stock. The S&P 500 Index also saw a slight increase, while the Dow Jones Industrial Average rose more significantly.

feed.title: Natural gas price slips after storage draw; EQT stock dips in early New York trade
feed.summary: Natural gas futures fell after a weekly U.S. storage report revealed a 119 Bcf withdrawal, leaving inventories 1% above the five-year average. This led to a dip in gas-linked stocks like EQT Corp, which fell by 1.1%, and a 2.7% drop in Henry Hub natural gas futures. Traders are now monitoring shifting late-January weather forecasts and the upcoming storage report, while investors await EQT's earnings report on February 18th.

feed.title: Energy giant Enterprise boosts payout and spends $300M on buybacks
feed.summary: Enterprise Products Partners L.P. (EPD) has announced a quarterly cash distribution of $0.55 per unit for Q4 2025, an increase of 2.8% over the previous year. The company also repurchased $50 million of its common units in Q4 2025, totaling $300 million for the year, and will announce its Q4 2025 earnings on February 3, 2026.

feed.title: MISO selects AEP-Berkshire JV to build $1.2B, 765-kV transmission project
feed.summary: The Midcontinent Independent System Operator (MISO) has chosen a joint venture between American Electric Power (AEP) and Berkshire Hathaway Energy (BHE) subsidiaries for a $1.2 billion, 765-kV transmission project in Wisconsin. MISO also selected Viridon Midcontinent for a $350 million, 345-kV project, swayed by the company's strong cost containment commitments despite initial concerns about potential underpricing. These projects are part of MISO's $22 billion Long-Range Transmission Plan Tranche 2.1 portfolio, aimed at building a robust 765-kV transmission backbone across its central and northern regions.

feed.title: Babcock & Wilcox shares jump on Siemens Energy deal tied to AI data center project
feed.summary: Babcock & Wilcox (B&W) announced a deal with Siemens Energy to provide services for a project aimed at supplying power to an artificial intelligence data center. Following the announcement, B&W's shares saw a significant increase. The partnership highlights a growing trend of energy companies supporting the demanding power needs of the expanding AI sector.

feed.title: JB Hunt (JBHT) Earnings Expected to Grow: Should You Buy?
feed.summary: JB Hunt (JBHT) is expected to report a year-over-year increase in earnings despite lower revenues for the quarter ending December 2025. The company's Earnings ESP of +0.77% combined with a Zacks Rank #2 suggests a high probability of an earnings beat in its upcoming report, anticipated on January 15. Investors are advised to consider other factors alongside these indicators for a comprehensive investment decision.

feed.title: Energy Fuels shares gain as Vara Mada feasibility study highlights standout project economics
feed.summary: Energy Fuels Inc. (NYSE American: UUUU) (TSX: EFR) shares increased following the release of a positive feasibility study for its 100%-owned Bahia project in Brazil, known as Vara Mada. The study highlights robust economics for the project, which is set to become one of the lowest-cost and largest rare earth element projects globally. This development positions Energy Fuels to significantly contribute to the Western world's independent supply chain for nuclear energy and technology.

feed.title: Navios Maritime Partners stock hits 52-week high at 56.67 USD
feed.summary: Navios Maritime Partners (NMM) stock reached a 52-week high of $56.67, driven by strong investor confidence and market performance. The company shows attractive valuation metrics with a P/E ratio of 6.28 and a Price/Book ratio of 0.51, along with a robust 84.73% gross profit margin. Recent financial results for Q3 2025 surpassed analyst expectations, and a corporate restructuring included key leadership promotions.

feed.title: Vermilion Energy Inc. (NYSE:VET) Receives Consensus Recommendation of "Hold" from Brokerages
feed.summary: Vermilion Energy Inc. (NYSE:VET) has received a consensus "Hold" recommendation from eight brokerage firms. Despite market analysts suggesting a "Hold" rating, the company recently missed quarterly earnings estimates, reporting ($0.02) EPS against a $0.04 consensus, with negative net margin and return on equity. Vermilion provides a quarterly dividend of $0.13, offering a 6.6% dividend yield.

feed.title: UBER Stock Price, Forecast & Analysis | UBER TECHNOLOGIES INC (NYSE:UBER)
feed.summary: This article provides a detailed analysis of Uber Technologies Inc. (NYSE: UBER) stock, including its current price, key statistics, historical performance, and company profile. It highlights UBER's recent stock movements, its sector and industry classification, and a look at analyst forecasts and ratings. The analysis also covers UBER's fundamental and technical ratings from ChartMill, along with financial highlights and ownership details.

feed.title: DTE Energy donates $15M to non-profits to aid Michigan families with winter heating bills
feed.summary: DTE Energy has announced a $15 million donation to three Michigan non-profits to help residents with winter heating bills. The funds will be distributed equally among The Heat and Warmth Fund, United Way for Southeastern Michigan, and The Salvation Army Great Lakes Division, providing energy assistance to vulnerable populations. This initiative aims to prevent service disruptions and offer long-term affordability resources, though it comes alongside DTE's recent announcement of implementing new processing fees for credit and debit card payments.

feed.title: Is It Worth Investing in First Solar (FSLR) Based on Wall Street's Bullish Views?
feed.summary: This article discusses the utility of Wall Street analyst recommendations for First Solar (FSLR) and compares them to the Zacks Rank. While FSLR has a strong average brokerage recommendation (ABR) of 1.62, the article cautions against relying solely on these ratings due to inherent positive bias. Instead, it advocates for combining ABR with the Zacks Rank, a proprietary tool based on earnings estimate revisions, noting that FSLR currently holds a Zacks Rank #2 (Buy).

feed.title: YPF Shares Slide on Strategic Shift and Downgrade
feed.summary: Shares of Argentine energy firm YPF dropped over 4% after the CEO announced a potential IPO for its "Full" service station division and Zacks Research downgraded the stock to "Strong Sell." The strategic move is intended to fund shale oil projects, but weak recent earnings and a negative net margin contributed to the downgrade. Investors are now focused on the upcoming Q4 2025 earnings report set for March 5, 2026, and the critical support level at the 200-day moving average.

feed.title: Company News for Jan 8, 2026
feed.summary: This article summarizes significant company news for January 8, 2026, highlighting stock movements for Northrop Grumman, Alphabet, Seagate Technology, and Exxon Mobil due to specific events like a presidential statement, investor sentiment towards AI, and oil price changes. It also features a promotional section on quantum computing, identifying it as a potentially revolutionary technology and recommending stocks poised for growth in this sector.

feed.title: Babcock & Wilcox stock soars after Siemens Energy partnership for AI data center
feed.summary: Babcock & Wilcox stock surged by 19.1% after announcing a partnership with Siemens Energy. Siemens Energy will provide steam turbine generator sets for B&W's one-gigawatt power project, specifically for an Applied Digital AI Factory. This collaboration is set to deliver power generation solutions for data centers significantly faster than traditional methods, meeting the growing energy demands of the AI market.

feed.title: Surf Air Mobility to Attend the 28th Annual Needham Growth Conference
feed.summary: Surf Air Mobility Inc. (NYSE: SRFM) announced that its CEO, Deanna White, will attend and host virtual meetings at the 28th Annual Needham Growth Conference on January 16. Interested parties can schedule meetings by contacting their Needham representative or emailing investors@surfair.com. The company, an AI-enabled air mobility platform, is known for its SurfOS software and electrification programs aimed at modernizing air operations.

feed.title: Sunrun and HASI form $500M JV to boost distributed power development
feed.summary: Sunrun (RUN) and Hannon Armstrong Sustainable Infrastructure Capital (HASI) have announced a $500 million joint venture. This partnership aims to accelerate the development of distributed storage and solar projects across the United States. The collaboration combines Sunrun's expertise in residential solar with HASI's sustainable infrastructure investment capabilities.

feed.title: Ford (F) expands 2025 market share to 13.2% on strong hybrid demand, powertrain diversification strategy
feed.summary: Ford is projected to expand its 2025 market share to 13.2%, driven by increasing demand for hybrid vehicles. The company's strategy of diversifying its powertrain offerings is contributing to this growth. This improved market position highlights Ford's adaptation to evolving consumer preferences in the automotive industry.

feed.title: Q3 Earnings Highs And Lows: Saia (NASDAQ:SAIA) Vs The Rest Of The Ground Transportation Stocks
feed.summary: This article analyzes the Q3 performance of ground transportation stocks, highlighting Saia (NASDAQ:SAIA) as a top performer with flat revenue but impressive beats on operating income and EBITDA estimates. It also covers strong results from Hertz (NASDAQ:HTZ) and XPO (NYSE:XPO), while noting weaker performance from Universal Logistics (NASDAQ:ULH) and mixed results from Ryder (NYSE:R). The industry is generally seeing revenue in line with expectations despite economic cycles influencing demand and fuel costs affecting margins.

feed.title: Can Solid Utility Programs and Planning Work Drive Willdan in 2026?
feed.summary: Willdan Group, Inc. (WLDN) is positioned for growth in 2026, driven by its strong utility programs and planning work amidst increasing demand for energy and infrastructure services. The company has demonstrated robust financial performance in 2025, with significant revenue increases, and is expected to benefit from electric load growth fueled by data centers and electrification trends. Despite trading at a higher forward P/E ratio compared to some peers, its earnings per share for 2026 are forecasted to grow by 9.6%.

feed.title: Electric vehicle manufacturer selects New Mexico for new manufacturing facility, US headquarters
feed.summary: GreenPower Motor Company has chosen Santa Teresa, New Mexico, for its new manufacturing facility and U.S. corporate headquarters. This expansion is supported by nearly $15 million in incentives and tax credits from the state and is expected to create over 340 jobs and generate $200 million in economic impact over the next decade. The company will also offer dealer-level pricing on its commercial electric vehicles to the state of New Mexico, reinforcing the state's move towards net zero emissions.

feed.title: FuelCell Energy appoints new executive vice president and counsel
feed.summary: FuelCell Energy announced the termination of its Executive Vice President, General Counsel, and Corporate Secretary, Joshua Dolger, effective January 6, 2026. The company concurrently appointed Amanda J. Schreiber to the same role, effective January 12, 2026, with a base salary of $470,000, equity incentives, and other protections. An analyst rating on FCEL stock is a Hold with an $8.00 price target, while TipRanks' AI Analyst, Spark, rates it as Neutral due to weak financial performance tempered by positive revenue growth and backlog.

feed.title: Can AT&T's 5G Connectivity in Mitsubishi SUV Drive Future Profits?
feed.summary: AT&T has partnered with Mitsubishi Motors North America to integrate 5G connectivity into the upcoming Mitsubishi Outlander SUV, providing high-speed in-car internet and enabling remote software updates. This move positions AT&T to capitalize on the rapidly expanding market for connected and 5G-enabled vehicles, facing competition from Verizon and T-Mobile. Despite the competitive landscape, AT&T's stock has shown positive performance, and analysts foresee potential for future profit growth.

feed.title: Battery ETF (LIMI) Touches New 52-Week High
feed.summary: The Themes Lithium & Battery Metal Miners ETF (LIMI) has reached a new 52-week high, surging 194.5% from its 52-week low. This performance is attributed to a rally in global lithium prices, particularly in the Chinese market, which began in late 2025 and continued into early 2026. The ETF, which invests in companies involved in lithium and battery metals, is expected to continue its strong performance.

feed.title: Trimble and Volatus Aerospace Elevate Precision and Safety in BVLOS Drone Deliveries
feed.summary: Trimble has announced that Volatus Aerospace Inc. has integrated its Trimble PX-1 RTX solution into Volatus's commercial delivery drone service to enhance precision and safety for Beyond Visual Line of Sight (BVLOS) operations. This integration provides centimeter-level positioning and precise heading measurements, which is crucial for Volatus's daily delivery of medical supplies from Edmonton International Airport, where strict guidelines for airspace entry, exit, altitude, and speed must be met. The technology significantly strengthens the safety case for drone operations, enabling greater reliability and scalability in drone-based package delivery.

feed.title: Clearway Energy Operating LLC Plans $500 Million Offering of Senior Notes to Finance Renewable Energy Projects
feed.summary: Clearway Energy Operating LLC, a subsidiary of Clearway Energy, Inc., plans to offer $500 million in senior unsecured notes due in 2034. The proceeds from this offering will be used to finance renewable energy projects, refinance existing debt, and for general corporate purposes. This strategic move aims to strengthen the company's financial position and support its continued growth in the clean energy sector.

feed.title: Elon Musk Teases Extreme Performance Tesla Roadster, Says Safety Is 'Not The Main Goal'
feed.summary: Elon Musk has stated that the upcoming Tesla Roadster will prioritize extreme performance over safety, likening it to Ferrari vehicles. He hinted that the Roadster could be one of the last human-driven cars before self-driving vehicles become widespread and remained cryptic about its rumored hovering capabilities. The Roadster has been a highly anticipated but elusive topic, with past issues like delayed refunds for reservations.

feed.title: Thai Airways chooses AAR's Trax & Aerostrat for digital MRO upgrade
feed.summary: Thai Airways has selected AAR's Trax and Aerostrat solutions to enhance its digital maintenance, repair, and overhaul (MRO) capabilities. This partnership aims to streamline operations and improve efficiency for the airline. The move represents a significant step towards modernizing Thai Airways' MRO processes.

feed.title: CHS sees 6% increase in net income
feed.summary: CHS Inc. reported a 6% year-on-year increase in net income for the first quarter of fiscal year 2026, reaching $260.5 million, primarily driven by strong performance in its Energy segment. The company's revenues were $8.9 billion for the quarter ending Nov. 30, 2025. Despite facing challenges in its Grains unit due to global trade factors and lower margins, CHS achieved growth through refined fuels driven by higher refining margins and record premium diesel sales.

feed.title: TVA Spearheads UT Nuclear Engineering Endowment
feed.summary: The Tennessee Valley Authority has invested $3 million to endow the chair of the University of Tennessee, Knoxville's Department of Nuclear Engineering. This endowment aims to enhance academic excellence, workforce development, and faculty recruitment, solidifying UT's leadership in nuclear energy. The partnership underscores a shared commitment to advancing clean energy solutions and developing a skilled nuclear workforce to support the growing demands of the nuclear sector in East Tennessee and beyond.

feed.title: Clearway Energy plans $500M bond sale to back renewable projects
feed.summary: Clearway Energy Operating LLC (CWEN) announced its intention to offer $500 million in senior notes due 2034. The net proceeds will be used to repay borrowings under its revolving credit facility and for general corporate purposes, including financing or refinancing renewable energy generation and storage assets. These notes, which will be senior unsecured obligations, are being offered to qualified institutional buyers and outside the U.S., and are not registered under the Securities Act.

feed.title: Clearway Energy Operating LLC, a Subsidiary of Clearway Energy, Inc., Announces Proposed Offering of $500 Million of Senior Notes
feed.summary: Clearway Energy Operating LLC, a subsidiary of Clearway Energy, Inc., has announced a proposed offering of $500 million in senior notes due 2034. The net proceeds are intended to finance or refinance indebtedness and acquire renewable energy generation and storage assets, including the repayment of borrowings under its revolving credit facility. The notes will be offered to qualified institutional buyers and persons outside the United States.

feed.title: Safe & Green Holdings to Rebrand as Olenox Industries, Aligning Corporate Identity with Integrated Energy and Infrastructure Strategy
feed.summary: Safe & Green Holdings Corp. announced a comprehensive corporate rebranding, including a name change to Olenox Industries Inc. and an updated trading symbol. This initiative reflects its transformation into an integrated energy and infrastructure solutions platform and will consolidate subsidiaries while elevating core brands like Giant Containers and Machfu Monitoring. The company aims to enhance efficiency, strengthen brand visibility, and pursue an acquire-and-integrate strategy across key industrial sectors.

feed.title: Bloom Energy surges as AEP signs $2.65B fuel cell deal (AEP:NASDAQ)
feed.summary: Bloom Energy (BE) shares surged by 15.7% in pre-market trading after American Electric Power (AEP) announced a $2.65 billion deal. AEP plans to purchase solid oxide fuel cells from Bloom Energy as part of its strategy to develop and build fuel cell infrastructure.

feed.title: Zacks Industry Outlook Highlights Coterra Energy, Antero Resources, APA and W&T Offshore
feed.summary: Zacks Equity Research highlighted Coterra Energy (CTRA), Antero Resources (AR), APA Corp. (APA), and W&T Offshore (WTI) in its latest U.S. Oil & Gas - E&P industry outlook. The industry faces challenges from commodity price volatility and infrastructure constraints but sees structural upside from natural gas demand growth, particularly due to LNG exports and rising power needs. Despite a bearish industry outlook reflected in a low Zacks Industry Rank, these four companies are presented as selective opportunities for investors due to their individual strengths and growth prospects.

feed.title: ED Benefits From Long-Term Capital Spending and Renewable Growth
feed.summary: Consolidated Edison (ED) is expected to benefit from its significant capital investment program, totaling $38 billion through 2029 and $72 billion over the next decade, which aims to strengthen its infrastructure and expand its renewable energy portfolio, including the Brooklyn Clean Energy Hub. Despite these growth factors and a recent 3.7% share price increase, the Zacks Rank #3 (Hold) company faces risks associated with regulator-approved rate plans which may not always cover rising costs. NiSource (NI), Alliant Energy (LNT), and Edison International (EIX) are highlighted as better-ranked stocks in the same industry.

feed.title: Williams Companies, Inc. Prices $2.75 Billion of Senior Notes
feed.summary: Williams Companies, Inc. announced the pricing of a $2.75 billion senior notes offering, including different tranches of notes due in 2033, 2036, and 2056. The proceeds from this offering are intended to repay $1.1 billion of existing 5.400% notes due in 2026. The offering is expected to close on January 8, 2026.

feed.title: The 11% return this week takes Oil States International's (NYSE:OIS) shareholders one-year gains to 45%
feed.summary: Oil States International (NYSE:OIS) shareholders have seen a 45% return over the last year, significantly outperforming the broader market's 17%. The company also saw an 11% return this past week, moving from a loss to a profit in its earnings per share. Despite a positive one-year performance, the stock has experienced a negative return over the past three years.

feed.title: Holland America Line Sees Dramatic Rise in Europe Bookings for 2026
feed.summary: Holland America Line is reporting a significant increase in European cruise bookings for its 2026 season, with overall bookings up by over a third and Northern Europe voyages seeing an almost 50% rise year-over-year. The cruise line attributes this surge to travelers seeking dramatic natural beauty and easily explorable cities, urging early booking due to high demand. The 2026 season will feature immersive itineraries with longer port stays, access to numerous UNESCO World Heritage sites, and regionally inspired culinary experiences, along with broadcasts of all FIFA World Cup 26™ matches on board.

feed.title: Ford Motor stock hits 52-week high at $14.00
feed.summary: Ford Motor Company's stock has reached a new 52-week high of $14.00, reflecting a 51.52% return over the past year. Despite analysts expecting a net income drop this year and the stock trading above its Fair Value according to InvestingPro, investor confidence remains robust due to strategic initiatives and strong demand. The company also recently increased its U.S. market share and saw an upgrade in its stock rating from Piper Sandler, though it also faced a significant vehicle recall and a cancelled battery supply contract.

feed.title: flyExclusive stock soars after becoming authorized Starlink dealer
feed.summary: flyExclusive's stock (FLYX) surged by 110% after the private jet operator announced it has become an authorized dealer and installer for Starlink’s aviation connectivity system. The company plans to integrate Starlink's high-speed internet into its own fleet and offer installation and support to third-party aircraft. This expansion enhances flyExclusive’s Maintenance, Repair, and Operations (MRO) capabilities and aims to provide a world-class connectivity experience for its customers.

feed.title: New Mexico lands EV factory bringing 340+ jobs and electric school buses
feed.summary: GreenPower Motor Company is establishing a new 135,000 sq. ft. North American manufacturing facility and US corporate headquarters in Santa Teresa, New Mexico. This initiative is expected to create over 340 jobs and generate an estimated $200 million in economic impact over the next decade. The company qualified for significant state incentives and plans to leverage the facility's Foreign Trade Zone designation for efficient production and distribution of zero-emission vehicles, including electric school buses for New Mexico schools.

feed.title: Diana Shipping Inc. Secures Time Charter Contract for m/v Maia at $14,000 Per Day
feed.summary: Diana Shipping Inc. has secured a time charter contract for its m/v Maia Kamsarmax vessel with Paralos Shipping Pte. Ltd. The new contract, effective January 13, 2026, sets the gross charter rate at $14,000 per day, a significant increase from its current $11,600 rate. This agreement is projected to generate approximately $7.45 million in gross revenue over the minimum charter period, extending until at least July 5, 2027.

feed.title: RXO Analyst Rating Update: Citigroup Lowers Price Target | RXO S
feed.summary: Citigroup has lowered its price target for RXO (RXO) from $16.00 to $15.00 while maintaining a 'Neutral' rating. This adjustment reflects a 6.25% decrease in the anticipated price level. The article also reviews other recent analyst ratings and provides an overview of RXO Inc.'s business model, Wall Street forecast, and GuruFocus' estimated GF Value.

feed.title: Nuvve Regains Compliance with the Nasdaq Minimum Bid Price Rule and the Minimum Stockholders’ Equity Rule
feed.summary: Nuvve Holding Corp. announced it has regained compliance with Nasdaq's Minimum Bid Price Rule and Minimum Stockholders’ Equity Rule. The company met the bid price requirement by maintaining a $1.00 minimum closing price for 10 consecutive trading days and the stockholders' equity rule through a $5.4 million private placement. Nuvve will, however, be subject to a one-year Mandatory Panel Monitor by Nasdaq.

feed.title: Barclays Remains a Hold on EOG Resources (EOG)
feed.summary: Barclays analyst Betty Jiang maintained a Hold rating on EOG Resources (EOG) with a price target of $136.00. This comes as the company's latest earnings showed a decrease in both revenue and net profit compared to the previous year. Corporate insider sentiment towards the stock is negative, with recent sales of shares by executives.

feed.title: How Investors May Respond To NextEra Energy (NEE) $4 Billion ATM Equity Raise And Reaffirmed Targets
feed.summary: NextEra Energy recently announced a $4 billion at-the-market equity raise, paired with reaffirming long-term targets of at least 8% annual adjusted EPS growth through 2032 and high single- to low double-digit dividend growth through 2028. This move aims to fund large-scale grid and renewables investments while minimizing reliance on debt. The article explores how this equity raise, along with reaffirmed growth targets, might impact the company's investment narrative, especially considering potential dilution and risks associated with interest rates and regulatory outcomes.

feed.title: Nio to expand into Australian and New Zealand markets later this year
feed.summary: Nio plans to expand its electric vehicle sales into Australia and New Zealand later this year, likely in the second half of 2026. The Chinese EV maker will also launch its Firefly-branded vehicles in Thailand in March. These moves are part of Nio's strategy to broaden its international presence, especially in right-hand drive markets, with the Firefly sub-brand leading its global market exploration efforts.

feed.title: Zacks Research Downgrades Pangaea Logistics Solutions (NASDAQ:PANL) to Hold
feed.summary: Zacks Research has downgraded Pangaea Logistics Solutions (NASDAQ:PANL) from a "strong-buy" to a "hold" rating, aligning with the consensus "Hold" rating and an average price target of $9.00. The shipping company recently surpassed earnings estimates, reporting an EPS of $0.17 against a $0.03 consensus and revenue of $168.7 million. Institutional investors hold approximately 60.2% of the company's stock.

feed.title: Golf's PGA TOUR picks Viking as its official cruise line through 2030
feed.summary: Viking (NYSE: VIK) has announced a multi-year marketing partnership with the PGA TOUR, designating it as the Official Cruise Line of the PGA TOUR and PGA TOUR Champions through 2030. This agreement aims to run a brand awareness campaign for Viking across various PGA TOUR platforms. Both organizations emphasize their shared values in offering enriching experiences to their audiences, highlighting Viking's commitment to cultural programming and travel.

feed.title: Delta Air Lines Earnings Are Imminent; These Most Accurate Analysts Revise Forecasts Ahead Of Earnings Call
feed.summary: Delta Air Lines (DAL) is set to release its Q4 earnings on January 13, 2025, with analysts forecasting a rise in EPS and revenue. Ahead of the earnings call, several top analysts from firms like TD Cowen, Goldman Sachs, and B of A Securities have maintained Buy ratings and raised their price targets for DAL. Additionally, Sphere Entertainment recently announced Delta Air Lines as its Official Airline.

feed.title: Stardust Power strengthens Washington engagement as US lithium strategy accelerates
feed.summary: Stardust Power Inc., a US developer of battery-grade lithium carbonate, has engaged 38 North Solutions, a Washington D.C. government relations firm, to enhance its federal policy and funding strategy. This partnership aims to accelerate the development of Stardust Power's Muskogee refinery, which is positioned to become a crucial part of America's lithium supply chain. The collaboration strengthens the company's efforts to secure domestic critical minerals and align with US industrial and energy policy.

feed.title: VivoPower Appoints Rachel Pether, Sovereign Wealth Fund Expert,to Global Advisory Council
feed.summary: VivoPower International PLC has appointed Rachel Pether, a sovereign wealth fund expert, to its Global Advisory Council. This appointment aims to strengthen VivoPower's presence in the Middle East, a key growth region for its Sovereign AI digital infrastructure and electric mobility platforms. Ms. Pether brings extensive experience from 3iQ and Mubadala, and her network is expected to support VivoPower's institutional engagement and capital formation strategies.

feed.title: AAR Corp. (NYSE:AIR) Q2 2026 Earnings Call Transcript
feed.summary: AAR Corp. (NYSE: AIR) reported strong Q2 fiscal year 2026 earnings, exceeding expectations with an EPS of $1.18 against an anticipated $1.02. The company saw significant sales growth of 16%, led by a 29% increase in its parts supply business, and successfully integrated two strategic acquisitions (ADI and HAECO Americas) while announcing a third (ART). Management provided an optimistic outlook for Q3 and the full fiscal year, anticipating continued sales growth and margin expansion, particularly in its high-growth parts distribution and heavy maintenance segments.

feed.title: Equinor ASA (NYSE:EQNR) Given Hold Rating at Jefferies Financial Group
feed.summary: Jefferies Financial Group has reissued a "Hold" rating for Equinor ASA (NYSE:EQNR). The consensus among analysts for Equinor is currently a "Reduce" with a target price of $22.71. Equinor's recent earnings report showed $0.37 EPS, missing estimates, but revenue exceeded expectations at $26.06 billion.

feed.title: Jacobs Appointed Engineering, Procurement and Construction Management Lead for Hut 8 AI Data Center
feed.summary: Jacobs has been selected by Hut 8 to provide Engineering, Procurement and Construction Management (EPCM) services for its River Bend data center in Louisiana. This data center, critical for AI and high-performance computing, involves a 15-year, $7.0 billion lease for 245 megawatts of IT capacity. The first data hall is expected to be completed in Q1 2027, with additional halls throughout 2027.

feed.title: Can Solid Utility Programs and Planning Work Drive Willdan in 2026?
feed.summary: Willdan Group, Inc. (WLDN) leverages its expertise in utility programs and planning to address the growing energy and infrastructure needs of clients. The company has shown strong financial performance with increased contract and net revenues in the first nine months of 2025, driven by stable multi-year contracts and municipal demand. With anticipated electric load growth from data centers and electrification trends, Willdan is strategically positioned for continued expansion in 2026, maintaining a focus on core energy services and a solid pipeline of opportunities.

feed.title: Vistra to acquire Cogentrix Energy for $4B
feed.summary: Vistra Corp is set to acquire Cogentrix Energy, including its 10 natural gas generation facilities totaling approximately 5,500 MW of capacity, for $4.0 billion. This acquisition, comprising cash, Vistra stock, and assumed debt, will expand Vistra's geographic footprint and diversify its generation portfolio to about 50,000 MW across the U.S. The transaction is subject to various regulatory approvals and is expected to close in mid-to-late 2026.

feed.title: Tributary Capital Management LLC Has $29.61 Million Holdings in SM Energy Company $SM
feed.summary: Tributary Capital Management LLC significantly increased its stake in SM Energy Company (NYSE:SM) by 136.8% in Q3, holding 1,185,762 shares valued at approximately $29.61 million. This makes them a 1.03% owner of the energy company. Other institutional investors also modified their holdings, and the article details recent analyst ratings which have a consensus "Hold" rating with an average price target of $35.91 for SM Energy.

feed.title: Crude oil rebounds, but Exxon stock and USO ETF slip in premarket as Venezuela headlines bite
feed.summary: Crude oil prices rebounded, but Exxon Mobil stock and the United States Oil Fund (USO) ETF fell in premarket trading due to news regarding Venezuela and U.S. sanctions. Despite a drop in crude inventories, concerns about increased Venezuelan oil exports and mixed inventory signals (rising gasoline and distillate stocks) weighed on the market. Exxon also warned of a potential $800 million to $1.2 billion reduction in its fourth-quarter upstream earnings from lower crude prices, although refining margins could offer some offset.

feed.title: flyExclusive Named Authorized Starlink Aviation Dealer, Bringing High-Speed In-Flight Connectivity to its Fleet and MRO Clients
feed.summary: flyExclusive, a major private jet operator and certified repair station, has become an authorized dealer and installer for Starlink Aviation, offering high-speed, low-latency in-flight internet. This partnership will enhance connectivity on flyExclusive's fleet, with installations starting in early 2026, and also provide Starlink sales, installation, and support to third-party aircraft owners. The move aims to set a new standard for the onboard experience, offering capabilities like HD video conferencing and large file transfers.

feed.title: Boeing Stock Rises 2.6% in Three Months: Here's How to Play
feed.summary: Boeing's shares have outperformed the Zacks Aerospace-Defense industry over the past three months, rising 2.6% due to robust commercial and defense demand, significant contract wins, and a solid backlog. While strong growth potential exists with recent large orders and the acquisition of Spirit AeroSystems, the company faces challenges like supply-chain disruptions and declining earnings estimates. Investors are advised to wait for a better entry point, despite the stock trading at a discount.

feed.title: Why These Energy Stocks are Losing This Week
feed.summary: This article examines why several energy stocks are performing poorly this week, focusing on Diamondback Energy, Inc. (NASDAQ:FANG). Analysts have trimmed price targets for FANG due to expected near-term choppiness in oil prices, despite maintaining 'Buy' and 'Outperform' ratings. Diamondback Energy is highlighted as a "top oil idea" by Bernstein, citing its low-risk inventory and de-leveraging strategy, though its share price has declined over the past year.

feed.title: Why Scotiabank sees Latin America’s right turn and heavy oil race as a growth opportunity
feed.summary: Scotiabank CEO Scott Thomson links the bank's future growth to a rightward political shift in Latin America, a renewed "Trump doctrine" focusing on the Western Hemisphere, and increased Canadian pipeline development. He suggests these trends, along with growing US influence in Latin America and the potential re-entry of Venezuelan heavy crude, present growth opportunities for the bank. However, one analyst warns that Scotiabank's cautious lending approach in Latin America could hinder its turnaround efforts.

feed.title: Canadian Solar targets South America growth through BESS in its 2026 strategy
feed.summary: Canadian Solar is set to significantly expand its presence in South America by 2026, focusing on battery energy storage systems (BESS) and bolstering its technical and commercial capabilities in key solar markets. The company plans to introduce new high-power solar modules and modular BESS solutions, while integrating AI into inverters to enhance efficiency. This strategy underlines Canadian Solar's commitment to supporting the region's solar and energy storage market evolution.

feed.title: Edison International Stock: Quiet Rally, Firm Dividend And A Market That Keeps Betting On Stability
feed.summary: Edison International's stock has seen a quiet but steady rally, driven by consistent earnings, effective wildfire risk mitigation, and a stable dividend, despite California's regulatory and climate challenges. Wall Street's sentiment has shifted from skepticism to cautious optimism, with the stock trading near its 52-week high. The company's focus on grid modernization and risk management has led to respectable returns for investors.

feed.title: CenterPoint Energy touts significant resiliency improvements in 2025
feed.summary: CenterPoint Energy has significantly improved its grid reliability and resiliency in 2025 through its Greater Houston Resiliency Initiative (GHRI). The company reduced customer outage minutes by over 100 million and made various infrastructure upgrades like installing storm-resilient poles, clearing vegetation, and undergrounding power lines. CenterPoint Energy plans to continue these improvements in 2026 to further strengthen the grid against extreme weather.

feed.title: Soluna and Siemens Solve GPU Power Swings for AI
feed.summary: Soluna Holdings, Inc. and Siemens have signed a Memorandum of Understanding to address GPU-driven power swings in AI workloads powered by renewable energy. They will deploy a 2 MW pilot project at Soluna’s Project Grace site in Texas, integrating Siemens’ electrical infrastructure and controls to manage rapid power demand fluctuations. This collaboration aims to create a repeatable blueprint for behind-the-meter AI deployments at renewable energy sites, optimizing existing clean energy infrastructure to support the growing demands of AI.

feed.title: Why National Energy Services Reunited (NESR) Is Up 6.1% After Winning Multi‑Year Jafurah Fracturing Deal – And What's Next
feed.summary: National Energy Services Reunited (NESR) saw a 6.1% stock increase after securing a multi-year, multi-billion unconventional fracturing contract in Saudi Arabia's Jafurah field. This deal extends its revenue backlog and reinforces its dependence on Saudi-related spending for growth, aiming for a $2 billion revenue run rate by 2026. While the contract supports growth, it also increases NESR's exposure to execution risk and reliance on a few national oil companies.

feed.title: American Electric Power Co Inc Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Acquisition
feed.summary: American Electric Power Co Inc (AEP) has acquired a substantial portion of a 900 MW option for solid oxide fuel cells through a subsidiary deal signed on January 4, 2026, for $2.65 billion. This acquisition includes a 20-year off-take agreement for full output with a high-grade customer, with the facility to be located near Cheyenne, Wyoming. Conditions for the acquisition are expected to be met by Q2 2026.

feed.title: TVA invests $3 million into UT nuclear engineering
feed.summary: The Tennessee Valley Authority (TVA) has invested $3 million into the University of Tennessee’s Department of Nuclear Engineering. This investment aims to bolster UT's role in nuclear energy innovation, support clean energy solutions, and strengthen East Tennessee's position as a nuclear hub. The partnership will help train future engineers and meet the growing workforce demands of the nuclear industry.

feed.title: Intercontinental Exchange to extend trading hours for EU gas and power
feed.summary: Intercontinental Exchange (ICE) announced it will extend daily trading hours for its European gas and power contracts by February 23. This change is to align with the 22-hour trading cycle of the US Henry Hub gas market, as Europe increasingly relies on liquefied natural gas, with the U.S. as a key supplier. The new trading hours for Dutch TTF, British NBP, and German Power contracts will be 01:50-00:00 CET, significantly longer than the current 08:00-18:00 CET.
